loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent. She has owned a mini-market since 1997. She sells daily and dairy products, drinks, breads, sweets, etc. Her mini-market is located in a strategic place where there are lots of customers passing by. She is the main income source of the family. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory. She is confident that the loan will help her improve her work and she feels very positive about her business potential for the coming years.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Guddi's Group

texts.en:
Guddi is married. Her husband sells milk and yogurt. His shop is located in the market and his business is going very well, because he offers his clients good quality products. Guddi stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son, who is 23 years old and in the same business as his father. 

Guddi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to start his own business selling milk and yogurt. With the loan, he will buy milk in large quantity which will help him increase his profits and allow him to do business independently. Guddi is hopeful that the loan investment will be a great step towards the growth of her son’s business. 

Guddi is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Guddi.

loans.use: To buy milk for selling.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Mr.Gantumur is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is an experienced taxi driver who has been running a taxi business using his family car since 2000. His eldest daughter studies at university in the Czech Republic. His son recently completed driving lessons and has obtained a driver's license and recently became a taxi driver also, working for a taxi company. Gantumur’s family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in ger district. Gantumur is planning to replace the fences around his plot of land and needs to buy building materials such as cement, sand, gravel, and concrete blocks. The loan he is taking will be used to buy these building materials.

loans.use: To buy some building materials such as cement, sand, gravel, and concrete blocks to build a fence or wall around his plot of land.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 29 years old and married with three children, aged between 9 months and 6 years. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Ibrahim has owned this business for eight years and sells cigarettes and milk at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase milk and general merchandise goods.  Ibrahim says that the extra income from this loan will help him take care of his family. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to other store owners.

loans.use: To purchase more milk and provisions.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de treinta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee una venta de juguetes, películas y otros artículos; tiene su negocio en un lugar muy concurrido de personas a la orilla de una calle por la zona donde reside. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene productos de buena calidad, a un buen precio Carlos es un hombre emprendedor que siempre busca superarse a través del trabajo arduo que realiza esta dispuesto a superar todos los obstáculos que se le presenten por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como juguetes, películas, entre otros artículos varios, con esto lograra satisfacer la necesidad de la clientela y al mismo tiempo podre darle a su familia una vida plena con una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is thirty-two years old and he lives with his life partner. He has a store from where he sells toys, movies, and other articles. His store is located in a well known location, on the side of the street in the region where he lives. He has earned himself many clients given that he has good quality products and that he gives good prices. Carlos is an enterprising many who is always in search of ways to improve himself through hard work. He is ready to overcome any obstacles that may present themselves. He decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) which will help him purchase more products, such as toys, movies, and other various articles. Through this he will satisfy the needs of his clients and in turn, he will also be able to provide his family with a full life through a stable household economy.

loans.use: to purchase toys, movies, and other various articles.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida lives in a very pretty place, where everyone from the oldest to the youngest speak the "tzotzil" language. She is married to Pedro and the couple have five children who are all now married.

This is the first time that Zenaida has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She hopes to invest her money in buying clothes to sell in her town.  She has been working for two years and tells us that her business is doing well and has made her good income.

It was Zenaida's family who motivated her to start her business as it would enable her to improve her income and support her household.  Although she has the support of her children and her husband, Zenaida would also like to work.

What Zenaida would like is to use this loan to grow her business, buying better-quality clothes, and for her customers to become interested in the merchandise that she sells so that she can improve her profits.

Translated from Spanish:

       La señora Zenaida  vive en una localidad  muy bonita, en donde las personas hablan la lengua tzotzil, desde el más grande y los  pequeños también lo practican, ella es casada, con el señor Pedro y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados.
    
      Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en  fundación realidad y espera invertirlo en compra de ropa para luego venderlo en la misma localidad en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello lleva practicando dos años y comenta que le va bien pues con esto ha tenido unos buenos ingresos.

     Quien lo motivo ha este trabajo fue su familia ya que con ello sería mejor sus ingresos y se poyaría  con lo que le haga falta en su hogar  aun que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo también quiere trabajar.

     Lo que desea es que con el préstamo pueda agrandar su negocio comprando ropas de mejor calidad y su clientes se interesen en su mercancía que ella vende, para que mejor se  sus  ganancias.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 61 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte de triciclo y también tiene su agencia de servicios de viajes. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, el negocio de la agencia lo heredo de su esposo quien falleció y fue con la ayuda de este negocio que invirtió en la compra de triciclos y brindar este servicio que le generara ganancias ella tiene a una persona que trabaja diariamente y le entrega una parte del dinero y la otra parte que le corresponde a Imelda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de un triciclo que se encuentra en buen estado.
texts.en: Imelda, 61, provides transportation services in a three-wheeled vehicle; she also has a travel agency.  She’s had the business for over 5 years.  She inherited the travel agency from her husband when he died and support from this business helped her purchase the three-wheeled vehicles to provide this new service that generates profits for her.  She has an employee that works for her daily and part of what is earned goes to Imelda.  She is asking for the loan to buy a three-wheeled vehicle that’s in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has three children.
 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Clarisse Ursule

texts.fr:
Cliente  de 35 ans, mariée mère de 3 enfants dont  l’âge varie entre 2  et 9ans.Elle Est vendeuse du poisson salé en détails au marché depuis 5ans.
ses ventes journalières sont de 35000f a 50.000frs
Ayant  déjà été  bénéficiaire de 3 prêts à HOPE, elle entre en son 4e cycle avec des nouvelles idées pour accroitre au mieux son commerce.
Avec l’argent elle va achetée : 5 cartons de poissons salés morues,  5cartons de poissons salés soles,  5 cartons de poissons salés thons, 1 sac de  crevettes séchés.
Elle  continue d’épargner pour atteindre  son objectif, avoir deux tables, arriver au groupes solidaire afin d’ouvrir un dépôt de  poissons salés.
Femme au foyer, elle contribue moralement et financièrement a l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children, from 2 to 9 years old. She has been a retailer of salted fish at the market for five years. Her daily sales amount to 35,000 to 50,000 francs. Having already had three HOPE loans, she is starting her fourth loan cycle with new ideas for growing her business. 

With the money, she is going to buy: 5 boxes of salted cod, 5 boxes of salted sole, 5 boxes of salted tuna, and a sack of dried shrimp. She continues to save money to achieve her goal, to acquire two tables, and to join a solidarity group in order to open a warehouse for salted fish. 

As a housewife, she contributes morally and financially her family's growth and development.

loans.use: to buy boxes of salted fish: sole, cod, and tuna; and sacks of dried shrimp

loans.name: Darlin Nohemi

texts.es:
la joven Darlin Nohemí tiene 21 años de edad, cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, calzado y cosméticos, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, con las ganancias que le genera dicha actividad percibe ingresos para cubrir las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, convive en unión libre y es madre de una niña.   
Darlin Nohemí utilizara el credito para comprar vestidos, blusas, jeans, sandalias y zapatos, ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente para realizar las compras para surtir su negocio, se aproxima la temporada de cosecha de granos básicos y esta epoca es muy buena y muchas personas compran ropa para sus hijos, desea estar preparada para las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Darlin Nohemí is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She has a business selling new clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. Her business is located in her home. With the income she generates from her business, Darlin is able to cover her needs and household obligations. She is in a common-law marriage and the mother of one daughter.

Darlin Nohemí will use this loan to buy dresses, blouses, jeans, sandals, and shoes. At the moment, she does not have enough cash to purchase these items to restock her business. The upcoming grain harvest is a good season for her since many people buy clothes for their children. She wants to be prepared in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, jeans, sandals, and shoes for girls.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 44-year-old married man living with his wife and five children. He has been working as a taxi driver for more than 16 years. In 2008, he purchased a car and started to work in it, transporting customers to their desired location. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay university education fees for his son  who is studying electricA. engineering; this will be his first year. Khaled’s only goA. is to allow his son to acquire the needed education then move on and start working in a reputable company to earn good income.

loans.use: to pay his son’s university education fees.

loans.name: Pedro Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Pedro Fernando; el tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, el socio vende ladrillos, cementos, clavos pinturas entre otros materiales de construccion, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cemento, pinturas, clavos y ladrillos al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pedro Fernando, 46, belongs to the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He’s single and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with a business selling building materials and supplies.  He sells bricks, cement, nails and paint among other building supplies.  He works from 8am until 7pm.  He supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand the building supply sales business and is asking for a loan to buy cement, paint, nails and bricks at wholesale.  He is happy with the loan and pledges to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, nails and bricks at wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Fe buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell. Ma. Fe has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia, de 42 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de Félix, su esposo desde hace 22 años. Ambos tiene 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, que son menores de edad y a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ato. Gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia, pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, los que ya mayores siguieron su camino. Ahora sigue trabajando para el futuro de los que quedan, por ello trabaja con ahínco y esmero. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra arveja, maíz y papa en sus propios terrenos, según cuenta, tiene un promedio de 2 parcelas, que en cada cosecha vende al menudeo en el mercado de la ciudad de Pampas, donde trabaja una vez a la semana. Pues en el resto de los días, viaja a la selva, donde tiene plantaciones de plátanos; que cuida su hijo, quien vive ahí. Pero como es una mujer con iniciativa, también cría gallinas, los cuales enseba para después venderlos a un mayor precio, asimismo comenzó con la venta de golosinas en la plaza de su localidad, ya que así obtiene un ingreso adicional para el hogar. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera del apoyo de ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues es una mujer responsable y honrada. Teodocia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próximo sembrío de papa.
texts.en:
42-year-old Teodocia is a tenacious woman.  She lives with Félix, her husband of 22 years.  The couple have seven children but only live with three of them who are still dependent on them.  They care for them in their own home which is located in the small village of Ato.  Thanks to her efforts and perseverance, Teodocia was able to provide for her children and her grown-up children followed in hr footsteps.  She continues working for the future of her children who still remain at home.  For this reason, she works with determination and great care.

Teodocia's business activity is farming.  She grows peas, corn and potatoes on her own plots of land.  She tells us that she has two plots of land and when she harvests her crops she sells them in the market in the town of Pampas where she works once a week.  During the rest of the week, she travels to the rainforest where she has banana plantations which are cared for by her son who lives there.  As Teodocia is a woman with initiative, she also raises hens which she fattens and then sells at a higher price.  She also started selling candies in her town square as this makes her additional income for her household.

This is Teodocia's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments as she is a responsible and honest woman.  With your support, Teodocia will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over her next potato crop.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 62, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Sarah operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Sarah's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sarah dreams of making her store bigger and hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil is a 48-year-old man who sells milk and yoghurt, and also breeds cattle for meat purposes. He has four years of experience in this field. Adil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two sons. He usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them and resells for more profitable price in the local bazaar. Meat and milk products are very popular in Azerbaijan and people use them in everyday cuisine. His monthly income is 200 AZN. Now he would like to increase his profit and purchase more animals. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase one milk cow and two calves. This will be Adil’s third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Madelena

texts.en:
Madelena is a 45-year-old married woman with six children. One of them is in school. 

She has had a business of selling cooking oil in Kator, South Sudan, for seven years.

Madelena requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, su negocio lo inició con la intención de tener una fuente de ingreso para apoyar a su esposo, en los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad tiene clientes que son vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, serían 10 quintales de maíz para poder disponer para tiempo futuro, esta inversión ayudará para mejorar su producción y mantenerse en el negocio.
Su aspiración es convertirse en un futuro con un negocio más grande, con empleados y poder proveer a su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Teresa sells tortillas. She lives with her husband and three children. She started her business with the goal of having a source of income for helping her husband with the household expenses. Currently, her customers are neighbors and friends living nearby. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy corn and firewood. There will be 1000 lb of corn, in order to have it available for the future. This investment will help her improve her production, and keep her business going. 

Her ambition is to someday turn her activity into a larger business, with employees, and to be able to provide her family with all the necessities.

loans.use: To buy 1000 lb of corn, as well as firewood.

loans.name: Philice

texts.en:
Philice has been in active farming for two years and she produces maize, beans and milk. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of two and nine.  Two attend school.

Philice has requested a loan of 41,600 KES, with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says this will improve her farming income and help her uplift her business.  She adds the experience she has in the dairy industry will help ensure that her business runs with minimal costs.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José, vive con tres hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a vender ropa de marca en muchas ciudades, donde es el día de comercio, el negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia, todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en comprar pantalones y camisas al por mayor para hombre y aprovechando la época que es cuando más se vende y de esa forma podrá mejorar en sus ingresos.
El sueño de José es tener un puesto en el mercado,  tener variedad, tener clientes y los ingresos mejoren cada día para que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en: José lives with three children in his own home.  He sells branded clothing in many cities, where day trading is the business he started several years ago on his own initiative, working daily from Monday to Sunday.  The loan will be invested in buying men’s pants and shirts wholesale, taking advantage of the time when they are most sold and able to improve his income. José’s dream is to have a place in the market, have variety, have customers and improved revenue every day so that his family has enough to live.

loans.use: to purchase pants and shirts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de camote y platano al horno,ella vende en froma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el platano y camote al horno.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar platanos y camotes al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues selling roasted sweet potatoes and bananas.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor, from 8.00am to 4.00pm.  Through this business, she provides for her family.  The member's dream is to have a sales location from which to sell her roasted sweet potatoes and bananas.  She is requesting this loan to buy bananas and sweet potatoes wholesale.  

The member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy bananas and sweet potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DRAMANE  est le monsieur qui  tient la corne du bélier sur la photo.
DRAMANE  est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 43 ans, marié et  Père de 04 enfants, âgés de 2   à  25 ans dont 1 est scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Il  fait  l’élevage ovine, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  dans ses mêmes foires.  Il  a une expérience de 07 ans  d’élevage.
 Dans ses ventes, il gagne en moyenne  15000 FCFA de profit par Béliers. Avec le profit,  DRAMANE pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté à certaines difficultés (mort ou perte de béliers) et  a des situations de mévente mais s’est organisé à avoir  des acheteurs potentiels qui lui facilite l’écoulement de ses béliers.  
Dans l’avenir  Dramane  veut  un prêt beaucoup plus  élevé pour augmenter son  activité  d’élevage pour gagner plus de profit afin de s’acheter un tracteur et aussi faire un jardin potager  pour sa  famille.

loans.use: acheter des beliers pour élever puis les revendre aprés

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has owned her  restaurant for two years. It is a great local shop, and Ms. C. is thankful to be managing the operation. Before opening her own business, Lucia worked with her husband, and they ran a successful shop in the middle of Guayquil. When her husband passed away, she lost not only her best friend but her business partner as well. Lucia got a job cleaning clothes with the hope that, one day, she would be able to open her restaurant once again. Through the encouragement of her niece, this hard-working entrepreneur saved enough money from washing clothes to realize her dream. Every day at 5 a.m. Comedor Lucia opens its doors and closes at 9 p.m.

Lucia is applying for this loan so that she can buy chairs and two tables, so that she can acommodate more customers. Also, she will be able to purchase her raw materials more cheaply, and this will allow her to continue offering great meals at low prices. Lucia is a 52 year-old born and raised in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She lives with her mother and her nephew whom she is raising. Her wish is to move the retaurant from the corner of her house to a new location where customers can come from miles around.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lucia is applying for this loan so that she can buy chairs and two tables, so that she can acommodate more customers. Also, she will be able to purchase her raw materials more cheaply, and this will allow her to continue offering great meals at low prices.

loans.name: Enung

texts.en:
Enung is member of MBK who has requested a third loan for US$ 150. She has been running her business for long time. The loan that she requested from MBK will be used to buy the inventory for her store. Her income can reach US$ 18 with a profit of US$ 1.20 per day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by C. Patriawan, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: general store

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
Romelia is 30 years old. She makes corn tostadas to sell in San Cristobal (a 45 minute drive from her home). This work helps to sustain her and her 5 children. Her husband makes broom handles which generates very little income. She plans to invest in firewood, corn and comales to increase her sales volume. Romelia belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

ROMELIA, TIENE 30 AÑOS Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE TOSTADAS DE MAIZ, ELLA VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL ( 45 MINUTOS DEL LUGAR DONDE VIVE ) A VENDER LOS PRODUCTOS, CON ESTO AYUDA AL MANTENIMIENTO DE SUS 5 HIJOS YA QUE SU ESPOSO ELABORA PALOS DE ESCOBA Y ES MUY POCO EL INGRESO QUE PERCIBE. ESPERA INVERTIR EN LEÑA, MAIZ Y COMALES PARA AUMENTAR LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS.ROMELIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

loans.use: COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus is married with four children. The unemployment that exists in the country has had an impact on her husband's attempts to sell his roasted corn. His income is insufficient to support his family's basic needs. This is why Maria has sold beauty products for the last four years. She started her business along with her neighbor, and now, Maria also counts on her children's help.

In order to meet her client's requests and continue to grow her business, Maria asks for a loan of 250 dollars to purchase merchandise. Your contribution can help improve this family's way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, la falta de empleo que hay en el país ha afectado para que su esposo consiga un empleo por lo que se dedica a la venta de elotes, pero con el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, esta es la razón por la que Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace cuatro años, inició el negocio junto con una vecina y ahora también cuenta con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella es muy responsable y cubrirá su deuda en tres meses. Ayuda al crecimiento de este negocio, con tu colaboración puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: I started making zippers six years ago; my complete family helps me in this business except my youngest daughter, whom I have managed to send to school. I wish to send some of my other children to school as well, as it is never too late to study. I require a sum of $325 to help myself increase my income through making more zips. Please lend me the required amount.

loans.use: I want to manufacture more zippers.

loans.name: Ernestina Bertha

texts.es:
Ernestina is a diligent mother who takes her products to the city of La Oroya to sell each week. She spends part of the days that she doesn’t travel to La Oroya taking care of the small store she has in her town. Due to the innumerable tasks she has everyday, she begins working very early in the morning, along with her mother who helps her raise her 8 year-old daughter. Ernestina provides for her daughter without the help of the girl’s father, since he decided to abandon her and leave her without any support.

The fact that she does not have her own shop in La Oroya results in her having to pay very high rent. For this reason she would like to get her own shop so that she can work without worries and begin to save and increase her products. She wants to expand and stock her small space with the best products. In this way, she can fully cover the household expenses and give her daughter a good education. Let’s help Ernestina make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ernestina es una diligente madre de familia que se ocupa de llevar sus productos a la ciudad de La Oroya semanalmente, los cuales son infaltables por su atención y simpatía; así mismo dedica parte de los días que no viaja a esta ciudad a la atención de su pequeña tienda que tiene en su localidad. Por el sinnúmero de ocupaciones que tiene diariamente empieza sus labores muy de mañana junto a su madre con quién vive y la apoya en la educación de su hija de 8 años a la que otorga bienestar sin la ayuda de su padre porque decidió abandonarla dejándola sin ningún amparo. La carencia de un local propio en la ciudad que visita periódicamente para ofrecer sus productos le genera una suma de alquiler muy alta y muchas veces poco rentable.Por este motivo desea adquirir un local propio para trabajar tranquilamente y empezar a ahorrar e incrementar sus productos, ampliar y surtir su pequeño espacio de ventas con los mejores productos, de esta manera podrá contribuir con la plena cobertura de los gastos de su hogar y otorgarle una adecuada educación a su pequeña niña quién es su fuente de motivación. Ayudemos a que doña Ernestina haga sus sueño realidad con vuestra colaboración.

loans.use: To buy a small shop space in the city of La Oroya

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience A. is 40 years old, married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials and cloth. This is a business she started in 1999. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more cloth and tailoring material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring (sewing) materials and cloth

loans.name: Enayatan's Group

texts.en: I have six children: three boys and three girls. I live with my family in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. All of my kids attend school. I enrolled my kids in school because I am not educated, and I do not want the same fate for my kids. My husband makes and sells wooden doors and cupboards. He employs five workers. Last year we took out a loan to buy a saw. This year we would like to buy a wood cutting machine for which we require a loan. My group members are: Haneefan B., Fozia B., Bashiran B., and Zubaida B.. They would use the money to buy cows for their dairy business.

loans.use: Buy a wood cutting machine

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is a single man, who lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1981. He has 4 years of experience in the farming business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings and pesticides to improve his farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in school supplies and other merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working and untiring entrepreneur who strives to provide food and education for nine children. She sells women’s clothing in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur explains that her children’s education is very important for her future, and that she’d do anything to support them so that they can lift themselves up out of poverty.

Carmen is requesting a loan (actually the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to purchase clothing in bulk to continue her business activity and increase her income. The entrepreneur will do her best to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail in her community

loans.name: Tarajio Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Mildred A. is an average 40-year-old Kenyan woman who is married with four children. Also living with her are two orphaned children, left by her late sister.

Mildred started operating her business six years ago because the income of her husband, who is a small-scale farmer, was too little to support all their family's needs. Mildred is now able to purchase at least three bales of secondhand bags every week to sell to her regular customers. With the little profit that she gets from this small-scale business, Mildred is able to feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Mildred hopes to purchase more bales of secondhand bags to enable her to increase her monthly sales. In the future, Mildred would like to open a shop in her hometown, Bungoma, in the Western part of Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase handbags in bulk

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married and she has one son who is currently in school. She has been sewing for school children and adults in her town for 8 years. Prices of materials for sewing school uniforms are currently on the rise and Rebecca therefore wants to use the loan to buy more materials like cotton material, polyester, linen, buttons, etc to increase her stock and also to avoid price hikes. She hopes this loan would help her to start saving to enable her to register to become part of the National Health Insurance Scheme, so that she can also enjoy free medical care with her son. As part of her social responsibility, she is currently training 5 young women to become seamstresses so that they can also earn a living. Rebecca is standing in the middle of the photo. She is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials and accessories

loans.name: Dodjiko

texts.fr:
Born in Amou-oblo on December 31, 1966, Ms. Dodjiko M. is a widow with two children living in Lomé. She is a dressmaker in Agoè, a district in Lomé, where she currently lives. She has always made custom clothing. When her husband passed away and she had to manage the household expenses on her own, she had the idea of making clothes with the traditional fabric that she would buy at the market in Lomé. She sells the clothing at the market or in her workshop where she puts them on display. She is taking out the second loan to buy 20 pieces of fabric because these clothes are very valued and demand for them has increased.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Amou-oblo le 31 décembre 1966, madame M. Dodjiko, veuve avec deux enfants à la charge vit à la Lomé. Elle est couturière à Agoè, un quartier de Lomé où elle vit. Elle a toujours confectionné les vêtements sur commande. Mais à la mort de son mari où elle doit faire face seule aux charges de sa famille, elle a eu l’idée de confectionner des habits avec des tissus pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé. Elle les revend ensuite dans son atelier où elle fait une exposition, et au grand marché. Elle avait pris un premier crédit qui l’a aidé dans son innovation. Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes car ses vêtements sont très appréciés et la demande a augmentée

loans.use: Buy 20 pieces of traditional fabric

loans.name: Ofure

texts.en: Ofure O. is 41 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo state. Nigeria. He learnt this business for seven months and has been into this business since 1998. He needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more oil and lubricant for sales .

loans.use:
To buy more oil and lubricant for sales 

To buy more oil and lubricant for sales

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Mrs. Bo P., 43, grows vegetables to sell and typically earns around US$ 3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Noeurm Ny, 44, is a construction worker. Bo has five children, two of whom are also construction workers whose income helps to support the family. They live in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of increasing family expenses due to transportation and traveling, Bo P. wants to purchase a motorcycle to use to reduce the family's expenses. Hence, she is now requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell and reduce the cost of her husband's and children's traveling to work.

Bo's husband is pictured because Bo was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “Mujeres Unidas” se encuentra en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, todas sus integrantes son vecinas del barrio Ypati de dihca ciudad.

Las integrantes del comité son todas madres y a la vez trabajadoras incansables que se esfuerzan cada dia para acrecentar sus ingresos. En el comité de mujeres tienen la oportunidad acceder a creditos para poder financiar sus emprendimientos, lo que les permite contar con un capital de trabajo para dinamizar sus actividades economicas.

El comité lleva dos años trabajando y en este tiempo ha veneficiado a varias personas, pues en dicho comité pueden acceder facilmente a un credito. Las integrantes llevan entre si una armoniosa relacion y una solidaridad constante, lo que ha permitido que el comité perdure en el tiempo.

Los creditos que solicitan cada una serán destinados para la compra de varios articulos, la mayoria de ellos, materia prima o articulos de mercancia para los emprendimientos de las integrantes del comité. Algunos de estos articulos son: carnes, azucar, arroz, verduras, lacteos,queso, etc; estos estos productos son para aquellas señoras que poseen despensa, kiscos, etc., mientras que las otras personas que se dedican a la venta de dulces, fabricación de productos de limpieza y venta de ropas utilizaron su credito para la compra de articulos para la venta, tales como azucar, productos quimicos para materia prima o introduciendo nuevos productos para la venta, como ropas a la moda, nuevos productos de limpieza, etc. Por ejemplo, la Sra Mirtha Elizabeth Sanchez, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas ha invertido su prestamo íntegramente en la compra de dicha mercaderia aprovechando los buenos precios en un local. Dicha situacion le permite comprar mas barato y acrecentar la variedad y la cantidad de los productos que ofrece y a la vez acrecentar su margen de ganancias.

El detalle de las actividades que realiza cada una se cita a continuación: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. – compra y venta de comidas.

2. Panfila C. de Gimenez – venta de ropas.

3. Ramona C. – Venta de carbón.

4. Demetria C. – Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

5. Petrona C. – Costurera.

6. Rosa Asuncion M. – Copetín.

7. Ceferina M. – Venta de dulces y tortas.

8. Librada C. – Despensa.

9. Antonia Noemi L. – Venta de verduras.

10. Zunilda Ramona H. – Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

11. - Daniela F. – Venta de verduras.

12. Basilia M. Irala – Venta de ropas.

13. Elida B. – Modista.

14. Gloria M. Guanes – Venta de frutas y verduras.

15. Liz Marina R. – Venta de cosmeticos.

16. - Ester A. – Costurera.

17. Gloria Fatima C. – Dspensa.

18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. – Venta de ropas.

19. Ana Maria H. – Venta de helados.

20. Clotilde R. Cabello – venta de juegos de azar y loterias
texts.en:
The “United Women” committee is located in the city of Villa Elisa. All of its members are neighbors in the Ypati neighborhood of that city.

The committee members are all mothers and at the same time untiring workers who work hard to increase their incomes. The women’s committee has the opportunity to access loans to be able to finance their enterprises, which allows them to have working capital to strengthen their economic activities. .

The committee has been working for two years and in this time has veneficiado various people, so in this committee they can easily access a loan. The members have a harmonious relationship among themselves and a constant solidarity, which has allowed the committee to endure with time. .

The loans that each one is requesting will be directed towards the purchase of various items, the majority of them raw materials or merchandise for the committee members’ enterprises. Some of these items are: meat, sugar, rice, vegetables, milk products, cheese, etc. These products are for those women who have grocery stores, kiosks, etc. while the other people who work selling sweets, making cleaning products and in clothing sales used their loan to buy articles to sell such as sugar, chemicals products for raw materials or introducing new products for sale such as fashionable clothing, new cleaning products etc. For example, Mirtha Elizabeth Sanchez, who works selling clothing has invested her loan completely in the purchase of that merchandise taking advantage of the good prices in a store. Such as situation will allow her to buy less expensively and increase the variety and quantity of the products that she offers while also increasing her profit margin.

The detail of the activities that each on carries out is noted in the following: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. Ð purchase and sale of foods. 2. Panfila C. de Gimenez Ð clothing sales. 3. Ramona C. Ð Charcoal sales. 4. Demetria C. Ð Production and sale of detergents. 5. Petrona C. Ð Seamstress. 6. Rosa Asuncion M. Ð Snacks. 7. Ceferina M. Ð Sale of candies and cakes. 8. Librada C. Ð Grocery store 9. Antonia Noemi L. Ð Vegetable sales. 10. Zunilda Ramona H. Ð Production and sale of detergents. 11. - Daniela F. Ð Vegetable sales 12. Basilia M. Irala Ð Clothing sales 13. Elida B. Ð Dressmaker 14. Gloria M. Guanes Ð Sale of fruits and vegetables. 15. Liz Marina R. Ð Cosmetic sales. 16. - Ester A. Ð Seamstress. 17. Gloria Fatima C. Ð Grocery store 18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. Ð Clothing sales. 19. Ana Maria H. Ð Ice cream sales. 20. Clotilde R. Cabello Ð Sale of games and lottery tickets. El detalle de las actividades que realiza cada una se cita a continuación: 1. Elsa Esther A. de R. Ð compra y venta de comidas.

2. Panfila C. de Gimenez Ð venta de ropas.

3. Ramona C. Ð Venta de carbón.

4. Demetria C. Ð Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

5. Petrona C. Ð Costurera.

6. Rosa Asuncion M. Ð Copetín.

7. Ceferina M. Ð Venta de dulces y tortas.

8. Librada C. Ð Despensa.

9. Antonia Noemi L. Ð Venta de verduras.

10. Zunilda Ramona H. Ð Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.

11. - Daniela F. Ð Venta de verduras.

12. Basilia M. Irala Ð Venta de ropas.

13. Elida B. Ð Modista.

14. Gloria M. Guanes Ð Venta de frutas y verduras.

15. Liz Marina R. Ð Venta de cosmeticos.

16. - Ester A. Ð Costurera.

17. Gloria Fatima C. Ð Dspensa.

18. Mirtha Elizabeth Z. Ð Venta de ropas.

19. Ana Maria H. Ð Venta de helados.

20. Clotilde R. Cabello Ð venta de juegos de azar y loterias


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like clothig, charcoal, fruit, vegetables canned goods, rice, sugar, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro inició el negocio porque las necesidades se incrementaron a medida que sus hijos crecían y ella deseaba apoyar a su esposo con un ingreso adicional para poder completar en los gastos de la casa, la familia y con los estudio de sus 4 hijos. Hace cinco años inicio con la venta de blancos y zapatos por catalogo por iniciativa propia vendiendo entre sus amistades y familiares, y en la escuela de sus hijos, lo que le ayudo a generar mas ingresos para su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía de la nueva temporada.
texts.en:
María del Socorro started her business because the needs increased as her children grew and she wanted to support her husband in the costs of the home, the family, and the studies of their 4 children. It has been five years since she started in the sale of bedding and shoes by catalog on her own initiative, selling among her friends and relatives and in her children's school. This has helped her generate more income for her family. She needs a loan of $525 that she will repay in 5 months to buy merchandise for the new season.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en: Abulfat was born in 1951. He is married and has three children. This kind man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Baku city. Five years ago, he started a taxi business. Now, he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is 60 years old, and she is divorced with 2 children. She sells gravel. The demand for her gravel is high and she hopes to meet the needs of her customers. Lillian needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more gravel to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase gravel to sell

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
S. Azamjon has been farming from a young age. He supports four children, two of whom are studying in school.

Sarurov is seeking a loan to invest in crops. He has applied to IMON International to obtain a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy mineral fertilizer in order to prepare his land for upcoming season. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Esperanza Mirtala

texts.en:
Esperanza Mirtala H. lives in the Dolores canton of the Ilopango municipality. Her small business consists of the traveling sale of the typical candies she produces in her home. The candies are traditional and she sells them at a very low price. Esperanza lives with her young son. Up to now his monthly food and housing expenses have not allowed him to receive an adequate education, a fact that fills Esperanza with sadness, but at the same time gives her the courage and impetus to improve her life. Esperanza requests a loan to buy raw materials and expand her business, allowing her to direct her life toward a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

Esperanza Mirtala H. vive en el cantón Dolores en el municipio de Ilopango. Su pequeño negocio, es una venta ambulante de dulces típicos, que ella misma fabrica en su casa, los dulces son tradicionales y los vende a un muy bajo precio. Esperanza vive con un hijo pequeño, aún menor de edad. Hasta el momento sus múltiples gastos mensuales de vivienda y comida, han impedido que su hijo reciba la educación adecuada, hecho que llena a Esperanza tanto de tristeza, como de valor y aliento para superarse. Esperanza solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima, extender su negocio y encaminar su vida a un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her candy business.

loans.name: Mukima

texts.en:
Mukima Y. is 41 years old. She works purchasing and re-selling cows with her husband. She has three children. She would like to request a loan of 850 USD for the term of 9 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. You could become an important part in Mukima family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you give her!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 29 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Maha has been selling canned food for ten years.  She requests a loan of $500 to purchase raw material for food production. This is the first time Maha has requested a loan. 
Maha is special because she produces the food and is known for good quality.  Her clients are friends, neighbors and others.  When she first started her business, she didn't know how to deal with markets and competitive prices.  In the future, Maha plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for food production.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Jr. Elgiba Ramírez S/Nº - Caserío de San Isidro, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que todavía dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia  y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos.
Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertio comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Yolith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Yolith belongs to the "Heart of Jesus" community bank. She lives at Elgiba Ramírez S/Nº- Caserío de San Isidro in the San José de Sisa district of San Martín province. Yolith is 40 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom still depend on her economically. With help from her husband, Yolith invested 300 Soles in her own business. She owns a grocery store, which is located in her home. Her principal clients are her friends and neighbors. With a loan of 800 soles Yolith will invest in more products to supply her store. She'll buy sacs of rice and sugar, toiletries, cleaning products, packets of soft drinks, and various products to keep her clients happy. She'll repay the loan in four months. Yolith makes the decisions on how to spend the income from her business. Personally, she feels more independent, safe, and responsible with her loan repayments. Yolith would like to thank Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, cleaning products, and soft drinks

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Terbish D. lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 23 years old and attends a local university. Her husband is ill and stays at home. Terbish runs a small retail business selling women's apparel. She buys low-cost yet decent women’s clothing in Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and sells them at the stall that she rents in the Narantuul market, the largest open market in Ulaanbaatar. 

For the last two years, she has been traveling to Ereen, China once a month to buy clothes. When she leaves for Ereen, her cousin helps at the stall. In the future, she hopes to have her own shop where she will be able to sell her products, instead of renting a stall. She is applying for this loan to buy more women's clothing in China.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.ru: Калонов Икромиддин проживает  вгороде Турсун-заде. Возраст41 год, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет работает водителем такси. Кроме того он занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Откормив бычка , купленного на кредит он сможет продать по более выгодной цене. Это поможет ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
K. Ikromiddin lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, is married and has four children. He has been working as a taxi driver for 15 years now. In addition, he raises livestock. He has turned to us for a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. After fattening the bull that he purchases on credit he will be able to sell it at a more profitable price. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Parveen Muhammad Younas Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji has been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a delivery man by profession and delivers different items (fruits and vegetables) on his donkey cart. Parveen baji operates a sewing clothes business to pay off the utilities. She is applying a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted, affecting her husband's work. She is joined by three other group members.

Khalida baji wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her motor workshop. Razia baji and Majeedan baji each want a loan to buy timber to sell. Kiran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Zounmenou

texts.fr:
B. Zounmenou  est né vers 1976 à Katagon dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Zounmenou vit dans cette Commune de Akpro Missérété depuis son enfance. Et c’est là que Zounmenou  mène son activité de coiffure. Zounmenou est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. 

Zounmenou veut offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle. Mais, ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent pas d’équiper son salon de coiffure en matériels nécessaires. Alors pour y arriver, Zounmenou  s’adresse à ALIDé. En effet, Zounmenou  sollicite un crédit de ALIDé pour améliorer ses prestations de services et  pour accroître ses revenus dans le but de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
B. Zounmenou was born around 1976 in Katagon in the community of Akpro Missérété, in Ouémé County. He has been living in Akpro Missérété since his childhood, there where he has a barbershop as his business. He is a father of two children who are both in school. Zounmenou wants to offer a better range of services to his customers. But his financial means don't allow him to equip his shop with what is necessary. To do so, he is inquiring with ALIDÉ. Essentially he's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ to improve his range of services and to grow his revenues with the goal of providing for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large mirrors and and an electric clipper

loans.name: J Manuel

texts.es:
El señor J Manuel M. tiene ya mas de un años con su negocio de venta de (nieve y paletas de helo), es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.

El quiere compara mercancía y una amasadora para empezar un nuevo negocio de panadería, en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir.

Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y empezar el negocio de panadería.
texts.en:
Mr. J Manuel M. has been in business for over a year selling snow cones and popsicles in order to support his family.

He wants to buy merchandise and a mixer to start a new bakery business. At the moment, he does not have the money for the initial investment.

For this reason, he is requesting a business loan to start the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a bakery

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is a forty-four-year-old married mother of two, Irene and Mathew. She runs a clothes boutique in the busy market of Kongowea in Mombasa. She has been in the boutique business in Mombasa for three years.

This will be Ruth's first time to borrow from KADET, and with the Kenyan shilling 50,000 loan she plans to purchase women's clothes and to refurbish her business premises in order to attract more clients.

In the future Ruth hopes to establish wholesale stores and to become a major supplier of clothes to retailers in Mombasa.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes and to refurbish her business premises.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the town of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Norma is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture providing transport services to local community members. Norma is just starting this business.

In 2001, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Norma is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to provide a down payment on a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the fourteenth loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use some of the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide a down payment on a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Mayanka Group

texts.en:
This is a photo of Mariatu K. and Adama S. K. of the Mayanka group. Members of the Mayanka group have benefited from previous Kiva loans. With the help of these SMT/Kiva loans, these women have been able to expand their businesses in size and quality, and to make more sales and better profits. As a result, they can better support their school-going children, feed their families and pay their medical bills. However, Mayanka group members still require a new loan of Le 1,900,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Mariatu K. (right) is the leader of the group. Mariatu is approximately fifty years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have three children together. One of Mariatu’s daughters is already married, the others are in secondary and primary schools respectively. Mariatu was born in Magburaka but now lives and trades in Makeni city. Mariatu sells market food – ground-nuts, rice, onions, “margi” (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. at Makeni’s second-largest market. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for over thirty years.  With this loan, she will buy four bags of ground-nuts, three bags of imported rice, two bags of home grown rice, two bags of onions, two bags of salt, and three baskets of pepper.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mrs. Vantha Mak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Vantha M. Village Bank group is made up of eleven people from Smaong Village in Takeo Province. Each person will use their share of this loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Vantha M. is the bank president, selected by the members. She is also a rice soup seller and a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ly Keo, is a farmer and taxi driver. The couple has two children, one of whom attends the local school, and another who is too young to work or study.

Vantha is applying for a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Even though she has only one daughter, Melanie H. still works hard to earn a living because she wants to provide her daughter with financial security. She is a 43-year-old woman, living in the village of Brgy. Canggapas Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Melanie is married to Jose H., a truck driver who delivers sugarcane from the farm to the sugar mill. Driving a truck, in an industry that is known for its seasonality, cannot provide even a small family with a stable source of income. Even less, when the actual amount he receives for his labor is examined.

With no guaranteed income from her husband for part of the year to rely on for their family's needs, Melanie decided to earn her own living to supplement whatever income her husband earns and to provide their family with a more stable financial resource. When she was ready to start her business, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access a collateral-free loan it offers, and used it to set up a general store. 

As her earnings grew, and her customer base expanded, she saw another opportunity for expansion - offering electronic reloading to prepaid mobile phone subscribers, many of whom were already patronizing her general store. With the fast turnover of her business she was able to increase her income. She now earns a monthly average of 7,000 pesos from her general store. Her industriousness has paid off:  she is happy to report that her daughter has graduated from college.

In her previous 16th loan cycle, she was able to borrow 19,000 pesos which was used as additional capital for her business. She paid back all of the weekly installments on time, keeping her good credit rating with NWT-Project Dungganon. She is planning to borrow 19,000 pesos for her 17th loan cycle to support her general store and electronic reloading business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and electronic reloading business

loans.name: Indalecia

texts.es:
Indalecia es una ama de casa de 61 años, vive sólo con su esposo (Leonardo) de 65 años porque todos sus hijos ya formaron sus propias familias. A pesar de su edad esta señora es muy activa y emprendedora. Desde hace medio año se levanta muy temprano para preparar deliciosos jugos y extractos de fruta fresca y clasificada, los que posteriormente reparte a sus habituales clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos.
Para ella es muy importante ofrecer un buen producto a sus clientes a un precio justo, ya que ella es un a mujer honesta y le gusta hacer las cosas siempre correctas. Además, considera que este negocio le genera buenas ganancias porque se esmera en preparar los jugos para que sean lo preferidos de la clientela. 

Indalecia es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta cualidad la heredó a sus hijos. Hace algunos años tuvo una juguería en su casa, pero la tuvo que cerrar por motivos personales, pero sueña con poder reaperturarla algún día, ya que tiene casi todos los implementos, lo único que le falta es capital, pero le sobran ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y asegura que cumplirá con sus pagos y será muy responsable. Entre sus proyectos inmediatos, y para lo que solicita esta cantidad de dinero, es adquirir extractores modernos, además de productos naturales dietéticos para añadirlos en los desayunos que ofrecerá en su juguería. En el futuro para mantenerse sano se deberá consumir en la jugueria de Indalecia, comenta sonriente.
texts.en:
Indalecia is a 61-year-old housewife who lives just with her 65-year-old husband (Leonardo) because all of her children have left home to form their own families. Despite her age, this is a very active and enterprising woman. For the past 6 months she has risen early to prepare delicious fruit juices and fresh fruit extracts which she then distributes among her regular customers who, for the most part, are her neighbors. For her, it is crucial to be able to offer a good product at a fair price since she is an honest woman who likes to do things always in the correct manner. Besides, she believes this is a profitable business because she takes great pains to prepare juices that are her customers' favorites. Indalecia is a very hard working woman and she instilled this value into her children. A few years ago she operated a toy store in her home but had to close due to personal reasons. However, she dreams with being able to reopen it some day since she still owns almost all the equipment; her only lack is capital. But, she has no shortage of will to work and get ahead. This is her first loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be responsible with her repayment. Among her immediate projects, and the reason she needs these funds, is to purchase modern juice extractors as well as natural dietary products to add to her breakfasts which she will offer in her toy store. She smilingly states: in future, to stay healthy, one must eat in Indalecia's toy store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase juicers.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi has been working as a fisherman since 1999. He is a 33 year old single man. He works hard in collaboration with his father to provide better living conditions for his mother and four brothers. Today, Fadi is asking for a loan of $800 to perform maintenance on his boat motor and buy more tools to better satisfy the needs of his business.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his boat motor

loans.name: Massile

texts.fr: Après remboursement d’un premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de WAGES, cette dame veut profiter de la période des fêtes de  fin d’année pour augmenter ses recettes, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour agrandir son stock avec une vingtaine de pagnes, des assiettes et des casseroles.
texts.en:
After repaying an initial loan, which she obtained from WAGES, this lady wants to take advantage of the year-end holiday period to increase her income.  She's therefore requesting a second loan from WAGES to enlarge her inventory with 20 lengths of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and some dishes and pots. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth, dishes, and pots

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia LUCRECIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia se dedica a distribuir condimento molido a las vendedoras minorista del mercado de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender  condimentos molidos como: pimienta, ajo, comino y ají, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucrecia belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 30, married, and has one son and a daughter. She and her children live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She distributes ground condiments to the retail sellers in the Ollantaytambo market. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to buy and sell ground condiments like pepper, garlic, cumin, and chili peppers. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell ground condiments like pepper, garlic, cumin, and chili peppers

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel E. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Russel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal and beauty products in the local community. Russel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Russel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Russel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Russel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Russel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her beauty product offering

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita R., pictured with her two grandkids, is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Carmelita is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Carmelita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Carmelita joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 52 years old. She is a widow and has two children who are currently independent. She is a trader and trades in lingerie. She has basically supported her family through this trade. She started selling more than fifteen years, making her one of the famous sellers in the market. Vida is requesting for loan to buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials to increase her inventory and sales to make more income. She believes this loan would help her save some money and erect a shop where she can sell her stock.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Jodaline (25) y de su pequeña hija Xiomara (3).

Desde que era muy joven empezó a trabajar en diferentes oficios, ya que siempre quería ayudar a sus padres, y cuando formó su familia no dudó en seguir buscando una manera honrada de mantenerla.
