Es así que aprendió a manejar y empezó a trabajar, desde hace 4 años, ofreciendo el servicio de taxi, al principio lo hacia con un auto alquilado, pero hace un año logró comprar su auto propio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es dueño de su tiempo y labora tranquilo, especialmente en “horas punta” (de mayor demanda y tráfico) cuando hay más personas que requieran de sus servicios. William está muy satisfecho porque este trabajo le genera muy buenas ganancias que le permiten brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, y como es un hombre joven, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar otro auto y brindarlo en alquiler para generarse otros ingresos económicos.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para seguir progresando. William tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la revisión técnica (mandato gubernamental) de su vehículo, ya que debe cumplir con lo dispuesto por la ley para seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
William, 27, lives in his own house together with his partner Jodaline (2) and his little daughter Xiomara (3). When William was very young he began working in different jobs, as he always wanted to help his parents. When he started his own family he didn't waste any time in looking for an honourable way to maintain it. In this way William learnt to drive and 4 years ago started work offering a taxi service. At the beginning he used a rented car, but a year ago was able to buy his own car. William likes his job very much, as he is the boss of his time and works peacefully, especially in rush hour (the greatest demand and traffic) when there are more people that require his services. William is very satisfied because his work generates very good earnings that allow him to give his family a good quality of life. As he is a young man with a great desire to move forward, in the future he plans to buy another car and rent it out to generate more earnings. This is the fourth loan he has had with MFP and he is very thankful for all the people that have made it possible for him to obtain the loan to continue his progress. William plans to invest the money he is seeking in a technical revision (government mandated) of his car, which he must comply with as the law stipulates so he can continue working without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Technical assessment of car

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou G. est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’huile d’arachide et de légumes. Avec ce prêt elle souhaite mieux aider sa famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Codou G. is a 41-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children. She is active in selling peanut oil and vegetables. With this loan she would like to be able to help her family more with the daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of peanut oil and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: La señora Rosa Isabel es casada, tiene 40 años de edad y posee dos hijos de 13 y 17 años de edad respectivamente, los cuales aun viven con ella y están estudiando ambos en secundaria. La señora es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, pese a que también en su casa ofrece la mercadería. Ella también elabora comida los fines de semana para vender en su casa, además de esto también realiza destace de cerdos en su casa. Ella inicio con este negocio primeramente trabajando en una zona franca, allí comenzó a venderles a sus compañeras de trabajo las mercaderías de ropa hasta que se dio cuenta que el negocio era rentable y decidió dedicarse solamente a esto. Ella viaja a Managua, a comprar las mercancías para distribuirlas luego. Trabaja por pedidos, es decir que cuando tiene una buena cantidad de pedidos es que viaja a comprar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa nueva, con el objetivo de ofrecer nueva mercancías y capitalizar su negocio. Su sueño, es que a través de las ganancias ofrecidas por el negocio pueda brindarles una educación universitaria a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Isabel, 40, is married and has two children, 13- and 17-years old, both in school and both of whom she supports. Rosa Isabela operates a business selling new clothing. Although she normally works as a street vendor, she also sells merchandise from her house. In addition to her clothing business, she makes prepared meals at weekends that she also sells from her house and raises and slaughters pigs. She started the clothing business while working at a job in a free-trade zone, first selling clothing to co-workers and then going on to selling full-time when she found that it was profitable. She travels to Managua to buy merchandise to sell later. She works to order, that is to say that she makes buying trips to Managua when she has a good number of orders. She will use the loan that she is applying for to buy merchandise that she will resell. Her dream is to generate enough income from the business to put her two children through college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn B. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is a single woman. Marilyn is engaged in agriculture, particularly in planting of corn and rice. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 2,600 PHP. In 2005, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a cow. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Onorina

texts.es:
La Sra. María F.  es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya está casada con el Señor Calixto C.  padres de siete hijos, domiciliados en el Km 4 ½. Ella trabaja en su negocio denominada  Che La Reina, donde tienen una despensa  lo cual le genera importantes ingresos para su familia. El Señor Calixto se dedica a la venta de sombrillas,  el viaje hasta la Ciudad de Salto del Guaira donde tiene una clientela ya formada, se tratan de personas muy trabajadoras que consiguieron un importante crecimiento junto a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias para su negocio así como; arroz, fideos, azucar, panificados, lacteos, enlatados.
texts.en:
Sra. María F. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. She is married to Sr. Calixto C. and they are the parents of seven children. They reside at Km 4½. María manages a grocery store called “Che La Reina”, which generates significant income for her family. Sr. Calixto sells umbrellas and travels to the city of Salto del Guaira where he has an established clientele. They are hardworking people who have achieved significant growth by partnering with Fundación Paraguaya.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, noodles, sugar, baked goods, dairy products, and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Nehemias Isarel

texts.es: El señor Nehemías Israel C. D. León, D. diecinueve años D. edad,  vive con su esposa, tiene dos años trabajando como Albañil, además su esposa se dedica a la amarrada para cortes típicos, para el sostenimiento D. la pareja, el señor por la necesidad D. adquirir herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, por esa razón se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar sus herramientas D. trabajo, la que ayudará a obtener mejores oportunidades y opción D. trabajo, la que ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones D. trabajo y calidad D. vida familiar.
texts.en:
Nehemías Israel C. D. León is 19 years old, and he lives with his wife. He has been working as a bricklayer for two years. Also, his wife works making typical skirts to support the couple. He needs tools to improve his work. That is why he went to the Asociación ASDIR to get a loan in order to be able to buy tools for work. The tools will help him have better opportunities and work options. This will help improve his work conditions and the quality of his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Melagresa

texts.en:
Melagresa T. is from the village of Magsaysay Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Melagresa is single. To make a living, Melagresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of Avon products in the local community. Melagresa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melagresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melagresa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melagresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nazirdjon

texts.en:
Nazirdjon is 35; he lives with his wife and 3 children. For more than 18 years he has been involved in agricultural activities. He hires workers to work the land and finds help from his family with handling the money produced from the sales. 

Lately, Nazirdjon has expanded into raising livestock, which he also sells. He buys young cattle and cows, and when they are grown and heavy, he sells them. The only thing that Nazirdjon is suffering from now is the lack of water and that is the reason that he applied to IMON for purchasing necessary materials to make a borehole. 

This is the first time that Nazirdjon has requested a loan through IMON International; he has good references from his neighbors who consider him a responsible person.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of necessary materials for making a borehole on his land

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 62 años de edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos todos ellos independientes; la socia para mantenerse ocupada trabaja en vendiendo golosinas, ella compra al por mayor de los almacenes diferentes variedades dde golosinas entre galletas, chocolates, dulces y los vende al por menor en la esquina de su casa puso una carreta en la cual ella vende sus golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de golosinas. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department and is a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Dionicia, 62. She is a widow and has 6 children all of whom are independent. In order to stay occupied, Dionicia sells sweets. She buys a variety of sweets at wholesale like: cookies, chocolates and candy. She sells them at retail on the corner where she lives from a cart she set up for this purpose. She is asking for funds to stock her business. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it allows her business to grow and her quality of life to improve. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stock merchandise.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega es un grupo muy alegre y solidario el nombre lo escogieron entre todas las integrantes del grupo por que comenta que en la biblia sagrada habla sobre Alfa y Omega en este grupo son 9 integrantes de las cuales todas estan en la foto la representante del grupo es la señora:Teodora T. H. ella se dedica ala venta de comida economica cuenta con 40 años de edad tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella,vive en union libre comenta que su credito lo utilizara para poder comprar los productos que le hacen falta para negocio como son:M.,quezo entre otros productos mas tambien vende cosmeticos.
Las demás integrantes son:
Juana S. M. vende por catalago,
Avelina M. P. vende comida economica,
Maria G. Esleva vende Chiles y semillas,
Rosalba D. G. venta de ropa,
Lorena L. R. venta de antojitos,
Irma S. C. venta de Tacos,
Veronica G. T. venta de zapatos por catalago,
Olga Lidia V. G. ella teje manteles servilleteros y comenta que ella les enseño a su hijo y a su esposo a tejer; su hijo tambien le gusta tejer cojines,servilleteros entre o tras cosas y su esposo le ayuda cuando ella tiene mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Alfa y Omega” (Alpha and Omega) is a cheerful and close-knit group. The group name was chosen by all the members because of the reference in the Bible to Alpha and Omega. There are nine members in the group and all of them appear in the photograph. Sra. Teodora T. H. is the group representative and has a business selling affordable food. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children who are all independent. Teodora says her loan will be used to buy products that she is lacking in her business such as cornmeal and cheese. The other members are as follows: • Juana S. M. sells cosmetics through catalogs. • Avelina M. P. sells affordable food. • Maria G. Esleva sells chili peppers and seeds. • Rosalba D. G. sells clothing. • Lorena L. R. sells snacks. • Irma S. C. sells tacos. • Veronica G. T. sells shoes through catalogs. • Olga Lidia V. G. weaves tablecloths and napkins. Olga says she taught her son and her husband how to weave. They enjoy making items such as floor pillows, napkins, and other products. Her husband helps whenever there is large workload. Adriana V. M. and Emilia Montiel Murillo were not present to sign the contract, so their loans were canceled.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as cornmeal and cheese

loans.name: God’S Vision Group

texts.en:
Jimmy Y., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Vision. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged between 4 and 12 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. Jimmy cares for two siblings.
For the past ten years, Jimmy has been selling used shoes on Mechlin Street in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used shoes. Jimmy describes himself as a hardworking person. His goal is to expand his business and continue to educate his children so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces maize, beans, tea and milk, which he sells locally. He is also employed as a teacher. His biggest challenges in farming have been diseases and pests that attack his crops and animals, an inadequate market and high competition.

Evans is 30 years old. He is married with three children who are now between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of the children are attending school.

Evans has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and purchase manure for his crops. He says that he will also be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption.

He plans to purchase more agricultural land and a truck to supply his produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.en:
Arzykan A. is  a hardworking 48-year-old woman. She finished secondary school, got married early and gave a birth to her four children.  Arzykan and her husband supported each other in all activities and made their family very united. Unfortunately, in 2009, Arzykan’s husband suffered a stroke and died. It was a hard blow to her, but Arzykan had to get it together and move forward. 

Arzykan started selling vegetables at a local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful, but she handed the business over to her daughter whose own family was in need.

At that point, Arzykan decided to start her own business in cattle-breeding.  Using her initial capital of 15,000 KGS, she bought milch cows and started to sell milk.  Due to strong efforts, Arzykan has developed her farm and today she has two milch cows and 19 sheep.  Arzykan intends to use the loan of 60,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing one milch cow, which will allow her to sell more milk, and one horse.  

In future, Arzykan plans to hold her son’s marriage and prepare a cozy home for his future family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a horse

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of Sigamok. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a food stall, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Liloy-Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria;  La socia tiene 57 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella trabaja atendiendo la tienda y en esta oportunidad la socia requiere el dinero para comprar mercadería (arroz, fideos, harina, leche, azúcar). La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar la tienda. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner." This bank is located in the Calca district in the Urubamba province of the department of Cusco.

Maria is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She has a grocery store that she manages; she works tending to the store.  Maria requests a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise to restock her store.  At this time she needs money to purchase merchandise such as: rice, noodles, flour, milk and sugar.
 
Maria appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and likewise pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (rice, noodles, flour, milk, etc.)  to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Fermín

texts.es:
El señor Fermín  casado con Señora Francisca con 2 hijos. Nacido en Cochabamba y hace 5 años que vive en Santa Cruz en la localidad de Limoncito a 32 Km  de el Torno  se compro  una pequeña parcela donde vive con su esposa y trabaja en la agricultura, su esposa le ayuda en la siembra y la cosecha de sus productos después en la comercialización de los mismos. 
Siembra maíz, arroz, maní y yuca, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas y lo utilizara en los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mr. Fermín is married to Ms. Francisca and they have two children.  He was born in Cochabamba and has lived for 5 years in Santa Cruz, which is in the locality of Limoncito, 32 kilometers from El Torno.  He and his wife bought a small parcel of land and he works in agriculture.  His wife helps him with planting, harvesting, and later selling their products.  They plant corn, rice, groundnuts, and yucca.  He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds and to prepare his land for planting.  He is very grateful to those offering him support through this loan.

loans.use: to clear his land and plant corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier vive en la casa de sus suegros, el Sr. se dedica a la construcción ya como tres años y le va bien  por que es una persona responsable, además  que tiene que mantener a su esposa y a su hijo ya que su hijito es pequeño el cliente solicito el préstamo para la construcción de un cuartito, su suegro le dio una parte para que el se haga construir y viva mejor con su familia ya que desea el bienestar de su hija y de su nieto, por esta razón el Suegro apoya al Sr Javier.
texts.en: Javier lives in the house of his in-laws. For three years he has made a living in construction, and he enjoys the work and is a responsible person. Because he has to support his wife and their small child, the client is asking for the loan to be used for the construction of a little room. His father-in-law gave him a part [of the money] so that he could construct the room and live better with his family. His father-in-law is helping Javier because he wishes for the well being of his daughter and his grandson.

loans.use: Housing construction

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 50 years old. Elena is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and fruits for sale. Elena works hard to improve her farm. 

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita C. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) buying and selling both food and daily use products like junk foods, seasonings and spices in her community. She is 50 years old, widowed and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Tubod, Mahinog, Camiguin province. Esterlita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and instant noodles. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods and instant noodles

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina González Hernández desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada pues ese es su único ingreso para poder sostener los gastos de la casa. La señora nos solicita un préstamo para comprar mercancía de temporada para que sus ventas se incrementen y así generar más ganancias.
texts.en: Georgina González Hernández has been selling used clothes for 3 years. This is her only source of income to cover her household's expenses. She seeks this loan so that she can purchase seasonal merchandise to grow her sales and generate additional earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria R. R., tiene 21 años, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa y carro.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Luz Maria R. R. is 21 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. She has one child.

The members of V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the community of San Temistocles, belonging to Cantón Ventanas, this little area is dedicated to short-cycle farming work sowing maize and rice.

Luz is dedicated to farming maize and rice. She buys and sells products in Ventanas in commercial Peña and sells from her house or in the market every day.

She is requesting a loan to plant maize. She will buy inputs and seeds. With the support of the loan, she would be helped economically by supplying her necessities. She faces challenges like pests, illness and weather changes. Her dream is to have a house and a car. She likes to cook.

loans.use: Purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est constitué de 3 femmes mariées et d’une célibataire. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été payés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tubercules à travers MAMINATA TRAORE, la présidente du groupe.
MAMINATA TRAORE  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 600 kg de tubercules Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, souvent à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Djiguiya Group is composed of three married women and one single woman, who on average are 26 years old and have three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their fifth group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. The women in this group sell tubers. Mrs Maminata Traoré chairs the group.

Mrs Maminata Traoré intends to use her loan to buy 600 kilograms of tubers from wholesalers at the great market in Sikasso. She will retail her goods, often on credit or for cash, at the market in Sanoubougou and from her home to a clientele made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 80,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to provide for her family and repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers

loans.name: The Nusrat Tariq Waheed Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 45 years old. She is married to T. W., who runs a jewelry selling business in the market. The couple has two daughters and both are enrolled in the local school to get an education. The eldest is 17 years old. Nusrat lives in Sahiwal, which is famous for its cows and agriculture industry. For the past 20 years, she has lived there in a two-room brick house with her family. Nusrat is a housewife and she prefers to stay at home and complete her household responsibilities. She is a very active lady and performs her duties very well. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband’s jewelry business. With the loan, her husband will buy jewelry, such as rings, earrings, necklaces and bangles, in larger quantities to increase his business variety and boost sales. Nusrat’s husband started this business six years ago and Nusrat is hopeful that a loan investment will increase profits so she will be able to start saving money for her elder daughter’s marriage. 

In the photo, Nusrat is holding the blue Asasah Passbook. She is a new loan applicant with Asasah and is hopeful that this loan will increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en: Mesrop Mrtirosyan is from the village of Tufashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is happily married with two sons (fifteen and twenty years old).  He has been working on the family farm for the past fifteen years.  He is proud of his high school education and considers himself a hard-working person.  He would like to continue supporting his twenty year old son’s university studies.  With a loan to purchase livestock and renovate his barn he is planning to earn additional funds for the family.  In addition to supporting his family Mesrop also provided his relatives with agricultural produce from the farm.  He enjoys his life in Tufashen surrounded by good neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds and livestock

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a 30-year-old lady. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he has a construction supplies business. He sells supplies to different construction companies and to regular customers who comes to buy supplies from him. He is very good at his business dealings and receives a good number of orders every month.  

Sakina shares the financial burden with her husband by selling clothes. She buys clothes from city of Lahore, travelling there twice a month, and sells to her local area customers for a profit. She has four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works with his father in his construction supplies business while the others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest son who is only 4 years old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement and sand, etc. that will help him to fill larger orders on time and to earn better profits. Sakina is very confident that her husband’s five years of experience in his business will help him earn better profits after the investment and he will be able to provide better living facilities to his family. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She belongs to Kasur which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She lives there with her family in a small home which contains two rooms.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 23 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Cecilia de 24 años y su querido hijo Paúl de 1 año, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Raúl, son el principal sustento que tiene, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar papa, arveja y flor de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar a sus plantaciones, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Raúl is 23 years old and a very friendly and hard-working young man. He lives in his parents' home along with his wife Cecilia, 24, and their son 1-year-old son Paúl, for whom they want to provide a better future. Their main source of income are the fields of crops that Raúl obtained with a lot of hard work. His products are in very high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma, since his crops of potatoes, peas and flowers have gained fame for their high quality, which helps him sell them at very good prices. What Raúl likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests that can harm them. He has three years' experience in this activity, and the thing he considers most difficult is transporting the sacks of potatoes and peas because they are very heavy and tiresome to carry. In the future, he wants to purchase more land so he can expand his production. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that the loan will be very beneficial in developing his business. He is a very happy member of his community bank, and he always keeps order at the meetings. With the loan of 500 soles he is requesting, Raúl plans to purchase fertilizer to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44, married, and the father of two children Jad (6) and Nadine (3). Ahmad has been working in transportation since 2003; he uses his pickup to transport sand, stones and iron pillars to builders. He also uses it for many other things that need to be transported.

Ahmad wants to improve his business and his pickup is becoming small for the size of the work he's doing. That's why he's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the sixth time. Through this loan, he can buy a new, wider pickup. 
Ahmad's repayment history is very good, he's a man with a good reputation in his area.

He hopes to give his children the healthiest and securest lives possible.

loans.use: to buy a new pickup to improve his business

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: As everyone knows, fish is a vital fresh food for everybody, in particular families who depend on catching and selling fish from Tunle Sap River, which is the best place for fish sheltering. Svay P., one of these people, currently depends on selling fish at the busy local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Svay P. is a mother blessed with three school-aged children. Svay P. has requested a loan to purchase a second motorcycle for picking up her fish to sell because her old motorcycle has broken down. With the rest of her loan, she will plant potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle for picking up fish to sell.

loans.name: Souklema

texts.fr: Mariée à un adjudant (militaire), elle est mère de trois enfants et a 29 ans. Elle s’approvisionne d’ignames et  de céréales au marché d’Anié une ville située l’intérieur a quelques kilomètres de la ville de Lomé et revend  chez elle à domicile. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis  2001.ce prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter son actif et satisfaire  les demandes de ses clientes.
texts.en: Married to a military adjutant, she is the mother of three children and is herself 29 years old. She buys her cocoyams and cereals in the market of Anié, a town located up-country, some kilometers from the city of Lomé, and resells them out of her home. She started this business in 2001. This loan will allow her to grow her stock in trade and  satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy yams and cereals.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is married with two sons. Her elder son works in a factory and her youngest son is 16 years old and stays at home. Ameeran couldn’t afford his education due to financial constraints. Her husband operates a lathe machine and repairs tools and iron items. He is expert in his work and earns a good profit every month from his work. Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another lathe machine, which will help him expand his business by involving his younger son in his business. Ameeran is hopeful that a loan will help her husband make more income and improve the living standard of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran.

loans.use: To buy another lathe machine

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is married with five children.  She is thirty six years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Ivy has a bamboo furniture business.  She has had this business for eight years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000.00. Ivy has been a member of GDMPC for three years.  In the future, Ivy hopes to expand her furniture business to provide for her family needs .

loans.use: to buy bamboo for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Odette Heureuse

texts.fr: Née le 24 Juillet 1983 dans une ville du Bénin, Odette Heureuse est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Modeste. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Odette Heureuse et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour assurer les différents besoins de sa famille, Odette Heureuse  mène comme activité la vente de produits de brasserie dans sa boutique située dans une ville du Bénin. Odette Heureuse  s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de boissons. C’est la première fois que Odette Heureuse sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Odette Heureuse was born on 24th July 1983 in a town in Benin and is married to a mechanic by the name of Modeste. The couple has three children in its care, of which two are their own children. All the children are at school. Odette Heureuse and her husband live with their children and together cover the various family expenses. In order to provide for the family's needs, Odette Heureuse has a business selling brasserie products in her shop, which lies in a town in Benin. She gets her supplies from a drinks warehouse. It is the first time that Odette Heureuse has requested a loan from Alidé, in order to increase her business volume, customer base and income.

loans.use: to buy bottled and canned drinks

loans.name: Keang

texts.en: Keang, 57 years old, is a fish seller. She is a single mother with three children: one is a student, one is worK. in a factory and one more is helping her sell fish at the market. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to get more income with her career so that she can save money to repair her house and send her youngest child to university.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona del plan 3000 en la casa de su hermana, tiene un hijo de 1 año, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería. Ella tienen una venta de abarrote en su propio domicilio. El crédito que están solicitando es para comprar fideos, harina, verduras, carne, frutas, hortalizas, sodas, bebidas  para surtir más su venta ya que por donde viven hay un mercado nuevo y quieren tener más mercadería para la venta para tener una mejor atención a sus clientes. La Sra. Silvia es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposo tienen el deseo de superación para brindarle un futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives at her sister’s house in the Plan 3000 District. She has a one-year-old son and her husband is a locksmith. Silvia has a grocery store in her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy noodles, flour, greens, meat, fruit, vegetables, sodas, and beverages to increase her inventory. A new market opened where she lives, so she wants to have more merchandise to sell so that she can attract more customers. Sra. Silvia and her husband are hardworking people. They desire to succeed so that they can provide a future for their son.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Rose has been selling corn dough (in the pan in front of her). She also prepares banku to sell. The dough is made from maize or corn. Demand for the corn dough is increasing. A loan from Kiva will be used to buy bags of maize to process into corn dough to sell. She hopes to reinvest the additional capital. 

She is married and has four children. She has received a senior high education. Her husband is a carpenter. As part of her responsibilities as a housewife, she assists her spouse in providing the basic needs of the home.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make corn dough

loans.name: Chances Group

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Kudakwashe from Gweru, the capital of Midlands Province in Zimbabwe. He is married to a teacher and together they have two children, one attending school.  

Kudakwashe runs a food business selling farm produce and chickens. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is transportation of products to market. 

Kudakwashe has requested a loan of $400 to buy chickens and chicken feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to help sustain the family. In the future Kudakwashe plans to own and run a butchery.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 58 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión cinco hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, él se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo cerámica, él lleva a la ciudad de Lima y vende sus productos a diferentes centros artesanales. Ya son 35 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, barniz, arcilla y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in Pisaq (Peru). He is 58, married, and has five children. He currently lives in the city of his birth, where he works. He makes ceramics, bringing his products to Lima to sell in different craft centers. He has been an artist for 35 years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the hard work that he puts into his job.

Francisco needs this loan to purchase materials such as lacquer, varnish, and clay.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of the Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a very touristic area, as well as for being a commercial center. It is known for the traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as lacquer, varnish, clay, and other items.

loans.name: Segundino

texts.es: Segundino tiene 64 años, vive en compañía de su esposa. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, asimismo tiene 30 años trabajando en la crianza y venta de cuyes. Ambas actividades lo desarrolla en su casa, pues posee una granja, del cual dispone de una área suficiente para albergar cerca de 200 cuyes, de la mismo forma tiene terrenos para cultivar alfalfa u otro alimento que sirva de forraje para sus animales. Es así que día a día alimenta y cuida de sus cuyes asíi como siembra cebada. Ella vio por conveniente intensificarse en la crianza de cuyes por ello se capacita constantemente sobre técnicas adecuadas de crianza que le permiten mejorar en su trabajo, asi logra tener cuyes grandes y de buen peso, caracteristicas que es muy solicitado en el mercado. Ahroa está en aumento la reproducción por ello necesita de más forraje para cubrir la totalidad que tiene. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  está muy contento de poder acceder a los créditos que se dan de manera oportuna cuando mas lo necesita, ya que siempre se presentan las oportunidades de desarrollo. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de cebada para sembrar y tener mayor abastecimiento de alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Segundino is 64 years old and lives with his wife. He has been involved in the agriculture business since childhood. For 30 years, Segundino has been raising and selling guinea pigs. He operates both of his businesses from home. Segundino owns a farm and has sufficient space to accommodate almost 200 guinea pigs. On his land, he grows alfalfa and other crops to use as fodder for his animals. Segundino feeds and cares for his guinea pigs every day and also looks after his barley crop. He saw the need to intensify his efforts in raising guinea pigs, so he is constantly learning new techniques that will help him improve in his work and will result in larger and fatter animals. These characteristics are in great demand in the marketplace. In order to increase production, Segundino needs to acquire more fodder to feed his existing lot of animals.

This is the second time he has received a loan from MFP. Segundino is pleased to access these loans because they will open up opportunities when he needs them the most. He is always presented with opportunities to develop. The money will be invested in the purchase of barley seeds for planting so that he will have a greater reserve of feed for his animals.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds so that he can produce fodder for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

He has been working as a mechanic for more than 15 years. In 2009, he opened his own car repair shop. His job consists of changing cars oil. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional mechanical tools and supplies needed. He is sure that with this purchase he will be able to meet his business needs and the requests of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies for his car repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock of second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and works hard to support her family. 

Diadema has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment.  

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Maura Olimpia

texts.es: La Sra. Maura es una mujer casada, madre D. 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores D. edad e independientes; ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulatoria por las principales calles D. la ciudad D. Ica; también como otro ingreso tiene una moto la cual la alquila para el servicio D. taxi; ya lleva en el negocio D. la venta D. ropa 3 años, gana aproximadamente S/. 200 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra D. mercadería (ropa D. temporada) para poder aumentar sus ventas. Su principal desafió que enfrenta la Sra. Maura es la discapacidad D. su esposo ya que se encuentra postrado en una silla D. ruedas y no puedo trabajar. Su principal sueño D. ella es tener una tienda granD. D. venta D. ropa. La Sra. Maura esta agradecida por haber confiando en ella y haberle brindado el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Maura is married and the mother of three grown-up children who are financially independent.  She works selling clothes as a street vendor on the main streets of the city of Ica.  As additional income, she also has a motorbike that she rents out for taxi service.

She has had her business selling clothes for three years, and earns approximately 200 New Soles a week.

She will invest the loan being offered in the purchase of merchandise (seasonal clothing), so as to be able to increase her sales.

The main challenge facing Señora Maura is her husband's disability, as he is in a wheelchair and unable to work.  Her biggest dream is to have a large clothing store.

Señora Maura is grateful for your trust in her, and for providing her with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothes) to improve her sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with one child who is in school. She has been running a beauty salon for the last 11 years to support her family. She has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. In the next five years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. Mary dreams of buying a piece of land and building rental houses in future. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hairdrier and a blow dry machine.

loans.use: To buy a hairdrier and a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Ouheila

texts.en:
Ouheila is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and seven children. Despite being a big family, they’re all united and financially cooperative. 

Ouheila is a talented tailor. She has established a tailoring business at her domicile since 2000; and already worked for 20 years in this trade. In parallel, she sells food products from her home which she prepares herself. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new tailoring machine to increase her production and earn more income. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring factory.

loans.use: purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 45 years old and a widow. She has three children aged 11 to 13. All of her children are in school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. 

Odette would like a loan to buy more rice, beans, bananas, potatoes, and cooking oil to sell in her store. She hopes to use any profits to create savings for her family’s future. She hopes to provide sufficient products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes;  La socia tiene 44 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 24, 20, años de edad; La socia trabaja prestando el servicio de alquiler de maquinas pesadas, la socia tiene un negocio familiar, ella tiene maquinaria pesada y también fabricación de bloquetas, la socia vende bloquetas al por mayor a las diferentes constructoras o personas independientes y les alquila un camión o una maquinaria para trasladar el material comprado y también  se dedica  a la compra y venta de graba, arena, piedra chancada. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el combustible para las maquinarias pesadas y comprar piedra.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the "Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos in Quipicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 44 years old. She lives with her partner, and has two children, ages 24 and 20. 

She rents heavy equipment.  It is a family business. She has heavy equipment, and also makes cement blocks. She sells blocks at wholesale to various construction companies or individuals, and rents them a truck or equipment to move material they have bought. She also buys and sells gravel, sand, and crushed rock. 

She is applying for the loan to buy fuel for the heavy equipment, and rock. She is grateful for the loan, and promises to make payments in accordance with her loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy fuel for heavy equipment, as well as rock.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Don Bernardo es una persona muy trabajadora ya tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado desde hace 7 años, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, vive en Colonia Los Pinos de Choloma, Cortes.
Desde hace siete años se dedica a comprar y vender metales para reciclar tales como: chatarras de artículos y vehículos, desperdicios  de hierro, aluminio, cobre, bronce, hierro molido y recolecta plásticos, para venderlos  a una empresa  de reciclaje de estos materiales.  Compra a un precio y lo vende a otro generándole buena ganancia. Todo el día le dedica a este negocio desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde.
Se siente apoyado por los préstamos que le ha brindado ODEF, este es el segundo préstamo y lo necesita para invertir en compra de vehículos chatarra y desperdicios de hierro, bronce, cobre, plástico y aluminio, para la venta.
Su sueño es obtener un vehículo propio para esta actividad que realiza, y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a very hardworking forty-year-old man.  He’s been married for seven years and has two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  He lives in the Los Pinos de Choloma neighborhood, Cortes.

For the last seven years he’s worked buying and selling recyclable metals like: junk metal and car parts, iron, aluminum, copper, bronze and ground iron scraps and he also collects plastics to sell to a recycling firm.  He buys them at one price and then sells them for another earning a good profit.  He spends all day in this business working from 7am until 5pm.

He feels supported by loans from ODEF.  This is the second one and he needs it to buy junk autos and iron, bronze, copper, plastic and aluminum scraps to sell.  His dream is to own a vehicle for his business and to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Anicia

texts.es: Anicia, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, es casada con Arnaldo, vive en compañía de su esposo, sus dos hijos mayores y un menor, su casa es propia, la cual logró construir con el apoyo de su esposo. El trabajo de Anicia, consiste en la venta de comidas y bebidas, lo cual lo realiza todos los sábados y domingos y feriados en su local  ubicado en su propia casa, el cual lo abrió ya hace 05 años  tiempo que le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona y por las personas que pasan por el lugar, contando con la apoyo de sus hijas que le ayudan en la  preparación y atención al publico. Paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas durante los días de la semana contando con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, lo que no le gusta es que los precios de los productos para la elaboración de sus comidas están que suben lo cual hace variar sus ganancias. Ella sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto es muy concurrido  teniendo todas la ganas de ampliar su negocio. Este sería su préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, con el grupo que trabaja  se siente muy cómoda pues los conoce muy bien por el tiempo que viene trabajando, lo que le anima a seguir en el grupo. Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para arreglar su negocio como calaminas y listones para arreglar el techado y con el saldo lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de parrilladas.
texts.en: Anicia is 53 years old; she is a very happy, vibrant and enterprising woman. She is married to Arnaldo, with whom she lives as well as her two adult children and a small child. She lives in her own home which she was able to build with her husband’s aid. Anicia works selling food and beverages that every Saturday and Sunday as well as holidays in her stall located in her own home that she opened 5 years ago, time that has allowed her to be well known in the area and for the people that pass through. She has help from her daughters who help her prepare and take care of the customers. Besides selling food, Anicia also sells soft drinks during the week as she has a refrigerator that she bought with her savings. What she enjoys about her jobs is that she is able to have an income, what she doesn’t like are the prices of the products for the preparation of the food which are rising and make her profits fluctuate. She keeps working hard thanks to her customers who frequent her business and Anicia wants to expand her business. This will be Anicia’s loan number 3 with MFP, she is very comfortable with the group that she works with since she knows them very well for the time they’ve spent together and is encouraged to continue with the group. With the loan of 1000 nuevos soles, Anicia will buy materials to make improvements to her business like calamines and timber to fix the roof and with what’s left Anicia will buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her grill.

loans.use: buy timber and calamines to fix the infrastructure of her business as well as ingredients to prepare the grill.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es: Leocadio, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está soltero,  vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar alimento para mantener sus cerdos en buen estado. El cuenta con los cerdos y lo que el quiere es engordarlos rápido para la venta y así generar ganancias rápidas. Su meta es vender sus cerdos en un buen tiempo para que sea bien pagado sus animales y así con las ganancias generadas tener una estabilidad económica más estable para su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leocadio, 51, is single and currently lives alone.  With the loan he intends to buy feed to keep his pigs in good condition.  He depends on the pigs and what he wants is to fatten them for sale quickly and so generate quick profits.  His goal is to sell his pigs in good time so he will be well paid for his animals.  In this way, with the profits generated he will have more stable finances for his future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.en:
Glicerio is a married man with three children aged 11, 5 and 2. He works as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Glicerio primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 5000 Php per month doing this farming. 

Glicerio works hard to improve his business and save for his children's education. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alosius

texts.en:
Alosius is a thirty-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. 

He started this business with the intention of developing himself and educating his children. He hopes to expand his businesses and become a modernized farmer, though he faces a challenge of lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows and goats for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for his farm.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is a divorced man and he has a son Juan is living at El Alto but this time he moved to some place where he pays rent Juan works as a carpenter and he needs a loan to purchase wood Juan would like to have his own house and his own joinery in the future He hopes you can trust him again he is healthy and he is taking good care of his son

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Q. has been an auto repairman for 20 years. He learned the trade from a good friend of his, and after practicing for years, he decided to open his own shop. Although Luis had no experience running a business before, he had the insight to know that it would require savings. His first strategic purchase was a paint machine, and from there Luis was able to get more money to launch a fully-funtioning store out of his home. When business is slow, Mr. Q. is still able to turn a profit by contracting custom orders with clients, instead of just servicing the walk-in customers. 

Luis is applying for this credit so that he can revamp his tools and purchase raw materials like paints, scrap metal, airbrushes, tape, and a welding machine. His goal is to bring all of the tools in-house so that he does not have to go out and buy new ones every time a first-time customer comes in. 

He is a 41 year-old entrepreneur, father, and husband who is very dedicated to his work. Luis’ wife even helps out in the shop, selling seasonal goods that she makes. She also educates their young daughter, manages the household, and hopes that one day the body shop business blossoms into something larger.

loans.use: Luis is applying for this credit so that he can revamp his tools and purchase raw materials like paints, scrap metal, airbrushes, tape, and a welding machine.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela started her general store in 2005 with $200 capital supplied by her previous employer. She is married and has four children. She is educated to level 8.

She will use her loan to increase the variety of goods she sells and take advantage of more customer demands. 

She will use her profits to finish the house her family has begun to build.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Maria Feliciana

texts.en:
Maria Feliciana is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has 12 children, 8 girls and 4 boys. Her husband is a bricklayer, for which the salary is very variable, and with their family responsibilities the expenses were too great and were not covered by her spouse. So 15 years ago Maria Feliciana decided to work to help her husband with the household expenses, and above all the education of her children. She started selling tamales and other food, along with shoes. She had to travel to another city where she could buy good quality shoes cheaply, along with curtains and blankets, and in this way offer good prices to her customers. Little by little she got ahead. Today her children are married, but Maria Feliciana has not lost the taste for work, and she now dedicates herself to the sale of health products.

Maria Feliciana is requesting a loan for $375 to buy a new product put out by the company that supplies her health products. It is a weight-loss product. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months, since with this new product she hopes to have many customers. She thanks you for your support because she wants to keep working and have a better quality of life than she has now.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

María Feliciana es mujer muy trabajadora, esta casada y tiene doce hijos, 8 son mujeres y 4 hombres, su esposo es albañil, por lo que su sueldo es muy variable y con la carga familiar que tenían el gasto era demasiado y no era cubierto por su esposo, por ello desde hace 15 años María Feliciana decidió trabajar para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y sobre todo para la educación de sus hijos. Empezó vendiendo tamales, comidas y zapatos, teniendo que viajar a una ciudad en la que podía conseguir zapatos baratos de buena calidad, además de cortinas y cobijas y así poder ofrecer un buen precio a sus clientes. Poco a poco saco adelante a sus hijos quienes ahora ya están casados y María Feliciana no perdió el gusto por el trabajo y se dedica a la venta de productos para la salud.

María Feliciana está solicitando un préstamo de US $ 375 para la compra de un producto nuevo que saco la empresa que le proporciona los productos de salud, que es un producto para bajar de peso, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, ya que con este nuevo producto ella espera tener muchos clientes y agradece su apoyo por que quiere continuar trabajando y tener una calidad de vida mejor a la actual

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sheema

texts.en: “I manage my family’s dairy business of which we sell 3 to 4 kilos per day. My husband used to work in a local factory, which he quit due to an injury. Now that he is feeling better, we need a loan to purchase a Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle) on which he will provide transportation service to local townspeople. My eldest child works while the three younger ones go to school.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang Vathy, 49, lives with her husband, 62, and 3 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Her husband is a carpenter and earns approximately $7 a day. Two of their children also work in this business, and the third works at the factory. 
 Mrs. Cheang Vathy has applied for this loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for her husband's business. The couple would like to have a motorcycle so they can  transport the goods further, faster, and more easily, and thus reach more customers and increase their profits.

( This is a picture of her husband because Vathy is unavailable)

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to transport goods

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Sr. Octaviano A., 49 years of age, is married to Sr. Hermógena, 42 years of age, together they have two children ages 23 and 13. 
Octaviano is dedicated to selling fresh strawberries from his mobile stand in Aregua, Paraguay. One day he decided to purchase two packages of socks and sell these along with the strawberries. He was able to sell all of the socks by mid-day. Due to his success in selling the socks he decided to take out a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise. Octaviano bought: wallets, t-shirts, cell phone cases, watch batteries and of course, more socks. Now, Octaviano is thinking about further expanding his stock. The money he’s earned from these new items has been crucial in increasing quality of life. 
He now hopes to open his own stand rather than having to move around all the time. A kind woman he knows has allowed him to set up his stand on her street. With this added stability Octaviano is able to sell more than ever before.

loans.use: to purchase socks,wallets, t-shirts, cell phone cases, watch batteries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years of age, a self-employed tailor. She is married to her husband Martin, with whom she has four children: Sarah, 12 years; Charles, 6; Tony, 2 and a half; and a baby of three months. After her primary school, Ruth’s mother couldn’t raise tuition fees for secondary/higher education. Ruth’s mother resorted to taking her daughter to a technical school where she was trained in dressmaking.

Ruth and Martin bought a used manual sewing machine from an old tailor (woman) from their savings after a period of time. She established the sewing business in 2001, sewing children’s clothing and marketing them. She purchases material from the city centre, crafts different designs at home in Nansana, a city suburb, and makes her sales in bulk to the vendors in Owino Market, the largest local market in Uganda. She says sometimes local citizens place orders to design and craft clothing.

The overhead has been low, and she has managed to break even. Ruth believes there is a future for the business since sewing is done at home with limited costs. She would like to borrow $ 500 to purchase another sewing machine (second-hand) and materials (cloth) that will be repaid in six months. With time, she will use her profits to meet basic household needs, tuition fees for her family, and pass on the skills to her children as she has already done to the elder daughter, Sarah.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and material

loans.name: Elimosaria

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 42-year-old Elimosaia K.. She is married with five children, aged 6,11, 15, 18, and 20.

In 2006, Elimosaia established a food stall. Elimosaria has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice and oil in bulk.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish.

It is the kind of place where local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fruit, vegetables, rice and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 26, married in 2000 and has two little sons. She learned to weave from her mother and has been weaving for 8 years. She sells the finish product to the middle man in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns three dollars gross income every day. They live along the Mekong River, about 8 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Charatha is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Luz Mary's Group

texts.en:
Luz, Maribel and Elisabeth have belonged to the New Rock Community Bank (Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi) for 8, 4 and 8 months respectively. In their community bank, they learned responsibility, how to invest money, to save and what they can do to overcome hardships.

Luz is 20 years old and single. Luz along with her mother sell food in the Magdalena market. Luz plans to grow her business with the loan she hopes to get. She will sell chicken broth from a tent on Mondays.

On the other hand, Maribel is a 28 year old, single mother of 4 children. Maribel is a street vendor in the Magdalena market selling “emoliente” (a drink made with herbs and flax seed which has healing properties). Maribel also sells regional fruit on occasion.

Elisabeth is 29 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner. Elisabeth sells food on Fridays and Saturdays at the Ccejelambras and Chontaca fairs. Sometimes Elisabeth sells food at different construction sites. Elisabeth has a planned to open a general store.

Luz, Maribel and Elisabeth need loans for 1000 soles, 400 soles and 200 soles. This amount will be invested in buying a tent, pots, plates, sugar, flaxseed, rice and a portion of this loan will be used for Maribel son's medical expenses.

Their dreams are to finish their studies and work, grow their businesses, build their homes and help their children become professionals in the workplace.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Musuq Rumi” que significa “Nueva Piedra” en quechua, hace 8, 4, 8 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, como invertir el dinero, a ahorrar y que se puede salir de las dificultades.

Luz es soltera y tiene 20 años, Luz junto a su mama venden comida en el mercado Magdalena. Luz con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio, venderá caldo de gallina en una carpa los días lunes.

Por otro lado Maribel es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Maribel vende emoliente, (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino, contiene propiedades curativas), de manera ambulante en el mercado Magdalena. Además Maribel en épocas vende frutas de la región.

Mientras que Elisabeth es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Elisabeth vende comidas los días viernes y sábados en las ferias de Ccejelambras y Chontaca. Algunas veces Elisabeth vende comidas en diferentes obras de construcción. Elisabeth tiene proyectado abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth necesitan prestamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos, carpa, azúcar, linaza, arroz y una parte del préstamo de Maribel será para los gastos médicos de su hijo.

Los sueños de Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth son terminar su carrera y trabajar, tener un negocio mas grande, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Luz, Maribel and Elisabeth need loans for 1000 soles, 400 soles and 200 soles. This amount will be invested in buying a tent, pots, plates, sugar,  flaxseed, rice and a portion of this loan will be used for Maribel son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Mayra Nelly

texts.es:
Mayra A. is a divorced woman who has two sons, one who is 12, and one who is 8. Both are in school. After separating from her husband, she took charge of all of the expenses of her sons and her home. Eight years ago, she started selling food, feeding some construction workers who were working near her house. Upon having success with this, she continued doing it, and this is how she has been able to take care of her children. Now she has regular customers.

Currently she needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase some chairs and tables, which will let her offer better service and comfort to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mayra A. es una mujer divorciada que tiene 2 hijos uno de 12 y otro de 8 años, ambos están estudiando. Al separarse de su esposo se hizo cargo de los gastos de sus hijos y de su casa, hace 8 años inicio vendiendo su comida, dándole de comer a unos albañiles que estaban trabajando por su casa, y al tener éxito con esto continuo haciéndolo y es lo que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus pequeños, actualmente ya tiene sus clientes asiduos.
