Años anteriores le ha traído buenas ganancias dedicarse a esta actividad, pero últimamente, debido a las condiciones climáticas, ha notado que sus ingresos han bajado considerablemente, por lo que recientemente Margina ha optado por sembrar alfalfa, que es el alimento para los animales, que le resulta más rentable cosecharla a menudo y venderla por paquetes. Dentro de sus planes está la implementación de su propia granja de animales menores en su casa. Es la primera vez que Margina tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, que es la razón predominante por la cual fue aceptada a ser una integrante más de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de animales menores; como pollos y cuyes, los comprará por docenas para iniciarse en la crianza y venta de animales.
texts.en:
Margina is 53 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has been a farmer for 20 years, growing crops native to her area, such as potato and corn. This has sustained her family as she sells her harvest at market. In previous years, this was a good way to make a living but lately, because of weather conditions, she has noticed a sharp drop in her revenues. Margina has therefore decided to sow alfalfa, which is used to feed animals as it is more profitable to harvest it often and sell by bales. As part of her plans, she intends to start a business raising small animals at home. This is the first time Margina is getting a loan from MFP. She is committed to pay on time, which is why she has been accepted as a member of her community bank. She will invest the loan in the purchase of small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she will buy by the dozen in order to start up her animal-raising and sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a business raising small animals.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Juan Francisco U. tiene 48 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la compra y venta de cerdo, y la ubicación de su negocio está en una finca. Hace cinco anos que tiene este negocio, y Don Juan lo inició porque tuvo unos amigos que le aconsejaron que este tipo de negocio le podía ayudar a generar los ingresos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. El propósito de Don Juan es de comprar más cerdos en esta temporada ya que estos tienen diferentes utilidades. Por esta razón, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo designado a la compra de repuestos de su carretón, y además de eso lo ocupa para el traslado de los cerdos. Al final, sus deseos son de mantener este negocio ya que con este, él gana ingresos extras los cuales le permite dar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco U. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Juan’s economic activity involves the purchase and sale of pigs, and the location of his business is at a farm. He has had the business for five years, having started because he had some friends who advised him that this type of enterprise would help him generate enough income to support his family. Juan’s intention is to purchase more pigs during this season, as they serve various functions. For this reason, the financing is to provide him with working capital designed to purchase spare parts for his trailer. The trailer also helps him with the transport of the pigs. Finally, his wishes are to maintain the business since it earns him extra income that allows him to provide additional comforts for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id:
Dari Pinjaman periode yang pertama yang telah diterima oleh Ni ketut Sudantri dan yang sudah dipergunakan untuk membeli anakan babi dan induk babi.Hasil yang didapat dari usaha ini cukup baik karena Ni Ketut Sidantri melakukan segala petunjuk cara pemeliharaan babi yang  bimbingan oleh dokter Hewan dan pembina dari DINARI.  Hasil yang diperoleh ini dipergunakan untuk menambah jumlah Anakan babi yang bisa dipelihara dan juga untuk membiayai uang sekolah anaknya yang masih bersekolah
Untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini Ni Ketut Sudantri akan mempergunakan  pinjamannya untuk membeli Anakan Babi yang akan dipelihara selama 5 bulan dengan harapan penghasilanya akan lebih meningkat.
texts.en:
From the first round of loan, Ni ketut Sudantri has use it to buy piglets and sow. It was fruitful as she was given guidance on rearing them from Dinari's Vetrianry. The profit was used to buy new piglets and as well for the use of her children who are still studying. For the second round of loan she intend to use it to buy more piglets and pig feedings and rear them for 5 months, and hopes that her profit will increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: M. Rose is the leader of the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. She is a business lady with a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. Rose says that before the loans, she always figured out what she would sell out to her customers, and this mostly happened because she did not have enough capital. Then there was not a lot of competition in her area. But the use of loans helped her to include more goods on her shop shelves and now she is happy that although there are bigger shops in her neighborhood, she can afford to sell and make a weekly profit of 40000 Ushs and save for her family and future developments. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop.

loans.use: Restocking Rose's retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Yeral Walberto

texts.es:
El señor Yeral R. en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León ha iniciado la obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda el cual ha logrado llevar a cabo con mucho esfuerzo.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con dicha obra como lo es la puesta del piso y por esto requiere del crédito para así finalizar su obra y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeral R. lives in the Telica district of the city of León and, with much effort, has begun the work of remodeling his home.

He has come to CEPRODEL today with the desire to obtain a loan to purchase the construction materials necessary to continue the work of laying a floor in his home. He needs a loan to complete the project and provide better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has been selling aluminum for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as from surrounding regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum.

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 13 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan R. is 53 years old and is married to Mrs. Rufina Ferreira, with whom he has three older daughters. Mr. Juan produces cheese and also sells milk. He has been working in this business since 2000, thanks to help from his brother, who worked in an upholstery shop. It was due to this income that they bought a cow with a calf to start the business.

Currently he is also working to make leather footwear, which provides a large amount of income. Thanks to his work, his daughters were able to continue their education, and now they live on their own.

The credit applied for is for the purchase of cow fodder, so that the cattle can be well fed and produce quality milk.

loans.use: To purchase cow fodder

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé en 2007 le commerce de bijoux, elle s’approvisionne au Ghana, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle vend ses marchandises aux bonnes dames du grand marché de Lomé. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit lui permettant d’acheter 4 cartons de bijoux de nouvelles gammes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started a jewelry business in 2007. She supplies herself from Ghana, so she manages to realize a larger profit margin on her sales. She sells her merchandise to women at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The inventory currently at her disposal does not allow her to respond to customer demand. This is the reason behind her inquiry with WAGES. She is asking for her first loan to buy four boxes of new assortments of jewelry. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja en L. casa D. sus padres y tiene una hija que es el motor D. su trabajo. Él se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte público y a enseñar danzas. Cuando empezó con el transporte no contaba con L. licencia D. conducir ni con el permiso D. L. municipalidad, por lo que tenía muchas dificultades para trabajar. Posteriormente con el apoyo D. su padre logró regularizar todos sus documentos, por ello le da una parte D. las ganancias D. su trabajo como alquiler del motocarro, pues el vehículo es D. su padre. Pero con lo que José se siente más identificado es con las danzas y constantemente se capacita en diversas coreografías actuales. Además, también alquiL. los trajes para los danzantes, lo que le permite acumular más ganancias. Con estas dos actividades es con las que José mantiene a su familia, siendo su próxima meta L. construcción D. su casa propia. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los periodos concluidos demostró pagar a tiempo todas las cuotas, además sus compañeros le tienen mucho aprecio por ser el presidente D. su banco comunal y siempre los orienta para que tomen decisiones acertadas. El dinero que solicita lo piensa utilizar en el incremento D. los disfraces típicos que alquiL., con otra parte pagará el cambio D. un repuesto del motocarro con el que trabaja.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, lives with his partner at his parents’ house, and has one daughter who is the driving force behind his work. He dedicates himself to providing public transportation services and teaching dance. When he started in transportation, he didn’t have a license or the necessary municipal approvals, which maD. it very difficult to work. Later, with his father’s support, he managed to obtain all the necessary documentation. He pays a part of his earnings towards renting his motocar, as it belongs to his father. However, what José most identifies with is dance and he is always choreographing new dances. Teaching dance generates additional income for him, but he also has to rent dance costumes. His two activities allow him to support his family, and his next goal is to build his own home. This is his ninth credit with MFP, and his past record demonstrates that he complies with his payments. In addition, his friends greatly appreciate him as he is the president of their cooperative bank and he always helps guiD. them towards good decision-making. He plans to use some of the funds he is requesting to rent more traditional dance outfits, and the rest to pay off a repair on his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar and buy dance costumes.

loans.name: Nyame Som Pa Group

texts.en:
M. is forty years old. He is married and has nine children who are all still in school. He is a petty trader. He sells cereals. He supplies to local food vendors.

M. is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Som Pa’. He is the man seated in front in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work very hard to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the market square in the community they live in. Some trek to other towns to sell their products.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans le commerce du charbon de bois dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé où elle vend à la fois en gros et en détail. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1993 et c’est ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de contribuer financièrement aux dépenses de son foyer. Son stock est en état d’épuisement ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de 25 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle est célibataire mais a à sa charge 03 personnes.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in the sale of charcoal in the neighborhood of Djidjolé, in Lomé. She sells the charcoal wholesale and for cash. She has been in this business since 1993 and this allows her to handle the business herself and contribute to her family's financial expenditures. The stock of her business has been exhausted; so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 25 bags of charcoal.

She is unmarried, but she is caring for 3 people.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Lizzeth Zoraida

texts.es: LIZZETH ZORAIDA A. T., es una persona joven y madre desde los 16 años, ahora su hijo tiene 8 años y tiene el negocio con el que mantiene a su hijo y a ella misma, es la segunda secuencia que saca el prestramo ella es una cliente responsable con sus pagos y tiene un carisma especial, trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 22:00 y no se mueve de su puesto ubicado en una de las zonas con mas movimiento de nuestra ciudad. Ella vive solo con su hijo en un pequeño ambiente en alquiler.

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de nuevo kiosco para venta de golosinas

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: P. Antoinette est née le 27 octobre 1956. Antoinette est allée à l’école mais elle a fini par abandonner les études au profit du commerce. Antoinette vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Aujourd’hui, Antoinette vend ses articles dans une boutique qui lui appartient. Antoinette veut mieux développer son activité ; c’est pourquoi Antoinette sollicite de crédit de la part d’ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Antoinette P. was born on October 27, 1956. Antoinette went to school but ended up abandoning her studies to start a business. Antoinette sells a variety of items such as candies, cookies, canned food (milk, sardines and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwashing detergent, soap, batteries and candles. Today Antoinette sells her merchandise in her own small shop. Antoinette wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies, cookie, canned goods, sugar, pasta, detergent, soap, batteries and candles, and staples such as rice, eggs beans and corn.

loans.name: Krub

texts.en: K. is 52 years old, married, and has eleven children, one who is married and ten who live at home. He grows vegetables and rice, and sells them to other sources for income in Khnar Village in the Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife almost 30 years earns around $3 per day. Two of his sons are employed as construction workers and another raises pigs and poultry for sale. With his large family, K. works almost everyday to generate revenues for to support his family's living. K. said that he is always paid a lot of money for taxi because he doesn't have his own vehicle for riding so he has decided to ask a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Shahara

texts.en:
Shahara J., currently in the business of selling beer at her bar, is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Shahara, 24 years old and widowed, has two children, both of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike to carry crates of beer from wholesale stores to her bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Inés Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce del departamento de León, el señor R. ha comenzado a trabajar en su pequeña pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos los cuales son ofrecidos en su propia casa de habitación donde a diario oferta tales productos con el propósito de obtener el sustento para su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día, el señor Ines ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería. Entre los productos que comprará se encuentran los comestibles y las golosinas. Espera en que el crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así continuará ofreciendo sus productos en la pulpería ubicada en El Sauce específicamente en la comarca Los Tololos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ines R. operates a grocery store out of his home in the El Sauce municipality of Leon, where he sells a variety of products with the purpose of earning income to maintain his home. Mr. Ines has requested a loan so he can invest in the purchase of merchandise for his store. Amongst some of the products he will purchase are food and snack products. He hopes he will receive this loan so he can continue to offer many products in his store, which is located specifically in the district of Los Tololos.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grilled fish

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Sullcataca Baja sector  Laja  de la Provincia los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es soltero vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos menores, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de forraje, ya que por esta época de pocas lluvias no existe mucha producción de forraje para alimento del ganado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Edwin raises dairy cows and sells their milk to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant).

He lives in the community Sullcataca Baja sector Laja, Los Andes province, department of La Paz, located 3 hours from the city of La Paz.

He is single and lives with his parents and younger siblings, who study at the community’s school.

The loan will be used to buy animal feed since now is the time of little rain and there is not much animal feed production.

This is his first loan with Impro; the completed evaluation indicates that he is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
T. Batbayar is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son is a construction worker and his two daughters both attend a local secondary school. 

Batbayar currently works as a security guard at the local army post and also drives a taxi. He primarily drives a taxi and only works at the army post seven days each month. Batbayar started his business in 2006. He is very hardworking person and is known for his good personality. He has become an experienced and trusted driver and has used his business to stabilize his income. Batbayar is working hard for the future and says, “I am planning hope to improve my taxi service.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to refurbish his car.

loans.use: to refurbish his car

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 30 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Abir has owned a hairdressing salon for six years already. Abir is special in her work because of her experience and because she keeps aware of hairstyle fashion. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Before opening her salon, she used to go to her clients house to do their hair; so, after making herself known in her neighborhood and having her own clients, she decided to open her salon. Her previous loans helped her purchase all the required tools and cover the expenses of her salon. She also offers beauty products; she does makeup, hair removal and more. Abir has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.  Therefore, she requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her salon. In the future, she plans to keep on attracting more clients in order to have a better income and keep on improving her work by offering the best to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Vasya

texts.en:
Vasya is married with a teenage daughter Vanessa. He lives in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. Vasya sells fishing supplies, fishing rods and tents in a small retail store located at a wholesale market in his home town. He doesn’t have many competitors which helps his business keep a solid standing. Vasya launched this venture 5 years ago. Currently, he has 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Vasya is requesting a 14,000 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital. Main characteristics of his business are consistency and stability. Vasya is hoping to keep his business running and efficient in the future. One of his short-term plans is to open one more vending location in his home town of Vinogradovo.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort B. sells materials and clothes at Elmina.  She has received a junior high school education.  She is single and has three children, and is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and bills. Comfort has been selling materials and clothes for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more material to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more material to sell

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca rodeo grande sector los esterios, el señor Bismarck Antonio M. Rodríguez, se dedica a la producción de ganado bobino, porcino y avícola, también es empleado del fondo de desarrollo local sucursal Somotillo en donde tiene 12 años de laborar empresa cuya actividad es otorgar créditos, el señor Bismarck M. ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades agropecuarias ya que le facilitan los ingresos necesarios para la mantención de su hogar y familia que esta constituida de su esposa e hijo.
El crédito será empleado en la compra de alambre y poste los que usara para mejorar su infraestructura de la finca.
texts.en:
Bismark Antonio raises cattle, hogs, and poultry in the municipality of Somotillo, in the Rodeo Grande region. He is also employed by the local branch of the “Fondo de Desarrollo” (Development Fund), which helps obtain loans for entrepreneurs. Bismark has spent most of his life doing agriculture, since it provides the necessary income to support his home and family, consisting of his wife and son. He will use the money from this loan to buy wire and posts which he will use to build a fence.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fence building supplies

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa del señor José Gabriel.

José Gabriel es una persona muy ocupada el trabaja en una maquiladora la mayor parte del día; es por ello que su esposa decidió dedicarse a la casa para el cuidado de sus tres pequeñas hijas. La pareja esta preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijas es por ello que desean darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ellos quieren que se les apoye para poder realizar su proyecto de dividir sala comedor de su vivienda y para esto necesitan comprar el material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is José Gabriel's wife. José Gabriel is a very busy person that works in a maquiladora (bonded assembly plant) most of the day. His wife decided to be a full-time housewife to care for their three small daughters. The couple is concerned for the wellbeing of their daughters and would like to provide them a better quality of life. They need help in getting materials and supplies and to pay labor costs to divide their living room-dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To divide his living room-dining room.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 42 años, es casada, de los cuales tiene dos hijos, independientes y con familia. Solo vive con su esposo en su casa. Su carácter emprendedor la empujaron a incursionar en diversos trabajos con su esposo, y con el correr del tiempo compraron su primer carro, siendo su pareja quien conduce el vehiculo, mientras ella lo administra y de las ganancias que obtuvieron, pudieron comprar su motocarro, en donde su hijo mayor lo trabaja. Maritza es una mujer muy ahorradora, pero a la vez, amante del trabajo, es por ello que se puso a trabajar como cocinera, en un convento, desde las 11am de la mañana hasta las 8pm de la noche, sin descuidar, la administración de sus vehículos. Su mayor anhelo de Maritza es comprarse otro carro, para uso exclusivo de ella. Éste es su séptimo préstamo  con MFP y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas, como en anteriores veces, asimismo le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, pagará el mantenimiento de su carro y cambiar algunos repuestos que requiera.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and married; she has two grown children with their own families. She lives with her husband in their home. Her enterprising nature pushed her to tackle various jobs with her husband, and after some time, they purchased their first car. Her husband drives the vehicle, while she manages it. From the profits they earned, they were able to buy their "motocarro" (a three-wheeled, light delivery van), with which their older son works. Maritza is a very thrifty woman, but at the same time, she loves working. For that reason, she began to work as a cook in a convent, from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m., while continuing to manage their vehicles. Maritza's greatest desire is to buy another car for her own use. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she agrees to continue making her payments, as in previous cases. Likewise, she enjoys working with her communal bank. With the loan she is requesting, she will pay for the maintenance of her car and replace some of the parts it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for car maintenance and spare parts

loans.name: Suong's Group

texts.en:
For this loan, Mrs. Suong S. is the group leader, selected by the members. The group consists of six members, located in Pea Ream village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. 

Suong S. is a silk weaver who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chork L., is a farmer who owns a 1.20-hectare field on which to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living. 

Suong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase the income to improve the family's standard of living. This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are students who also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy more silk in order to expand the business

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Group

texts.es:
Estas personas todas  actualmente residen en el municipio de Santo Domingo, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.	
la cual tuvimos la oportunidad de investigar el estado de vida de cada una de las integrantes del grupo, en la 	
cual nos dimos cuenta que ellas anteriormente tenían sus negocios propios que los ayudaba a mantener la 	
mejora de su vida, en la cual siempre habían manejado con prestamos en otros bancos pero estos en ves 	
de ayudarlos les cobraban mas intereses y eso ayudo a que las personas con el tiempo perdieran sus 	
negocios, la cual el la visita realizada de parte de la Asociación Asdir se dieron a conocer los beneficios que ofrece la Asociación, y realmente se convencieron y están solicitando su préstamo para volver a iniciar sus 	
negocios que tenían anteriormente, la cual es de venta de Maíz por menor, venta de plátano y venta de 	
refacciones, ellas se ven muy entusiasmadas en recibir sus créditos porque a base de ellos implementarán 	
de nuevos sus negocios y esto ayudara a que mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
All of these individuals currently reside in the municipality of Santo Domingo, Suchitepéquez in Guatemala. Each of the members had previously managed their own businesses in order to help improve their lives. They worked with loans from other banks, but were charged too much interest which led to them losing their businesses. The group members visited Asociación ASDIR upon learning the benefits that were available. They were really convinced and have now requested a loan to restart the businesses they had previously, which include selling corn, bananas, and spare parts. They are excited about receiving their loans because they will be able to reestablish their businesses, which will help them improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to restart their previous businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and flour.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna D. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 25 years old. Donna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Donna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Donna is just starting this business.

In 2010, Donna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Donna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Donna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Donna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mame Diarra/ndoffene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe « MAME DIARRA » est créé en 2007 lors de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui abrite ledit Banc Villageois, il a 2 et demi ans d’existence. Il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par cohabitation et affinité. Elles sont âgées entre 30 et 60 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 4 enfants. La plus part d’entre elles font de l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine. Et comme activité parallèle elles font du petit commerce de produits divers, par exemple des céréales locales, du poisson et des légumes. 

Fatou Dakal S. la responsable du groupe de solidarité, en second rang, à l’extrême droit de la photo de tenue sombre vêtue, est âgée de 48 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et de légumes. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 3 ans. A l’instar de ses camarades, elle fait également de l’embouche ovine. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer ses activités génératrices de revenus afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices qui à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, assurer la nourriture de ses enfants et le payement de leur scolarité par exemple.
texts.en:
The “Mame Diarra” group has been created in 2007 on the occasion of the inauguration of the “Banc Villageois” two and a half years ago. The group is made up of nine women, all of them coming from the same village. They gathered by vicinity and common tastes. They are aged 30 to 60, all married and mothers of 4 children at least. Most of them do fattening of sheep and/or cows, and also small business of selling various products, such as local cereals, fish and vegetables. Fatou Dakal S., the solidarity group leader (second row, farthest right, dark clothes) is 48 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 7 children. She has been selling fresh fish and vegetables for over 3 years. Like her friends, she also does fattening of sheep. Her new loan will allow her to develop her activities in order to make more profit and improve her family’s life, feed her children and pay for their school fee for instance.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote the group’s business

loans.name: Delma Ramona

texts.es: Delma Ramona tiene 24 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que decidió comenzar con este negocio que fue por cuenta propia pues tenía un dinero que había guardado, pues ha obtenido muy buena clientela por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El también es un padre responsable pues tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que él le proporciona lo necesario. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, polvos, sombras y ropa interior. El sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo que es lo más importante que el tiene.
texts.en:
Delma Ramona is 24 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics. She started this business more than four years ago using her own money which she had saved. Delma has been able to attract good customers because she is always aware of what they are requesting. She is also a responsible parent with a child under her care, so she provides him everything he needs.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, eye shadows, and undergarments. Her dream is to increase her operating capital since it is the most important thing she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, eye shadows, and undergarments

loans.name: Chequita

texts.en:
Chequita D. is from the village of Mabini, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Chequita is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Chequita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Chequita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chequita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chequita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Chequita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martana Ingrid

texts.es:
Martana Ingrid G. V. tiene 36 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.  

Martana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Martana se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, arroz, cacao, café, y soya. Vende sus productos en Mata de Cacao y va toda la semana para hacer compras y ventas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y insecticidas para las plagas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo se va a mejorar su vida y seguir incrementando. Su sueno es seguir adelante con su negocio. Tiene miedo de que si no sale bien, no se avanza. Si sale bien, se gana, dice Martana.  

En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer cosas en la casa.
texts.en:
Martana Ingrid G. V. is 36 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. She doesn’t have children. Martana is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Martana works in agriculture. She has corn, rice, cacao, coffee, and soy. She sells her products in Mata de Cacao and she goes every week to make purchases and sales. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for pests. With the support of this loan she will improve her life and continue growing. Her dream is to continue with her business. She is afraid that if things don’t go well, she won’t make progress. If they do go well, she will earn, says Martana. In her free time she likes to do things around the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for agriculture

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Madame Adjovi B. works at her general store in Lome, Togo, where she sells a range of grocery items and merchandise. Currently she is selling home products like soap, detergent, and other cleaning products. She would like to add food products like oil, sugar, canned goods, and other items to her merchandise. 

For this reason, she has requested a loan of 300,000 XOF in order to purchase these products for her store. She normally purchases her provisions at the Grand Market in Lome. Madame B. is married to an electrician and they have one child.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell at her general store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old, and a married father of 4 children between the ages of 1 and 13. Three of his children attend school. David has been practising mixed farming in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya, for the last four years. He has employed one person from his community. He sells his milk at the local market and eggs to local hotels. He is also employed by the Teachers’ Service Commission and earns income from his small-scale farming of tea, which he sells to a local factory.

David has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farming operation. He says that this loan will enable him to purchase equipment which will increase his egg production and sales. The extra income from this loan will help him meet the needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been poultry diseases and poor markets for his products. He hopes to turn his poultry farming into a higher income-generating business in the future.

loans.use: to expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella S. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 52 years old. Estrella is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es: Maria Estella tiene 61 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre, y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta está siempre busca la forma de salir adelante. Desde muy temprano se temprano ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res, cerdo entre otras. Como todo negocio estableció un pequeño negocio de estos productos en su vivienda  por lo que llegan diferentes clientes que solicitan de este productos. Ella dio inicio por su Mama quien anteriormente vendía en el mercado fue así que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida. Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de carnes ya que tiene cierta demanda. Sueña con hacer más grande su establecimiento y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Estella, 61, is a hard working, cheerful woman.  Despite the constant difficulties she faces she always seeks ways to get ahead.

She sells meat, primarily beef and pork, among others, from very early in the day.  Like all businesses, she set up this small business in her home and different customers come by to seek these products.  She started out thanks to her mother who used to sell in the market and this is how she learned from a very young age to earn her livelihood.

She is asking for this loan to buy meats because she has a bit of demand.  She dreams with enlarging her establishment and make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Derma De Lourdes

texts.es:
Derman de 56 años, hace decoraciones y recuerdos de masilla para reuniones, fiestas. Vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil lugar caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes.

Cuando se quedo viuda con sus tres hijos decidió tener su propio dinero haciendo muñecos a base de masilla para fiestas y decoraciones, dándose a conocer a muchas personas comenzó a obtener dinero haciendo decoraciones de todo tipo. Trabaja desde su casa haciendo los adornos por pedido en ocasiones su hija le ayuda cuando tiene demasiado trabajo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar masilla y equipos para hacer mas adornos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando en su negocio, y que su negocio sea bien conocido para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Derma is 56 years old and she makes decorations and keepsakes made from mastic for gatherings and parties. She lives in El Guasmo, a sector of Guayaquil characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.

When she became a widow with her three children, she decided to make her own money by making mastic-based figured for parties and decorations. She started to make a name for herself among many people and began to make money by making all types of decorations. She works from home making the decorations by request. Her daughter helps her at times when she has too much work.

With the loan, she wants to buy mastic and equipment for making more decorations. In the future, she wants to continue working in this business and wants her business to be well-known to secure her retirement.

loans.use: Mastic, equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more furniture

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros R. is a married woman who lives in Malocbaloc, Barangay Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband Emelio R., who is 37 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have ten children who are between 8 and 30 years old. 

Milagros joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 5,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $100, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for the purchase of pump boat materials so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Milagros R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of pump boat materials

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
N. Joweria is 30 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Joweria has a retail shop business, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more goods like sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joweria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Joweria hopes to set up another branch of her business.

loans.use: more goods like sugar.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa A. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Risa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Risa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green and sweet bananas in the local community. Risa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Risa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Risa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Risa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Risa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio, de 41 años, está casado con Gladys, de 51 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Magaly de 16 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo de Aurelio, consta en la agricultura, y la panadería. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano él, se dirige a la una fuente de soda donde trabaja, ahí elabora los ricos panes y pasteles que deleitan todas las mañanas los pobladores de su localidad. Pero todos los fines de semana en compañía de su esposa cuidan de sus cultivos de café, ya tiene 15 años dedicándose a ello, y según menciona sus granos son muy reconocidos en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, donde vende en cada campaña agrícola. Ahora están planeando hacer viveros de café, con los cuales renovaran sus plantaciones de café, con 3 mil plantitas; con ello obtendrán nuevos y mejores granos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante con el apoyo de su banco comunal, los que trabajaran arduamente para salir adelante. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café, y si el crédito le alcanza invertirá en la contrata de peones para el mantenimiento de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Aurelio, age 41, is married to 51 year old Gladys.  They have a 16 year old daughter, Magaly.  The family lives together in their own house, which is located in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).

Aurelio’s work consists of farming and the bakery.  Very early every morning he heads to the soda fountain where he works.  He makes delicious breads and cakes, which delight the area’s inhabitants every morning.

Every week-end he and his wife take care of their coffee crop.  He has been doing this for 15 years.  He mentions that his grains are very well-known in the Alto Palomar cooperative, which is where he sells each farming season.

He is now planning to have a coffee nursery, which he will use to renew his coffee plantings with three thousand plants.  He will get new and better grains with them.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He hopes to get ahead with the support of his communal bank; its members are working arduously to get ahead.  He plans to use the loan he receives to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.  He will spread the fertilizer on his coffee crops.  If there is still money from the loan, he will hire workers to help with maintenance of his fields.

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer and pay workers to help him in the fields

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres  hijos en su casa propia.Toda su vida ha estado ligada  a las actividades agrícolas, es así que cada día esta dedicada al cultivo de la papa y el maíz que con mucha dedicación observa los terrenos de cultivo y verifica  la aparición de posibles plagas que pueden afectar seriamente sus cosechas. Las ganancias obtenidas  le permiten  tomar acciones concretas que la ayudaran  tener una buena producción y recuperación de la inversión que realizo en la época de siembra, para ahorrar en su inversión cuenta con sus equipos y herramientas como su tractor que le facilitan la labor. Para mas adelante desea aumentar su producción.Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.Hilda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para su campaña de siembra, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 48, lives with her husband and their three daughters in their own house.  She has been tied to farm work her whole life.  Every day she devotes herself to growing potatoes and corn.  With great dedication she watches over her fields and checks for the appearance of possible pest infestations that could seriously affect her crops.

Her earnings allow her to take concrete actions, which will allow her to have a good production and recuperate the investment she made during planting season.  In order to save on her investment she has equipment and tools like her tractor, which facilitate the work.  Later on she wishes to increase her production.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

She is grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  The loan will be very useful to her in the progress of her financial activity.  She plans to use the requested money to buy various sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers that she needs for the planting season.  This is the way she plans to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael is a mother of one child who is 13 years. She is so hard working and she is focused. Rachael has a library and she is requesting for a loan in order to buy more books and to have a variety of books in her library. She has done this business for five years and this has enabled her to pay school fees for her child. With the profits, together with her savings, she hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Towards buying more books to sell.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en: Orm N. is a 51-year-old married woman who has been living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents where she grows rice and vegetables. She has no life partner because she divorced her husband when her daughter was young. Her daughter is a cashier in the Siem Reap province and needs a vehicle to drive to work, but she lacks the money to buy one. Therefore, Orm N. wants a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle so her daughter can get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to get to work

loans.name: Prod Natura (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Prod Natura esta formado por seis mujeres y un hombre quienes laboran en la venta de productos naturales de la marca TIENS, actividad que les está permitiendo mejorar económicamente y a salir adelante con  sus familias, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es de clima frió y su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.  

La Señora. María Luz Vizñay vive por la parroquia del Valle, tiene 59 años, es viuda y tiene  5 hijos de 29, 26, 23, 21 y 18 años de edad, sus primeros 4 hijos trabajan y le apoyan económicamente, su ultima hija le ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar. Con su sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María Luz se dedica a la venta de productos Naturales actividad que la realiza hace 3 años, vende sin horarios de lunes a sábados. En su casa se dedica a la cría de chanchos, gallinas, cuyes y ganado. 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace un año y los créditos anteriores le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra productos naturales. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio de venta de productos naturales.

La Señora. Fanny María H. vive por el sector de Totoracocha, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga. Tiene 53 años,  es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 34, 32, 29, 28 y 26 años de edad, su primera hija es soltera, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo y tercer hijo son casados e independientes, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la universidad y trabajan. Su esposo es operador de equipo camionero.
Doña Fanny María hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca TIENS, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales. Su meta es llegar a ser una líder de en la venta de este producto.
texts.en:
The “Prod Natura” communal bank is composed of six women and one man who work selling TIENS brand natural products, an activity that makes it possible for them to improve economically and get ahead with their families.  They live in various parts of the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in the country; it has a cold climate and its residents keep their culture and traditions.

Mrs. María Luz Vizñay lives in Valle parish.  She’s 59 years old, widowed and has five children who are 29, 26, 23, 21 and 18 years of age.  Her oldest four children are employed and help her out economically.  Her youngest daughter helps out with housework.  She has managed to build her own house with her sacrifice.

María Luz sells natural products; she’s been in this line of work for 3 years.  Se sells from Monday through Saturday with no set work schedule.  She also raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and livestock at home.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and the prior loans have helped her business grow.  She’ll use the new loan to buy natural products.  Her goal is to grow much more in her business selling natural products.

Mrs. Fanny María H. lives in Totoracocha.  This is her first loan with the communal bank; she was invited by a girl friend.  She is 53 years old, married and has five children who are 34, 32, 29, 28 and 26 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is single, employed and helps out economically.  Her second and third sons are married and independent.  Her youngest two children are going to the university and also work.  Her husband operates trucking equipment.

Fanny María has been selling TIENS brand natural products for three years.  She works Monday through Saturday with no fixed work schedule.  She will use the loan to buy natural products.  Her goal is to become a lead seller of this product.

loans.use: To buy TIENS brand natural products.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married with six school-going children. She owns a house that lacks both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over 20 years, she has operated a business selling brooms, both at the market and from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In the future, Mjeni dreams of expanding her business in order to improve her standard of living.

With the loan of 30,000 Kshs, Mjeni plans to purchase brooms for resale. She joined Yehu in order to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase brooms for resale

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a young man from Tulkarem city; he works in an investment company, Waleed has been saving money for a while and took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a piece of land that he is thinking of using for building a house in the future when he saves more money.

Waleed is single and is trying to build a house, save money, and secure his future, Waleed is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to build a house.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 24 year-old single man living in Saida.  BilA. owns a clothing shop, which is the main source of living for him and his family.  BilA. is a hard-working man.  He's still young, but he started his own business 3 years ago in order to provide for his family and support them with the major things they  need.  BilA. is responsible for his brothers.   He is requesting a first-time loan from A. Majmoua to pay for his brothers' education expenses.  
He's very proud of them and also proud of himself, because he's trying hard to give them what he couldn't afford for himself: education!

loans.use: to pay for his brothers' education expenses

loans.name: Solina

texts.en: Solina is 27 years old.  She has 3 children who are between 3 and 11 years old.   She is married to a cook.  Solina sells fresh milk and has been doing this for the past 1 ½ years. This business has enabled her meet her family's needs, feed her children, and pay their school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of milk in order to make more profit.

loans.use: buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan, es una persona que trabaja como encargado de albañilería en una empresa que construyen casas,   el como su esposa se apoyan económicamente para los gastos de la casa y como pronto se casaron todos sus hijos y la  familia crecera , el Sr. Juan desea  terminar  la  construcción de una habitación mas a su pequeña casa, agradece  a  la institución  por  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Juan works as a construction manager at a housing construction company. He and his wife both work to support their family. Juan hopes to complete an additional room on his small house, since all of his children will be married soon and the family will be growing. He is grateful to the financial institution for this support that will allow him to complete his housing project.

loans.use: To construct a room.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Nita is separated from her spouse and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Nita buys and sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used in oil production). Nita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Nita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copra. This will be the third loan taken out by Nita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Mira Jalpetekova's Group

texts.en:
Mira, 61, leads this group. Like most of her neighbors in the village of Kochkorka, she makes a living raising cattle. In recent years, this work has become harder for her to do because of health issues, so she is grateful to have a 24-year-old son who has taken over the work and is continuing to increase the number of cattle they own. This is important because it’s easier to cover fixed and variable costs with a large herd than a small one. Mira is applying for this loan to buy more cattle and increase her family's income so that her son can buy a car and begin working as a cab driver.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor JOSE  esta casado con la señora Melisa cliente de la institucion  que integró el banco de emprendimiento buenas emprendedoras que ya finalizaron su crédito. El señor José es técnico electricista y realiza instalaciones de alarmas, porteros eléctricos e instalaciones eléctricas en general, vive en la casa de sus padres los cuales  están en Argentina, vive con su esposa y con su hijo en la zona de Llojeta el crédito será destinado a la compra de materiales para instalaciones en un edificio de la zona de Miraflores. Asimismo tiene un contrato con una empresa constructora en la que trabaja junto a su papa y su hermano, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jose is married to Melisa.  He is a customer of the field partner that integrated the communal bank.  They are good entrepreneurs who have given him his loan.  Jose is an electrical technician who installs alarms, doorbells, and other electrical installations.  He lives in his parents' house while his parents are in Argentina.  Jose lives with his wife and son in the neighborhood of Llojeta.   

The loan will be used to purchase equipment for installations in a building in the neighborhood of Miraflores. Jose also has a contract with a construction company where he works with his father and his brother.  He is a hard worker and is grateful for the field partner's support.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for electrical installations.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapple, apples, etc. and is requesting a loan to expand her small business.  She is 35 years old and married. Lucy has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to more smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
Don Jose es propietario de un pequeño taller de enderezado y pintura automotriz, casado, durante varios años laboro en un taller, lo que nacio la idea de poner el propio, teniendo dificultades al no tener todas las herramientas necesarias. 
Pero cada dia se esfuerza para salir adelante con su familia.  Devido  a su experiencia ha captado clientela, y ha venido haciendo mejoras a su casa. con financiamiento a plazo que Afodenic ha dado en cinco ciclos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara materiales de construccion para terminar el techado del bajarete y parte de su casa, en el cambio de cuatones y laminas de zinc.Dando a su familia una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
José owns a small auto detailing and paint shop.  He’s married.  He was employed at an auto shop for many years and that’s where the idea to open his own business arose although he had difficulties doing so because he lacked the necessary tools.  However, every day he struggles to get ahead with his family.  Due to his experience, he’s managed to secure clientele and has been doing some home improvements with help from Afodenic long term loans that he’s had in five cycles.

He will use this new loan to buy construction materials and supplies to finish roofing the covered around porch and part of his house replacing the beams and the zinc metal sheeting thus providing his family with better living quarters.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and has three children. She sells charcoal at Takoradi, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Mary will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en:
Amisi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has twelve children, with three of them currently in school.

Amisi is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. For the past ten years Amisi has had a catering business. To expand his business, Amisi is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC to purchase warming dishes. Amisi hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children.

In the future, Amisi hopes to buy another car which will be used to transport his catering supplies.

loans.use: to purchase warming dishes for his catering service.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: Adelia, de 44 años, es una mujer con muchas ambiciones, hace 21 años que convive con Cancio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. Ver a sus hijos profesionales y encaminarlos en la vida, es su meta. Por ello, hace 21 años que trabaja con ahínco en la siembra de papa, arveja y avena; que gracias a los constantes cuidados; le genera buenas ganancias. Pero conciente, que en temporadas donde hay  escasez de agua, no se puede sembrar; ella aprovecha para vender la leche que produce su 2 vacas de la raza “mantona”; con ello, asegura la estabilidad económica de su familia. Además de varias cabezas de ganado ovino, que también comercializa después de ensebarlos. Como buena madre siempre vela por la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella también cría animales menores como: cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, que según cuenta utiliza la carne para su alimentación, pero viendo su buena crianza está planeando comercializarlos y abrir una estancia de ganados a todo nivel. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde augura muchos éxitos a su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y solidarias. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Adelia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 15 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y 20 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “tomaza”, que muy pronto sembrará.
texts.en:
Adelia, age 44, is a woman of many ambitions. She has lived with Cancio, her husband, for 21 years. Together they have 6 children, but only 5 live with them. They have their own home in the town of Huaricolca. Their goal is to see their children become professionals and to set them off in the right direction. With this in mind, they have worked diligently for 21 years sowing potatoes, peas, and oats. Thanks to their constant care, this generates them a good income. However, during water shortages they are unable to sow. Adelia takes advantage of this time to sell the milk that their two Mantona cows produce. In doing this, she ensures her family's economic stability. In addition, they have several heads of sheep, which they sell after fattening them.

A good mother, Adelia is always thinking about putting food on her children's table. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and hogs, whose meat they eat. However, she sees that they grow well and she plans to sell them and to open a ranch for all kinds of livestock. 

She belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] Communal Bank, and this is her second loan with MFP. She predicts great success with this communal bank, as they are responsible and united people. For this reason, Adelia promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. Upon receiving your support, Adelia will invest the requested loan in the purchase of 15 bags of natural fertilizers and 20 bags of potato seed of the Tomaza variety, which she will sow very soon.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of fertilizers and 20 bags of potato seeds.

loans.name: 23 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 23 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta (Provincia de Manabí), ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace cuatro meses atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Clemencia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 20, 18 y 15 años, el mayor vive en el extranjero y los tres menores estudian  en colegio. El marido trabaja en el Consejo Provincial.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además también allí mismo tiene una heladería ella aprovecha que muy cerca de su casa hay una escuela y que los estudiantes en su mayoría niños gustan mucho de los helados, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Tiene seis años con su negocio y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que está bien ubicada y también este bien surtida para que sus clientes encuentren de todo en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos,, helados y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "23 De Agosto" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta (in Manabí province).  The city is well-known for its nickname "The Incomparable Calceta", so named for the beauty of its women and because as far as its people are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

This is a group of people who four months ago decided to join together to form this Communal Bank, which has served them well in improving their small businesses.  They work in a variety of fields, such as retail, services, and food sales among other things.

Señora Clemencia lives here.  She is 42 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which she has four children aged 21, 20, 18 and 15.  The eldest lives overseas, and the younger three attend high school.  Her husband works for the Provincial Council. 

Our friend has a food store in her home, where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent.  She also has an ice-cream business.  She takes advantage of the fact that there's a primary school near her home, and that the students, who are mainly children, very much enjoy her ice-cream.  She works every day from 6 a.m. through to 10 p.m., and sometimes till even later.  Her children help her with her work when they are free.
