She has had six years working with this business and it's always gone very well for her as her location is good, and also her store is well-stocked so that her customers can find everything they want at her place.

She will use this loan to stock her store up further; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, ice-cream and other everyday products.

Her goals are to continue progressing with her business and the Communal Bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, ice-creams and other everyday products.

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es: William Antonio tiene 31 años, su actividad es el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que él había aprendido este oficio fue con el paso del tiempo que logro obtener sus propios clientes. William realiza un buen trabajo con cada uno de sus productos. Él solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, pega, maque entre otros
texts.en: William Antonio, 31, owns a carpentry business.  He has operated the business for more than 13 years.  He learned everything he needed to know about carpentry, gradually built a customer base over the years and started the business with his own funds.  William fills every order with great care.  He is applying for a loan to buy wood, nails, glue, maque, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Severiana

texts.es: Doña Severiana es una mujer trabajadora y constante, ella es casada pero ya no tiene hijos que dependen de ella ya que todos se casaron, doña Seve como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace  mas de 30 años atiende una tienda de abarrotes que sus padres le dejaron, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su tienda de abarrotes dice ella “quiero tener bien surtido mi changarro ya que de aquí comemos mi viejito y yo y es nuestro único patrimonio por eso pido el crédito para que mi negocio crezca”. Comenta que comprara jabón, cloro, galletas, refrescos, garrafones de agua, leche, huevo etc. ella esta muy contenta por que quiere salir adelante con su negocio, el sueño que tiene Severiana es comprar material para construcción y vender ya que tiene un local a lado de sus abarrotes que no se ocupa y sacar provecho del local.
texts.en:
Severiana is a hard-working persevering woman. She is married but none of her children depend on her, as all of them are married. She is known by her nickname of Sevi in her community.

She has had a grocery store for more than 30 years that her parents left her. She is asking for a loan in order to invest in her grocery store. She tells us, "I want to supply my grocery store as this is how my husband and I earn our daily bread and it is all we have, and this is why we are asking for a loan in order for my business to grow." 

She comments that she will buy soap, bleach, cookies, soft drinks, bottles of water, milk, eggs, and other items. She is very happy because she wants to improve her business. 

Severiana's dream is to buy and sell construction material and she already has a place next to her grocery store, which is empty, and she wants to take advantage of it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fish balls, siomi, bakery breads and assorted foods to sell

loans.name: Mabinty Ishmail

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mabinty. She is single and has a child who is nine years old and a student. In 2004, Mabinty established her business selling dishes, slippers, and bowls. She started her business because she left school at primary level and her mother introduced her to business. She began by joining her mother selling vegetables but as she grew older she started her own business. Gradually, her business grew and she was able to accumulate 1,000,000 SLL which she used to start her current business. This business is special to Mabinty because she is making a living out of it and it also gives her security. She works 11-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,200,000 SLL each month. Competition is great but Mabinty buys in quantity to provide what her customers need on time. She serves customers around the city center and is assisted by her cousin. Mabinty’s suppliers are located in Conakry and she usually travels there by public transportation twice a month.

Mabinty is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy slippers, ladies blouses, and rubber bowls to sell. She hopes her loan will increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Mabinty plans to open a big store and give her child a good education and life.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, ladies blouses, and rubber bowls

loans.name: Adalberto Enrique

texts.es: Adalberto, debido a la necesidad en aumentar en sus ventas se ha decidido a tener otro crédito, para mejorar su negocio y comprar más medicina como: jarabe para la tos, pastillas, el objetivo de él es tener más variedad de productos para los clientes y aumentar más en sus ventas. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho aumentando en sus ventas, esto le permitió mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.Lastimosamente se atraso con un mes, pagando tarde y con un porcentaje de mora.
texts.en:
Adalberto has decided to have another loan because he needs to increase his sales to improve his business and buy more medicines such as cough syrup and pills.

His goal is to have a greater variety of products for his customers and increase his sales more.  The previous loans helped him a lot to increase his sales, which allowed him to improve his family's living conditions.  Unfortunately he got behind by one month, paying late and with a late fee.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup and pills to sell.

loans.name: Caren Chepkirui

texts.en:
Caren is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 10 and 12. She describes herself as a focused woman. 
Caren operates a dressmaking shop where she sells and repairs clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in Mauche shopping center in Nakuru town. 
Caren describes her biggest business challenge to be obtaining materials. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy three rolls of material and a sewing machine. Her business goal is to expand her store within five years.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and three rolls of material.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio mario se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,el socio es cocinero y prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,saltado,cuyes al horno,tallarines entre otros platos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para occinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario is continuing with his business selling food.  He is a cook and he prepares a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, saltado (a traditional Peruvian beef dish), roasted guinea pigs, pasta and other dishes.  He works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business he provides for his children.  Mario wants to expand his business selling food.  He requests a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale.

Mario is happy to be getting this loan, and he pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Filomena Maria, tiene 44 años de edad , es casada y tiene un hijo que es mayor de edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Latinas" desde hace tres años y esta formado por 7 integrantes.
la Sra. Filomena María se dedica desde hace cinco años a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir, iniciò con muy poco capital comprando pequeñas prendas desde ropa interior y medias, poco a poco fué aumentando su mercadería y fué creciendo su clientela ya comenzó a vender polos, pantalosnes, para damas, caballeros y niños.
Una de sus metas es lograr tener una boutique, en una local propio ubicado en una zona comercial.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir y atender algunos pedidos de sus clientes hechos con anticipación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Filomena Maria is 44 years old, married and has an adult son.  She is a group member of three years in "Mujeres Latinas," which has a total of seven members.

Filomena has five years experience in the clothing business.  She started with very little capital and invested in small clothing items such as undergarments and socks.  She gradually increased her inventory and grew her client base and began selling shirts and pants for men, women and children.  

One of her goals is to open a boutique in a commercial area. She plans to invest the loan in clothing and fill her pending orders.

loans.use: invest in retail clothing business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ganados vivos que luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y a personas que le solicitan; La socia tiene su local en el cual vende carne de vacuno, la socia compra al por mayor los ganados vivos y los degolla para vender en su carnicería, en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ganados vacunos para la venta; la socia desea implementar a futuro i ampliar su local para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, la socia también comprar maquinaria para trozar y cortar la carne.
texts.en: Trinidad continues with her business buying and selling cattle that she buy live and then sells to customers and to people who request it.  She has a butcher shop where she sells beef.  She buys live cattle at wholesale that she butchers to sell in her butcher shop.  On this occasion she wants to buy cattle to sell.  In the future, she’d like to enlarge her shop to cover customer demand.  She also wants to buy machinery to butcher and cut the meat.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en: Renie is 24 years old and lives in Pob 2, Oroquieta City. He is married with one child. Renie has an automotive shop business and earns approximately PHP  8,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase equipment for his auto repair shop. Renie has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 42 años convive con jorge de 27 años, fruto de este amor tienen 3 hijos con los que viven en una casa alquilada. Marina esta muy ansiosa porque pronto comprará su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, generalmente lo vende en las ferias de su ciudad o de otras ciudades aledañas. Desde que se inicio en éste negocio, fue su esposo quien más la apoyo y a veces él tanto como ella se dirigen a distintas ferias para vender todo la mercadería que tienen. Así juntos traen el ingreso a casa, para que sus menores hijos puedan tener una mejor vida. Pues ahora ambos juntaron un pequeño capital con el que comprarán una vivienda, pues le falta para completar al tope del precio de la casa. Es por ello que decidieron sacar un credito de MFP, por tanto este será su primer credito por el que Marina estáa comprometida en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles completará en el pago de la compra de su vivienda.
texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Marina lives with 27-year-old Jorge.  They have three children whom they live with in a rented home.  Marina is very nervous because soon they will buy their own home.  She sells clothing for a living; generally she sells at fairs in either her city or neighboring cities.  Since she started this business, her partner was the one who supported her the most and sometimes he and she go different fairs to sell all of their merchandise.  Thus, together they are working on a deposit for their home, so that their young children will have a better life.  They have now saved a small amount of capital they will use to buy their home, but they still don't have enough to cover the price of the house.  That's why they decided to take out a loan with MFP.  This will be their first loan and Marina is committed to making her payments on time.  The 1,000 nuevos soles will cover the rest of the payment to purchase their home.

loans.use: to pay for part of the purchase of her home

loans.name: Cachito De Cielo Group

texts.es: El  grupo solidario “Cachito de Cielo” es un grupo mixto formado por un hombre y dos tres mujeres. Todos ellos empresarios, se reunieron para acceder a la financiación para sus pequeños negocios. Argelia de 66 años, ejemplo para muchos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y pelibuey desde hace 15 años. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de los ingresos obtenidos por la venta de frutas en un mercado nacional. Con su crédito desea comprar concentrado, vacunas, alimentos y vitaminas para así ofrecer una calidad sanitaria mejor a sus clientes. Los otros miembros, Mercedes Ramón  de 56 años, hombre luchador que se dedica a la venta de refrescos de manera ambulante; Petronila de 27 años vende ropa nuevas y perfumes; Yerlin de 34 años se dedica a la venta comida en su casa y por encargos

loans.use: desea comprar concentrado, vacunas, alimentos y vitaminas para así ofrecer una calidad sanitaria

loans.name: Stanimira

texts.en:
Stanimira J. is 32 years old and lives in Bourgas. She is a fashion designer by education and her interests have always been in the field of fashion. In 2001 she found a shop on the city trade center and started her business.

She is competitive because of the quality and the low prices of clothes she sells. Stanimira is married and has a two years old. Boy. Her husband is a professional driver and spends most of his worktime abroad.

Stanimira J. needs to supply winter clothes for her shop and she applyes for a $ 1 200 loan.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: I am a single woman, a mother of 4. I sell cooked food. I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Sonia Clara

texts.en:
Sonia makes cheese from cow milk and sells it in the market of Viacha (a rural area an hour and a half away from La Paz), while her husband is a baker. These two activities are their main sources of income to support their 6 children, ages 12, 10, 8, 5, 3 and 1. Sonia an her family live in Achica Baja community on Ingavi province, La Paz (2 hours away from la Paz city). The loan will be used to buy a milk cow so Sonia can make more cheese. It is her second loan and her good credit with our institution allows her to take out further loans, which will help her earn more income and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Sonia, elabora queso de leche de vaca para comercializarlos en la feria de Viacha (localidad rural a 1 hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz), el esposo es panadero, y estas son sus actividades principales generadoras de ingresos para la manutención de sus 6 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 5, 3 y 1 año de edad. Vive en la Comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi de La Paz (a 2 horas de la Ciudad de La Paz) El crédito será destinado para la comprar una vaca lechera, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción de queso. Es el segundo crédito, los buenos antecedentes que tiene en nuestra institución le permiten acceder a otro préstamo que le ayudara a subir sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiares.

loans.use: Capital de inversion

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old, and he has a shop to sell electric equipment in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase an air cooler from another city and sell it in the market. His wedding is in the next couple of months. He wants to prepare himself and work hard to be ready for his new life. He is looking forward to a good future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase air cooler

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda G. Poma, is married and has four children all in school, she is the president of the Asociacion Alemania Pro Mujer (Women's group) in Villa Adela and she makes baby clothes. She also sells different baby products such as feeding bottles, little cars and others. She has been doing this activity since fifteen years ago and her main market is with fair merchants in El Alto. She is a wholeseller and sells her products by the dozen. Currently, Reynalda asks for capital to get merchandise, especially since the end of the year is approaching. She needs to travel for business purposes to the town of Desaguadero, which is where merchandise is concentrated and where most of her income is generated.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynalda Gutiérrez Poma, casada con cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar es presidenta de la Asociación Alemania de Pro Mujer en Villa Adela se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de bebe, como también a la venta de artículos de bebe como ser cochecitos, biberones y otros. Ya son mas de quince años que Reynalda se dedica a esta actividad y su principal mercado se encuentra entre los comerciantes de las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es mayorista y vende sus productos por docena. Actualmente Reynalda precisa de capital para proveerse de mercadería principalmente para la venta de fin de año. Para este propósito ella necesita realizar viajes a la localidad de Desaguadero, lugar de concentración de la mercadería que ella vende y que genera su subsistencia.

loans.use: Reynalda precisa de capital para proveerse de mercadería principalmente para  la venta de fin de año. Para este propósito ella necesita realizar viajes a la localidad de Desaguadero, lugar de concentración de la mercadería que ella vende y que genera su subsistencia.

loans.name: Rolando Richard

texts.es:
Rolando is married and has three children: Rolando 9, Magaly 11 and Waldo 3. His business is selling toys and making overalls. Rolando and his wife have been working at these two businesses for about 3 years. Both make and sell the overalls, and there is little competition in this field. However, there is a lot of competition within the toy-selling business, and the key to success is having good contacts to be able to buy directly from wholesalers outside of Bolivia.

He would use the loan to purchase toys to be sold retail. Prices vary according to product's type and quality; for example, a box of dolls runs about US$25, remote control cars about $135, and remote control motorcycles $14.

Rolando has been granted loans in the past, and he has always made his payments on time and responsibly. Pictured above is Rolando's wife, as he was not available at the time the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Rolando es una persona casada que se dedica a la venta de juguetes y también a la confección de overoles, su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, Rolando de 9 años de edad, Magaly de 11 años y Waldo de 3 años de edad. Rolando junto con su esposa trabajan en ambos rubros aproximadamente 3 años, ambos confeccionan y posteriormente venden los overoles, en este rubro no tienen mucha competencia, pero por otra parte el negocio de venta de juguetes si tienen que enfrentarse a una competencia más elevada, la clave de su negocio es que cuentan con buenos contactos para comprar directamente de los mayoristas fuera de Bolivia. El presente crédito es para la adquisición de juguetes para su posterior comercialización al menor, los precios varian dependiendo del tipo y calidad del juguete por ejemplo el precio de la caja de muñecas es aprox. $us. 25.-, los autos a control remoto $us. 135.-, las motos a control remoto $us. 14.-. Actualmente Rolando cuenta con antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución, está es su cuarta frecuencia en la misma y siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad. se hace notarque cuando se fué a tomar la foto del negocio Rolando no se encontraba, en la foto se ve a su esposa.

loans.use:
OPERATING CAPITAL

CAPITAL DE OPERACIÓN

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo U. is a young woman with 2 children. She is occupied with carpets’ business 7 years. She considers this type of business more profitable and that’s why she wants and wishes her business growth, to buy different types of carpets and make its assortment manifold. She applies to KIVA for the loan and hopes that with the help of this loan she will fulfill her purpose.

loans.use: Increasing goods' assortment

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Four years ago and after completing the contract with the company that she was working for, Cecilia decided to open a shop in her home where she offers an large variety of products for the office, home and other. During this time her situation has improved greatly and this hard working mother is planning to acquire a larger amount of products in order to improve her business for the benefit of her small son. Let us fulfill her request so that this worried mother can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia, hace cuatro años y luego de terminar su contrato con la empresa para la cual laboraba decidió aperturar en casa un pequeño bazar en el que ofrece una inmensa variedad de artículos para la oficina, casa y demás.Durante el tiempo de su desempeño las cosas en casa han mejorado notablemente y el plan de esta trabajadora madre es adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos para consolidar su pequeño espacio de ventas en beneficio de su pequeño hijo.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta preocupada madre alcance la meta que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Additional capital to acquire more inventory

loans.name: Banda B7 A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Dorothy A.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand business. Dorothy is 34 years old and married; her husband is a retail trader. She has 5 children ranging in age from 5 to 15.

Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits and, with the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Dorothy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Dorothy is joined in her small group by Regina N., Gorette N., Mastula N., and Aisha N.. Regina N. has a business selling local brew and wants to add to her business. Gorette Namudu is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to increase stock. Mastula N. operates a business of selling raw foods and wants to expand. Aisha N. is also in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to start a shoe business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Kikabala Central D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kasifa N.. She is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan to purchase more frying pans and flour. Kasifa is 44 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 1 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Kasifa makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Kasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kasifa is joined in her small group by Samya A., Jesca N., Kasifa T., and Hadija B.. Samya A. has a business selling maize and wants to add to the business. Jesca N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to expand her business. Kasifa T. operates a business selling shoes and wants to purchase more shoes to sell. Hadija B. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to start a retail shop business.

loans.use: To add capital to snack business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a single woman who owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for  her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva began selling natural medicines to end the economic hardships of her home. As time has passed and thanks to the income from her sales, the business has flourished.

Currently she has many clients and her clientele is growing thanks to recommendations from satisfied customers.

Now she requests a $975 credit to be returned in six months which she will use to purchase stock at wholesale. She wants to start a sales club with this stock.

Eva has high hopes that with your help, her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Stock purchase

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Don Hilario is fully engaged in the production of onions and wheat, some of them as end products, others as processed products - it all depends on the demand. So he can receive better prices for his work, he has to travel to other parts of the country and this requires a sum of money which he doesn't have at the moment. This is his motive for his request, especially now that harvest time is approaching.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

DON HILARIO, esta plenamente dedicado a la producción de cebollas y trigo algunas veces comercializadas así y otras procesadas, todo dependiendo de la demanda. Para recibir una mejor cotización por su trabajo tiene que desplazarlo a otras partes de su país y su traslado requiere de importantes sumas de dinero con los que no cuenta hoy y ese es el motivo de su petición ya que el tiempo de cosecha se acerca.

loans.use: To transport his goods to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various materials for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.en:
Marisabel is a married, 38-year-old mother of four children. She has a small store in her house, located across from a high school, where she sells home supplies, vegetables, fruit, meat, gifts, licorice, stove gas, and home-made lollipops she prepares. Furthermore, Marisabel has another location where she has an Internet and photocopying service with the help of one employee. Marisabel also sells catalog cosmetics to her friends and relatives.

Marisabel is a member of the Sol Radiante Village Bank where she has learned self-worth, and to save and invest her money. Marisabel needs a loan of 1,050 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in boxed liquor for her business.

Marisabel's dream is to have a hardware store, a construction company, and that her children will continue studying.

loans.use: to invest in boxed liquor for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Risa is 59 years old, a widow and has 5 grown children. Currently two of her unmarried sons live with her as well as one of her daughters, who is a single mother.

She owns a motorcycle which is taken care of and driven by her sons while she takes care of the management of the business. In addition she sells second-hand clothing, which she sells or trades for animals in the small towns around Yarinacocha (in the Pucallpa district). She has been doing this work for the past 4 years and it takes up her entire day. She likes her work very much because she gets to know other places and to meet people.

Rosa works to take care of her expenses and to keep her business going.

She would like to buy replacement parts to fix her motorcycle so her sons can continue to work without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 59 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos que son independientes, en la actualidad vive con dos de sus hijos que son solteros y con una de sus hijas que es madre soltera.

Es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual es cuidado y manejado por sus hijos, mientras ella se encarga de la administración. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la vende o hace intercambio por animales en distintos caseríos de Yarinacocha (Distrito de Pucallpa), viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 4 años y le toma casi todo el día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que conoce muchos lugares y se socializa.

Rosa trabaja para solventar sus propios gastos propios y para mantener activo su negocio.

Desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro, para que sus hijos trabajen tranquilos, sin preocupaciones.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Risueñas Group

texts.es:
Este es el Grupo Risueñas, esta conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras de Ciudad Cadereyta, Nuevo León. Lourdes es la coordinadora del grupo, ella inicio el negocio por necesidad económica, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Comenzó hace 4 años con la compra de los catálogos de zapatos, que empezó a vender a sus familiares y así poco a poco fue haciendo clientes. Ahora necesita de capital para comprar mercancía y entregar a tiempo los pedidos que tiene.

Ernestina inicio el negocio para ayudar económicamente a su mama ya que en ese momento ella se encontraba enferma. Comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de cosméticos, ya que u mama era quien los vendía antes de enfermar por lo que ella decidió continuar con esta labor y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien, sin embargo requiere comprar mercancía para entregar a tiempo varios pedidos, además de comprar otros artículos de belleza.

Yolanda inicio el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y así obtener ingresos extras que le permitieran darles mejor calidad de vida a sus 3 hijos. Comenzó con la venta de cosméticos hace 3 años, por recomendación de su hermana la cual vende los mismos productos. Ahora requiere de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y poder surtir sus pedios.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo por US $700 que pagaran en 3 meses. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
This is the Smiling Group, which is comprised of 3 enterprising women of the city of Caderyta, Nuevo Leon. Lourdes is the coordinator of the group. She began the business due to financial need and to help her husband with the family expenses. She began 4 years ago by purchasing shoe catalogues, which she began to sell to friends and little by little formed a client base. Now she needs capital to purchase merchandise and to deliver her orders on time. Ernestina began her business to provide financial assistance to her mother because right now she is sick. Ernesta began selling cosmetic products two years ago, because her mother used to sell them before she got sick. Because of this, she decided to continue her mother's business and until now she has been met with success. However, she needs to purchase merchandise in order to deliver her various orders on time, and needs to purchase additional beauty products. Yolanda began her business to help her husband with the household expenses so that she could earn an additional income which would permit her and her husband to give their three children a better quality of life. She began selling cosmetic products 3 years ago per her sister's recommendation, who sells cosmetic products as well. Now she needs a loan to purchase merchandise so that she can supply her orders. The women need a $700 loan which they will repay in 3 months. With your help they will come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad Baji is married to Mr. B., and the couple has five children: a son and four daughters. Irshad Baji's son is in 10th grade, while her daughters stay at home and help take care of the household. The family lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Irshad Baji’s husband earns income selling milk to a number of shops and directly to people in the community. Irshad Baji is a housewife and also helps her husband in milking the buffalos. She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Robiyua

texts.ru: Шарипова Робия проживает в районе Гиссар. Вдова. Живет без мужа уже 4 года. Сразу после смерти мужа начала свой бизнес. Занимается торговлей одежды. Таким образом она обеспечивает своих детей. У нее трое маленьких детей, которые все учатся в школе. Для того, чтобы дать им хорошее образование ей приходится много работать. Теперь она планирует увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Robiyua S. lives in the Gissar District. She is a widow, having lived without her husband for four years already. She started her business in clothing sales soon after his death. The business enables her to support her children. She has three young children, who are all going to school. Providing them with a good education requires her to work a lot. Now she plans to use a loan to increase sales. The loan term is 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Felipa Consuelo

texts.es:
Felipa R. se ha destacado en el trabajo de la venta de productos de uso personal el cual ha logrado comercializar en su pequeño establecimiento en el Mercado La Terminal de León. Entre los productos que ella ofrece se encuentran colas, pirañas, limas de uñas, pinturas de labios, entre otras.

Actualmente el negocio de la señora Felipa requiere de inversión en estos productos y para esto ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos para su respectiva comercialización. Con este crédito logrará mejorar sus ventas y podrá continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
Felipa R. has concentrated on the sale of products for personal use, that she has been able to commercialize in her small establishment in the market “La Terminal de León.” Among the products that she offers are nail files and lipstick. Felipa’s business requires the investment in such products and for this she has come to Ceprodel to be helped with a loan that would allow her to acquire the products for her respective business. With this loan she seeks to better her sales and will be able to continue bringing support to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana S. lives in Ucrainca village in the Causeni district. Since 1983 and till now, she has been working in the middle school of Ucrainca village, currently a primary grades teacher, but she previously worked as a teacher of mathematics and the Romanian language at a school in the same locality. She has never had any other loans through Microinvest.

Ioana, together with her husband, has a sheepfold with 40 sheep, and they want to increase the number of sheep to produce more milk because they have a little business with the milk: they sell to customers in the city who buy their milk at a lower price.

The loan was requested to increase the number of sheep.

loans.use: increase the number of sheep they tend

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Doña Juana C. cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar cortes típicos en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea ChiP., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana C. is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children. Both she and her husband are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 18 years from their home in the ChiP. Village, in the Totonicapá district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Juana has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she and her husband can increase their weekly sales. With this loan, they hope to help their children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Thoang's Group

texts.en:
This small group loan is requested by three people, all residents of Battambang Province. Its leader, Mrs. P., 55, has a small family with other five members. She is a good homemaker who cooks delicious meals for her family and cares for the children. The family's daily expense is supported by P.'s husband, who works as a staff member of ECC Association and gets a salary $200 a month. The couple has four children: one is a student and the other three are married and live away from home. P. has a hard time cooking because her kitchen is small and ugly; therefore, she is asking for a loan to build a new kitchen.

The other two borrowers are:

D., age 46, raises animals from home for sale and she requests a loan to purchase piglets and chickens to raise.

C. is single, aged 27. He is staff member for an organization and he is asking for a loan to buy a computer to support his work.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Ochahon

texts.ru: Очахон работает в колхозе. Сейчас сезон полевых работ и она постоянно на работе. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее муж тоже работает в колхозе. Заработную плату деньгами выплачивают редко и в основном идет натуроплата – пшеницей, рисом и тп. Чтобы поддержать семейный бюджет дополнительно откармливают скот дома. В этом им помогают дети. Купив бычков в течении нескольких месяцев откармливаю и продав на полученную прибыль совершают расходы семьи. Для Очахон это первый займ и она планирует потратить его на покупку маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Ochahon works on a collective farm. This is field work season and she is constantly at work. She is 46 years old, is married and has 4 children. Her husband also works on the collective farm. Salaries are rarely paid with money and the pay is usually in kind – wheat, rice, etc. In order to sustain the family budget they also raise livestock at home. Their children help them. After buying calves over a period of several months they fatten them and after selling them, use the profits for family expenditures. This is a first loan for Ochahon and she plans to use it to purchase a small calf.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Mrs. Beverly J. is of legal age, married, and a resident of Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She engages in selling vegetables, spices, and root crops. Her stall can be found in the market. She is blessed with six children, three of whom are still studying. Beverly is an active member of Paglaum MPC and already accessed loans four times to support her business. Through this business, she hopes to have enough income for their family and for the education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and root crops to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek has owned a toy and accessory shop for three years. He is a 38-year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He has requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

Malek knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had to face competition. Malek decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a toy and accessory shop

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos E. F. tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Santos  se dedica a la venta de cerveza y en los fines de semana vente comida rápida, al inicio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, encontrando mas adelante un negocio más rentables en la venta de cerveza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos (yuca, arroz, cebolla, limones).
Con este crédito de 1700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza al por mayor.
Santos tiene como sueño terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Santos E. F. is 43 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, in La Libertad, Perú.  She completed her Secondary school education, and has 1 daughter that depends on her financially. Santos dedicates herself to selling beer, and on weekends she sells fast food. She started out selling beauty products, but later found the sale of beer to be more profitable. She runs her business out of her home. With the first loan she received from her cooperative bank Fighting Romans II, she invested in the purchase of ingredients for making food (yucca, rice, onion, lemons). With this loan of 1700 soles, she will invest in the purchase of beer at wholesale. Santos’ dream is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Doralicía Benítez formed this committee. She lives in the Fátima district of Ciudad del Este, is the mother of two children, and works selling hens. She contacted her neighbors and friends in order to form this committee in their area.

The committee is named the 8th of December, and is made up of 18 very active and supportive women, all from the same area. They have many different activities, such as selling: pants, t-shirts, tomatoes, onions, garlic, facial cream, apples, bananas, sodas, cookies, sweets, melons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, dustpans, detergent, fabric softener, meats, etc. Some women are starting their own businesses. All of the women asked for credit between 300,000 and 1,000,000 Paraguayan guaranis. The credit will go toward the purchase of merchandise and raw materials for sale.

1 Maria Felicia B. Small grocery store 2 Rafaela B. Dressmaker 3 Doralicia B. Hen sales 4 Rosalina M. Sales of foodstuffs 5 Bartola D. Ice cream sales 6 Guillermina G. Cosmetic sales 7 Ramona B. Ice cream sales 8 Lilian F. Vegetable sales 9 Gabina D. Sugar sales 10 Rocio I. Clothing sales 11 Nimia E. Clothing sales 12 Amancia V. Hamburger sales 13 Librada A. Sale of Cleaning products 14 Sara R. Candy sales 15 Aurelia G. Food sales 16 María N. Small grocery store 17 Nilsa A. Hen sales 18 Emilce A. Vegetable sales

loans.use: To buy hens for sale

loans.name: Ruben Ruíz

texts.en:
Mr. Rubén Ruíz Díaz is from the city of Roque González.  He is 40 years old, single, and lives in the Immaculada Concepción neighborhood. 

Rubén travels and sells comforters, hammocks and tablecloths, which are all artisan products.  He sells these products in San Lorenzo, about 80 km from where he lives.  He also has a small grocery store that generates income.  He will use the loan for the purchase of comforters and blankets to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of comforters and blankets

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia S. is from the village of Malibangcao in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 40 years old. Lorgenia is married. To make a living, Lorgenia plants and harvests corn, banana, and coconut to sell. Lorgenia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lorgenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorgenia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lorgenia's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Urruz Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Arroz tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, casado y su esposa le tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejora  a su casa, el trabaja como técnico en las maquinas de tragamonedas. Con este crédito es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias ya que podrá invertir en materiales de construcción para anexar un cuarto y poder tener mejor privacidad como comodidad para su familia. También espera tener salud y trabajo para poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien el cual será una sastifaccion de padre.
texts.en:
Urruz is 39, and he lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married, and they have two minor children. Their plan is to be able to finish making improvements to their house. He works as a technician on slot machines. This loan is his second loan cycle with Afodenic. He is grateful that he will be able to buy construction materials to add a room and have the comfort of better privacy for his family. He hopes to have good health and work to be able to help his children so that they can have an education. This would be a father’s satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to add a room

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice I. is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her husband Lucas is a driver. Two of her daughters are in the university. Her other children are in high school and primary school. 

Eunice hawks (sells door-to-door) clothes around the Kangemi area, a very highly populated,low and medium-income neighborhood in Nairobi. Due to the nature of her business, she is in a position to meet many people, unlike those who are confined to one region.This enables her to maximize her returns, and she can visit her clients wherever they are.

Eunice was introduced to KADET by her friends who were already in a group. She had never borrowed from other sources before. After repaying her first loan well and on time, she decided to apply for a second one to add clothes to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business by increasing her stock and diversifying her goods. She also intends to build her own house so that she can save on rent and be able to educate her children comfortably.

loans.use: Eunice plans to increase her stock of clothes and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Linaria

texts.es: Linaria tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy hábil en el trabajo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ricardo D. 58 años y sus 2 hijos: Joel D. 20 y Jordán D. 15 años, y tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante y darle una buena vida a su familia. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), ella venD. ropa y su puesto es muy concurrido porque es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre trata muy bien a sus clientes, lo cuales no dudan en comprar en su stand debido a los novedoso modelos que ofrece. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es combinar las prendas con las que vestirá a sus maniquíes, ya que sabe que eso es una muy buena forma D. atraer a los clientes. Lleva 26 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su puesto. Por tal motivo, su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda D. ropa donD. brinD. un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que siente que tiene que dar el ejemplo en su banco comunal, del cual es una D. las fundadoras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor el stock D. su puesto.
texts.en:
Linaria is 56 years old and a very clever businesswoman. She lives in her own home with her husband Ricardo, who is 58 years old. They have two children, Joel (age 20) and Jordán (age 15). She is very eager to succeed and proviD. a good life for her family.

Her business is located in the Tupac Amaru Market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca). Linaria sells clothing and happens to be well-known as a vendor because she is very charismatic and always tries to get along well with her customers. She always offers the newest styles, so customers never hesitate to buy something from her clothing stand. What she likes most about her job is dressing the mannequins in different outfits, because this is a great way of attracting customers. Linaria has been in business for 26 years and says the hardest part is having to manage her clothing stand the entire day. For this reason, she hopes to open a clothing store where she can proviD. better service to her customers.

Linaria is taking her sixth loan with MFP and she has always been responsible with her payments. She feels she has to set an example for the rest of her Communal Bank because she was one of its founding members. With her loan of 3000 soles, she will order more clothes so that she can increase the inventory at her vending post.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells cooked food by carrying it from place to place in a wheelbarrow. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Irayda América

texts.es: Irayda América R. F. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Irayda tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija la pequeña Doris de 6 años estudiante de parvularia. Irayda se dedica a la costura elaborando ropa y accesorios para el hogar, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la cual quiere mejorar a través de este crédito, ya que no cuenta con el suficiente espacio para trabajar y desea construir un pequeño cuarto para instalar su negocio

loans.use: construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 17 and 12, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and both her daughters go to a local high school. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town while B. operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in the family’s ger and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings.

B.'s working capital now exceeds 450,000 tugrug (~316 USD) and she has established a loyal customer following because of her delicious, quality meals. B. is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~630 USD) loan so that she can purchase food supplies and a new stove for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and a new stove for her business

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza A. originaria de Candelaria del departamento de Cuscatlán, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 21, 14, 11 y 5 años de edad. José esposo de María trabaja como albañil y María se dedica a su negocio con veintidós años de experiencia en la elaboración de puros, las ventas que María realiza son dos veces por semana, cuando ella sale a ofrecer su producto, pero todos días tiene que trabajar en la producción de los mismos para acumular una cantidad suficiente para vender, ella solicita un crédito para invertir en materia prima y así aumentar la producción de puros.
texts.en:
María Esperanza A. from Candelaria in the department of Cuscatlán lives with her husband and her four children (21, 14, 11, and 5). José, María's wife, works as a mason, and María has worked for 22 years operating a cigar-making business. María sells her cigars twice a week, but she works every day making her product to accumulate enough to sell. She is applying for a loan to invest in prime materials and thus increase her production of cigars.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of prime materials to make cigars

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo (Florentino), de 59 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Flora de 19, Geraldine de 15 y Brayan de 5 años de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño mercado ubicado cerca de su casa, aquí ofrece diversidad de platos, como el tan solicitado ceviche. De esta forma abastece los almuerzos de otros comerciantes del mercado y las personas que concurren para realizar sus compras. 
La sazón de Feliciana es muy buena, pues a ella siempre le ha gustado la cocina, siendo para ella una actividad muy divertida, aunque muchas veces tiene tantos comensales que no se abastece en atenderlos a todos.
Por otro lado, al encontrarse tan cerca de su casa puede velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y esto la tiene tranquila y contenta.
Actualmente su negocio está arrojando buenas ganancias, pero ella cree que le sería más útil abrir un restaurante en su vivienda, así tendría más espacio y podría brindar mayores comodidades a la clientela, es por ello que está trabajando duro para llegar a este sueño.

Este es el primer préstamo de Feliciana con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para elaborar sus platillos y así tener más clientela y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 41, lives with her husband (Florentino, 59), and their three children: Flora, 19, Geraldine, 15, and Brayan, 5, in their own home. She sells prepared meals in a small market near her home. She offers a variety of selections, like the ever-popular ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic). This is how she provides meals for other merchants in the market and to market customers who come to do their shopping. Feliciana's dishes are very tasty because she has always liked to cook, an activity which is very enjoyable for her, although sometimes she has so many diners that she can barely take care of them all. On the other hand, being able to be so close to home allows her to watch over her children and this keeps her happy and worry-free. Currently, her business is producing good profits but she thinks it would be more useful to open a restaurant in her home; she would have more space and be able to provide more comfort for her clientele. She is working hard toward achieving this goal. This is Feliciana's first loan with MFP and she commits to being very responsible with repayment. With the funds she is requesting now she will buy larger quantities of ingredients to prepare her meals so that she can have more customers and have her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta D. ovejas criollas.
La señora Isabel no tiene estudios y tiene 5  hijos..
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 meses atrás. Su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. ovejas.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. ovejas cara negra.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar mas animales como toros y así poder vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the "24 D. Junio" Community Bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the town of Puno. Isabel is 50 years old and is married. She has 5 children and has not had an education. Her business involves buying and selling native sheep. Isabel worked with "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" 6 months ago and obtained a loan for S/.500.00 soles, which she used to purchase sheep. Now, she has requested an additional loan of S/ 1200.00 soles, which she will use again to purchase more sheep (blackface breed). Her hope for the future is to purchase more animals like bulls so that she can have a better life. What she enjoys about the "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" organization are the savings and the meetings they hold.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE UNA OVEJA CARA NEGRA (purchase of "blackfaced" sheep)

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida A., 43, is from the village of Cabaruan. She is married. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en:
Oluwole is 42 years old and is married with three children, his youngest being 10 years old. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells groceries to make a living.

Oluwole sells generator parts at retail prices to his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more generator parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Oluwole is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more generator parts to sell

loans.name: Delbor

texts.es:
Delbor es un hombre laborioso de 33 años, vive con su esposa Clerina, de la misma edad; con ella tiene 2 hijos: Jazmín de 10 y Diana de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia en lo alto de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, arveja y flores (gladiolos). Cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su esposa y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar las papas y ver como florecen, pues las flores le anuncian la productividad que obtendrá, y como siempre se esmera por mantener sus tierras bien cuidadas casi nunca pierde sus cosechas. Pero lo que no le gusta es que a veces debe luchar contra las inclemencias del clima como las lluvias, que retrasa sus labores; a pesar de ello considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable porque le permite cubrir la educación de sus hijos y los gastos de primera necesidad de su casa.
Para el futuro, Delbor desea sembrar en mayor cantidad, además quiere implementar una tienda en la ciudad donde pueda vender productos comestibles.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contento de trabajar en su banco comunal donde pertenece a la junta directiva y motiva a sus compañeros ha ser organizados y responsables para acceder a posteriores créditos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar 5 botellas de fungicidas para fumigar sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Delbor is a hard-working 33-year-old man. He lives with his wife Clerina, who is the same age. They have 2 children: Jazmín is 10 and Diana is 4. They live in their own house high in the mountains of Peru. For 12 years Delbor has devoted himself to agriculture, growing potatoes, peas and flowers (gladiolus). He relies on his wife's unconditional help, and what he likes best about his work is growing potatoes and seeing how the plants flower, since the flowers show him the size of the crop. Since he always makes an effort to take good care of his land, he almost never loses his harvests. What he doesn't like is that he sometimes has to fight inclement weather, like rain, that holds up his work. Despite this, he believes his work is quite profitable because it allows him to pay for his children's education and for basic household expenses. In the future, Delbor wishes to sow greater quantities of seed. He also wants to open a store in the city where he can sell groceries. This is the third loan he has had with MFP, and he is happy to work in his communal bank where he is on the board of directors and motivates his partners to be organized and responsible in order to have access to loans later. With the money he requests now, he plans to buy 5 bottles of fungicide in order to spray his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fungicides

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita acaba de cumplir 40 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos; Juan de 11 y Dora de 8.
Su negocio es un bazar, donde vende desde ropa hasta cosméticos. Su local está situado en el mercado de su distrito, lugar muy concurrido. Cuando empezó fue muy difícil porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y se enfermaban constantemente, por lo que el dinero no le alcanzaba para pagar todas sus cuentas. Pero su perseverancia, más el apoyo de su esposo, la ayudó salir adelante; ahora está más tranquila y su negocio es más estable. 
Empieza sus labores a las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 8 de la noche, pese que este negocio absorbe todo su tiempo, se siente bien con lo que hace, ya que desde niña su madre le enseñó a trabajar en el comercio.
Para el futuro, Sarita planea construir varios pisos en su casa, pues en su vejez quiere vivir del alquiler de sus habitaciones.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP e indica que será puntual, como siempre lo ha sido en sus pagos, ya que desea salir adelante para educar a sus hijos. La organización de su grupo la tiene muy contenta porque son personas responsables y no la hacen quedar mal, pues ella es la coordinadora. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cuadernos y otros útiles escolares, pues se viene la temporada escolar y estos artículos serán muy demandados.
texts.en:
Sarita has just had her 40th birthday, is married, and has two children: Juan aged 11, and Dora aged 8. She runs a store where she sells everything from clothing to cosmetics. It is situated in the district market, a busy location. When she started the business, it was very difficult as her children were small and were often sick, so the money she earned wasn’t enough to pay all the bills. But she persevered, her husband helped out, and she got through that period. Now her life is calmer and her business more stable. Sarita begins work at 7 in the morning and finishes at 8 in the evening. In spite of the fact that her work takes up all her time, she is happy with what she does as her mother taught her when she was a young girl how to run a business. As for the future, Sarita plans to add several floors to her house, as when she is older, she wants to earn money by renting out rooms. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She says that she will be punctual with her loan repayments--which she always has been in the past--as she wants to get ahead and provide a good education for her children. She is very happy with the organisation of her group as they are responsible people and she doesn’t want to cause any problems for them. Sarita is the coordinator. The money she is asking for will be used to buy notebooks and other school supplies because the back-to-school season is approaching and these items will be much in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store, her main source of income coming from selling food products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $350 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marcia Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Marcia I. vive en la comunidad de Maluay en la parroquia El Valle, esta localidad  es  reconocida por  que es una gran productora de maíz y papas, su gente mayor se dedica a la agricultura y los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad o al extranjero en busca de un mejor porvenir.

Marcia tiene 28 años de edad, se encuentra casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su localidad, su esposo es carpintero y aún  no han logrado construir su casa por lo que viven en la casa de un familiar.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la limpieza de oficinas, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 8am. a 12 pm. tiene 2 años trabajando en este oficio, también se dedica a la cría de chanchos inculcada  por sus padres, además  va a incursionar en la ventas por catálogo de la línea  de cosméticos y bisutería Yanbal.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la fundación gracias a la invitación de su prima a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres organizadas que luchan para tener días mejores, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo   va a comprar cremas, tratamientos, labiales, sombras, perfumes y más  productos YANBAL  y pagar una deuda adquirida por la compra de  un electrodoméstico para su hogar.

Su gran sueño es salir adelante junto a su familia y entregar  lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcia I. lives in the town of Maluay, in El Valle parish. This area is known for producing corn and potatoes. The older generations in the area work in agriculture, while the younger ones have either migrated to the city or gone abroad in search of a better future.

Marcia is a 28-year-old married mother with 2 children, ages 10 and 8, who attend the local elementary school. Her husband is a carpenter, but they have not been able to build their own house, which is why they are currently living at a relative's house.

Our client cleans offices for a living. Her work schedule is Monday-Friday, 8am to 12pm. She has been in business for 2 years now. She also raises pigs for a living, an activity which she learned from her parents. Furthermore, she is going to start selling Yanbal cosmetics and fashion jewelry by catalog.

She is currently in her third loan cycle with our institute, thanks to the fact that her cousin invited her to join this group of organized women who struggle for better days. She states that the loans have greatly benefited her business. With this new loan, she will purchase lotions, skin products, lipsticks, eye shadow, fragrances and other Yanbal products. She will also pay off a debt that she incurred when purchasing a home appliance.

Her greatest wish is for her and her family to get ahead, and to be able to give her children the very best.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal beauty products and pay off a debt

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana R., vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca, llamada Chinas Unidas, tiene dos niños los cuales se encuentran bajo su custodia, fue operada de la vesicula, y tras esto se le ha dificultado la convivencia diaria con sus hijos por sus achaques, que le han impedido una vida cotidiana, su compañero de vida le apoya económicamente

Es por esta razón que solicita un pestamo para la culminación de la construcción de su hogar, especificamente desea construir un muro en la parte lateral de su casa, esto les favorezera  a la familia a habitar en un espacio mas digno y sobretodo seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Ana R. lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She works in a company in a tax-free zone called Chinas Unidas. She has two children who are under her care. She had gallbladder surgery, which has made her family life difficult because her ailments hindered her daily life. Her partner supports her economically. For this reason, Ana is asking for a loan to finish building her house. Specifically, she wants to build a wall on the side part of her house. This will allow the family to live in a more dignified and--more than anything--safe space for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building side wall in home

loans.name: Clive Road W. G. Of Jinja Group

texts.en:
Z. Cathy is 46 and is married with two children. She operates her twenty-year-old garment sales business in Jinja central market.

80,000 shillings is the amount this experienced businesswoman makes in a month. This is paltry for a woman with no other form of income. It is for this reason that Cathy wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects.

By her own account, the future of her business is promising once Cathy gets this loan. With it she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease of life.

loans.use: To purchase more surplus garments for her business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is a widow with two grown children. She worked at a shoe factory, however, it went bankrupt and Larisa was downsized. This is when she started considering being a private entrepreneur. Larisa launched her small enterprise back in 2000. She lost her husband due to the wrong diagnosis which caused his sudden death. Larisa was forced to find ways to provide for her kids and decided to start a small retail business in her hometown of Belaya Tserkov. Larisa sells household chemicals, perfumes, shampoos, souvenirs, etc. She owns a small retail store and works extra hours to earn additional income. Larisa has 30,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her gross monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Larisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase new merchandise, i.e. cosmetics and wall clocks. Better selection of inventory will result in higher demand and more stable income as well. Larisa is very enterprising and determined. She is ready to work extra days and hours to ensure a better living for her children who have become the center of her life.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Desde el año 2002 Aída Luz  Díaz A., puso en marcha  su idea de negocio concebida desde mucho antes de tener sus hijos, pero empezó en esta época porque priorizó las actividades propias del hogar y la educación personal de ellos. En la actualidad aun sigue como comerciante y además de  vender  calzado, correas bolsos, simultáneamente prepara alimentos y refrescos, como gaseosas y  chichas combinadas almuerzos para sus clientes del barrio y familiares que multiplican su publicidad y le traen referidos.

A sus 43 años aun vive en el barrio la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, un lugar muy cerca al estadio de Futbol Metropolitano  de Barranquilla”,  con sus tres hijos en edades de 16, 19 y 23 años, que son una gran motivación y la impulsan a crear opciones de ingreso constantemente. Aida Luz Díaz dice que los créditos le ha servido para mejorar sus ingresos, sacar adelante a sus hijos en el tema educativo y aumentar sus utilidades, por eso en la actualidad solicita su tercer  crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.500.000,  ella va comprar mercancías al por mayor y de contado como calzado, correas bolsos y materias primas e insumos  para la preparación de  almuerzos especiales en el día de la madre, mes en el que espera un repunte importante en sus venta y puede conseguir descuentos al comprar en mayor cantidad.

Su desafío constante es la fuerte competencia  pero diariamente mejora sus habilidades para sostenerse  con calidad  y ofrece plazos cómodos acompañados de una atención esmerada a sus clientes. Ahora su meta principal y también gran desafío, es construir una habitación para mas adelante montar un almacén en una de las esquinas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
In 2002, Aida Luz D. A. put into practice her business idea which she had years before she had children; she didn't start it till 2002 because she prioritized her household duties and her children's education. Now she works as a saleswoman selling shoes, belts, and purses; at the same time, she prepares meals and drinks, like soft drinks and chica (a local beverage), for her customers and relatives in her neighborhood--they all give her more publicity which brings in more business. She is 43 years old and lives in the Cuidadela 20 de Julio neighborhood, an area very close to the Barranquilla Metropolitan Football Stadium, with her three children who are 16, 19 and 23 years old. They are a great source of motivation for her and constantly encourage her to generate new income. Aida Luz D. says that the loans she has received have helped her to increase her income and help her children in their education and in what she can provide for them; this is why she is seeking a 3rd loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo of $750. She will use it to buy wholesale merchandise like shoes, belts and purses and ingredients for her food sales business; this is particularly important this month with Mother's Day as it will be a month of high demand and she will be able to get discounts if she buys in larger quantities. Her constant challenge is the amount of competition she faces but daily she tries to improve her abilities to support herself through better quality and offering good prices and good customer service. Her primary goal and challenge is to build an additional portion of her home that she can use as a warehouse in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise like shoes, belts, and purses, and ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Nhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhen P. is 55 years old and a villager in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a widow with two children – one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student in the local school. Mrs. Nhen P. is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Besides farming, she is also a farm laborer for which she receives a small salary to support her family.
For her farm, Mrs. Nhen P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Zelah Group

texts.en:
Varbah H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Zelah'. She is 39 years old, single and has 3 children who range from 12 to 23 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to financial constraints. All of her children are attending school and she also cares for one sibling.

For more than 3 years, she has been selling charcoal and salt at Waterside Market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 42,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more of bags of charcoal and salt. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman.

Her plan is to improve her business and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more of bags of charcoal and salt

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Despite of her low educational level (elementary), Liezel R., 28, possess a great amount of drive and passion.  She wants to run a fish selling business.

Her loving fisherman husband has given her emotional security which opens her mind and enhances her strength.  Her three loving children are her inspiration. 

Liezel’s children range in age from 3-5 years old.  As a mother, she is working to give them a better and brighter future.  She also wished to earn money and augment her husband’s income to help support their family.
