Liezel recently joined ASHI and is requesting a loan for her fish business.  She plans to buy supplies to make a raft for fishing that will be managed by her husband. So, aside from buying and selling her fish, she would also sell her husband’s catch.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making a raft for fishing and purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia V. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 44 years old. Ofelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers and managing a flower farm. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Par Cisse Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de PAR C. a été inauguré le 04 décembre 2007, au sortir de son Assemblée Générale Constitutive. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village qui porte également le même nom que le Banc Villageois. Le Banc Villageois est à sa troisième année et ses membres ont 06 fois bénéficié de crédit de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE. 

Madame NGONE SAER S., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est la Présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle a aussi la charge d'1 neveu.

Elle faisait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide comme activité. Mais avec son nouveau Crédit elle va changer d'activité en faisant de l'embouche ovine. 

Son prêt de 50.000 franc CFA lui permettra d'acheter un mouton et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser l'animal pendant au moins 4 mois avant de le revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Surtout en ce qui concerne la scolarité de ses enfants et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Par C. "Banc Villageois" was established December 4, 2007, following its initial General Assembly. The "Banc Villageois" is composed of 29 women from the village of the same name. The "Banc Villageois" is in its third year and its members have benefited from six loans by CAURIE micro-finance. Mrs. Saer S. Ngone, standing at the right of the picture, is President of the "Banc Villageois". She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. She also cares for one nephew. Mrs. Ngone used to make and sell peanut oil, but with her new loan she will change her business and start fattening sheep. She will use her 50,000 franc loan to buy one sheep and animal feed, which will allow her to fatten the animal for at least 4 months before she sells it in the weekly markets in her area. Her goal is to contribute to improving the living conditions of her family, especially with respect to schooling her children and food.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sheep

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Madame Adjo D. sells health products and medicines at her small store in Lome, Togo. She has been in this business since 2008 and is looking to expand a little. She is ready to take her second microloan from WAGES and has requested 500,000 CFA in order to purchase many different kinds of products to sell as merchandise in her shop. 

Madame D. is the sole caregiver for her only child, and so any increased income she receives as a result of your investment in her business will allow her to better care for her child.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and other products

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris M. M. is 28 years old and married with one child.  He has been running his retail shop for only one year.  In addition, he runs a cafeteria and a butcher shop. He was previously working as a shopkeeper before he decided to open his own shop.  He is a member of Faulu Kenya under a group called Imani but has never taken out a loan.  Now, he wants to take out a loan of 80,000 Kes.  With the loan, he will add stock of mobile phone air time, rice, sugar and soda.  He hopes to improve his business in the future.  In ten years, he wants to buy a plot and build his own business premises.

loans.use: To add stock of mobile phone air time, rice, sugar and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy essential materials for his bakery

loans.name: Pez Globo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Pez Globo, porque la mayoría de las integrantes venden globos y otras cuantas venden pescado en los tianguis. Está ubicado en Atlacomulco en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. 

Patricia M. González es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el 2º año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total seis hijos (2 mujeres y 4 hombres). Ella se dedica a la venta de globos que inició hace 23 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar globos metálicos y tanque de gas helio para inflar los globos. Sus clientes en su gran mayoría son niños o según la ocasión puede ser que también consuman los novios o esposos, su mercado es en las calles de la Ciudad de México (Parque Residencial en Coacalco), además de zonas concurridas como parques, explanadas, centros recreativos, etc. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y motivada. Quiere este crédito para  la temporada del 01 y 02 de noviembre, navidad y dia de reyes, ya que la venta es buena en estos días. También espera terminar de estudiar la primaria y secundaria, actualmente está estudiando la primaria en el sistema abierto (INEA), además tiene el objetivo de remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called Pez Globo ("Balloon Fish") because the majority of the members sell balloons and the others sell fish at street markets.  They are situated in Atlacomulco in the State of Mexico.  The group is composed of 12 members.

Patricia M. G. is the president of this group.  She is 43 years old and has a total of six children (2 girls and 4 boys).  She has only studied up to second grade.  She is a vendor and sells balloons, which she began doing over 23 years ago.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase metallic balloons and helium gas tanks to use to inflate them.  The majority of her customers are children, or depending on the occasion, sometimes they can also include boyfriends and husbands.  Aside from crowded areas, like parks, esplanades, recreation centers, etc., she also sells her products on the streets of Mexico City (a residential park in Coacalco).  As she applies for this loan, she is content and motivated.  She would this credit for the 1st and 2nd of November, Christmas, and the Three Wise Kings Day, since sales rise on those days.  Also, she hopes to finish elementary and middle school.  Currently, she is finishing her primary education through the open system (INEA).  Lastly, she wants to remodel her house.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Vilma Ester

texts.es:
la señora Vilma C. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la Aldea la Cabeza del departamento de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de carne de res,  actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años.
Vilma es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable según los vecinos que viven junto a ella, hacen buenos comentarios acerca de su forma de ser, su negocio es muy visitado ya que es la unica persona que destaza en la comunidad.
Vilma cuenta con el apoyo total de su esposo es agricultor.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas carne de res asi tendra mayores ventas y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma C., age 49, lives in the village of La Cabeza in the Choluteca department.  She sells beef, and she has been doing this for five years.  Vilma is a very hard-working, honorable, and responsible woman according to her neighbors who live near her.  They had good things to say about her way of being.  Her business is much frequented because she is the only person who butchers in the community.

Vilma has total support from her husband, a farmer.

She will use the loan to buy more beef.  That way she will have greater sales and more income.  She needs the income to cover the household expenses and for her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a household appliance

loans.name: Nasipkan

texts.en:
Nasipkan B. is a 52-year-old farmer with two children. Nasipkan’s husband is also engaged in livestock breeding. During 28 years of their marriage, they have been supporting each other in all activities, which serves as the best example of a happy couple for their children.   

To find means of income for the family, in 1998, Nasipkan and her husband started to breed cattle, using their start-up capital of only 5,000 KGS. Today Nasipkan has a small farm and manages to earn about 6,000 KGS monthly by selling meat products at the local market.  

Nasipkan is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy livestock to fatten and resell. With the revenues from this investment, Nasipkan dreams of buying a house for her son.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the most vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child, who is not currently in school.  Teddy has a hotel business, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish as another business. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and taking care of herself.  In the future, Teddy hopes to study hair dressing. Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her a chance to being self employed.

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has been operating a clothes selling business for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She sells Khanga’s from door to door. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase stocks of Khanga’s for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it has few legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of Khanga’s for sale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Alugbate, Brgy. Gil Montilla , Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: selling vegetables, a tricycle transport and a livestock business. Her husband, Efren, age 48, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 15 to 26 years old. Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,800 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Rosalie E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona bastante conocida por producir limón y maracuyá, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, específicamente en el cultivo de limón. El cuenta con una parcela de cultivo en donde cultiva este producto y lo cosecha permanentemente para luego ofrecerlo en venta a los diversos acopiadores de la zona y al público en general. El cuanta con bastante experiencia en el manejo de estos cultivos y siempre se esfuerza por mantener su negocio ya que de el depende el sustento económico de su familia.

Máximo desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de modo que pueda asegurarse una buena producción, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maximo is 56 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children in one of the farmhouses in the agricultural district of Olmos; an area well known for producing limes and passion fruit.  It's in the province of Lambayeque and is more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of limes.  He has a parcel of land where he grows them and harvests constantly so he can sell the limes to the various wholesalers in the area, and to the general public.  He has a lot of experience in the management of these crops and always works hard to maintain his business, as he depends on it to support his family.

Maximo would like to acquire some fertilizers to be able to nourish his crops in a way that will secure good production.  To achieve his goal, he has requested 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for the nourishment of crops

loans.name: Viviana Esther

texts.es:
Barranquillera de nacimiento y con una hermosa hija de 9 años,   desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de mercancías como calzado, cosméticos, electrodomésticos juguetería, papelería y útiles escolares; tiene otra actividad que le genera otros ingresos en la prestación de servicios  de pedicure, manicure corte , siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y vive muy feliz por tener el negocio en su casa y no desatender a su pequeña hija , actualmente se capacita a través del Sena en la elaboración de calzado artesanal.
Su negocio llamado Miscelánea Emanuel, esta situado en el barrio Carrizal al sur  de Barranquilla en una vivienda  familiar que comparte con sus padres y su abuela; está dotado de una  buena infraestructura y adquirió   activos fijos, como vitrina estantería  y exhibidores de mercancías,  con sus ahorros de varios años, cumpliendo su  meta de lograr una buena presentación   y   esto fue con  mucho esfuerzo. Los clientes con los que cuenta  son personas naturales y vecinos del barrio carrizal y de sus  aledaños  en los cuales es bien conocida, porque Viviana  aprendió su actividad mercantil de una tía que la  enseñó e impulsó a seguir adelante, todo  con el propósito de  ayudar a su hija a darle un mejor futuro,  después de la separación de su esposo. 
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también su credikiva,   el cual invertirá  en la compra al por mayor de calzado y obtendrá un 30% descuentos por la compra de  contado,  de esta manera  su margen  de utilidad aproximado seria de un 50%;  en la actualidad su promedio de ventas  en su  Miscelánea Emanuel  es de  $1.000.000 COP mensuales, con su crédito se incrementaran las ventas, por su nuevo capital   y por  ofrecer  un mejor servicio; también   invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares,  pues es usual que el primer trimestre del año   sea de gran  demanda de estos artículos.  Su inversión  seria exitosa   porque adicionalmente  tiene una clientela con un buen comportamiento de pago,   un proceso de selección, es muy positiva y creyente y además  ya tiene el  80% de la demanda  de estos productos resuelta  por su buena calidad.
Viviana V.  es una mujer soñadora y trabajadora, ella aspira a tener su propia casa y ubicar a su hija en un entorno para que tenga un futuro exitoso y un  taller de marroquinería generador de  empleo.
texts.en:
From Barranquilla by birth and with a beautiful 9 year old daughter, for the last year she has sold merchandise like footwear, cosmetics, home appliances, toys, paper goods and school supplies.  She has another income producing activity: providing pedicure, manicure and haircut services.  She has always enjoyed being independent and she lives very happy because her business is home based and she can watch over her daughter.  She is currently taking artisanal shoemaking courses through SENA (National Education Service).

Her business is called Miscelánea Emanuel (Emanuel Miscellany).  It is located in the Carrizal neighborhood in south Barranquilla in the family home she shares with her parents and grandmother.  It has good infrastructure and she acquired fixed assets, like glass shelving and merchandise display cases, using saving from several years back thereby meeting her goal of attaining good appearance; she managed this with much effort.

Her usual customers are residents of Carrizal and neighboring areas where she is well known because Viviana learned her mercantile skills from an aunt that taught her and urged her to continue forward with the goal in mind of helping her daughter have a better future after the separation from her husband.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and first Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy footwear at wholesale getting a 30% discount for paying cash.  This way her profit margin will be 50%.  Her current monthly average sales in Emanuel Miscellany are $1.000.000 COP.  With the loan sales will increase thanks to the new capital and thanks to being able to offer better service.  She will also invest in the purchase of school supplies because the first trimester of the school year is traditionally of high demand for these items.

Her investment will be successful because her clientele has good payment habits, a selection process, she’s very positive and a believer and besides, she already has 80% of the demand for these products resolved because of their good quality.

Viviana V. is a hard working woman with dreams.  She hopes to have a house of her own and to place her daughter in an environment leading to a successful future as well as a leatherworking workshop that will generate employment.

loans.use: To buy footwear and school supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a piggery business.  Her husband Nickarter, who is 47 years old, works as a solar collector to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 10 and 25 years old. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,700, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy more stock so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Erlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for a professional aesthetics course

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 28 years old and married, with one child. He earns his daily bread by dairy farming. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and also does poultry farming for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He hopes to expand his business and become the best farmer in Kiambu. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza Strip; he is a father of one daughter and one son. Jamal took money from relatives and friends when he got married and started his small family and now he is trying to pay them back.

Jamal who appears in the picture above took a loan from FATEN to pay back the money and have one organization to pay back which is going to be easier on him.

loans.use: to repay relatives and friends who loaned money to him to start his family.

loans.name: Gladyse

texts.en:
Gladyse is 44 years old and is married, with one child who is four years old.  Gladyse sells various foodstuffs in her business, such as sugar, breads, biscuits, tomato sauce, bonbons, etc.  Gladyse has had her business for 1 year.  Her business is open from 8am until 7pm every day. This business is well-organized. 

Gladyse has requested a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs, like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and so on.  With this profit, she will be able to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, like sugar, biscuits, tomato sauce, bonbons, etc.

loans.name: Alba Edith

texts.es:
Trabajar vendiendo productos por catálogo desde su casa con el fin de contribuir a solventar los gastos del hogar y continuar atendiendo las labores propias de la casa fue la decisión que Alba Edith H. tomó desde hace 4 años, así equilibraría un poco las necesidades que enfrentaba su familia debido al trabajo inestable de su esposo. 

Desde entonces, Alba Edith es una consagrada a su negocio y como ella misma lo afirma, se siente orgullosa de contribuir con una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. 

A sus 49 años de edad, esta emprendedora espera mantener un buen nivel de ventas que le permitan sostener su negocio en el tiempo. Actualmente Alba Edith necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido de los catálogos que llega en producción y así mantener un inventario adicional que le permita generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Four years ago Alba Edith H. decided to work from her home selling catalog items, with the goal of helping with her family's costs while continuing to take care of her household tasks. This way she balanced a little the needs of her family caused by her husband's unstable employment. 

Since then, Alba Edith has established herself in her business, and as she herself affirms, she feels proud to contribute to a better quality of life for her family. 

At 49 years of age, this entrepreneur hopes to maintain a good level of sales that will allow her to sustain her business over time. Currently Alba Edith needs a loan to buy stock from the catalogs that arrive in production and therefore maintain an additional inventory that will allow her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy catalog stock to maintain inventory.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es una joven de 19 años de Medellín que por la falta de recursos y oportunidades, se ha dedicado a vender postres por diferentes barrios de la ciudad, esta labor la desempeña principalmente en las mañanas pues como madre cabeza de hogar de sus gemelos de 3 meses de edad, debe dedicarles gran parte de su tiempo pues requieren no sólo de su cuidado y atención si no también de su constante acompañamiento. 
 
Vanessa compra los postres a un proveedor y posteriormente se encarga de distribuirlos en las diferentes tiendas que le  compran diariamente o semanalmente. Su gran impulso son sus hijos por los cuales se motiva a trabajar diariamente y a seguir luchando porque espera ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Sin embargo su trabajo tiene varias dificultades, una de ellas es el transporte de los postres que en algunos casos afecta la calidad de los mismos, por lo cual Vanessa necesita comprar por lo menos 2 neveras que le permitan transportar fácil y cómodamente los productos, igualmente poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos y así generar más utilidades, pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para esta inversión que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 19-year-old girl from Medellín who, because of a lack of resources and opportunity, has started selling desserts in several neighborhoods in the city. She does this work mainly in the mornings because she is a mother and head of household for her three-month-old twins. She must give them most of her time because they need not only her care and attention, but also to be with her constantly.
 
Vanessa buys the desserts from a supplier and then distributes them to the many stores that buy from her daily or weekly. Her children are her big motivation; because of them, she is motivated to work everyday and to keep striving because she hopes to offer them a better quality of life. However, her work has several problems. One of them is transporting the desserts, which sometimes affects their quality. For this reason Vanessa needs to buy at least two coolers, which will enable her to transport her products easily and comfortably. She will also be able to buy more products, thus generating more profit, but unfortunately she does not have the capital she needs for this investment that will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy coolers for distribution and an assortment of products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ruth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items, such as powdered milk, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos de 4 a 10 anos, todos vão a Escola, fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições.Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguem para alêm dos filhos.

Muda se de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu esposo. Começa a trabalhar numa alfaiataria onde aprende a costurar, seu marido emigra para a Africa do Sul e compra lhe uma maquina de costura, assim ela passa a fazer trabalhos de custura na sua própria casa. E proprietaria de uma banca na sua residência onde também vende produtos de primeira necessidade como( açucar, amendoim, arroz, feijão, massa e mais), tem gastado em cada viagem uma média de 8.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Conta também com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos. Conhece a Hluvuku atraves de amigos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos de venda. Os anteriores de (3.000.00,08.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foram para o comercio

Esta convicto que vai pagar cem nenhum problema para aceder a outros empréstimos no futuro, e dar inicio da costrução da casa no novo terreno.
texts.en:
Judite was born in Inhambane province. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children between 4 and 10 years of age. All of her children attend school. She went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of her family's financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family, and is not responsible for anyone else besides her children.
She and her husband moved from Inhambane to the district of Namaacha, where she started working in a tailor's workshop and learned to sew. Her husband emigrated to South Africa and bought her a sewing machine, so she began taking in sewing jobs at home. She has counter in her home where she also sells staple goods (sugar, peanuts, rice, beans, pasta, etc.). She spends an average of about 8000 meticals on each shopping trip and earns a profit of 3000 meticals, which she uses to cover household expenses and construction on the house. She also gets help from her husband, who works in South Africa.
She has held loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the organization. This is her fourth loan, and she will use the 17,000 meticals to increase the stock of products she carries for her shop. Her previous loans (in the amounts of 3000, 8000, and 15,000 meticals) were also invested in the business.
She is confident that she will have no trouble paying off this loan and will be able to request others in the future that will help her start building a house on a new lot.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods for her shop.

loans.name: Julia Amalia

texts.en: Julia lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her five grown children. For the last five years, she has run a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household supplies. Julia is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 with which to buy meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products for her shop. In her spare time she enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 28 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has two children.
 
Mary Jean works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Mary Jean has been a member of PMPC for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Guiancarlo

texts.es:
Guíancarlo  tiene 19 años de edad, el es soltero no tiene hijos. El vive en casa de sus padres; dicha casa está ubicada en el Caserío Peña Viva  en una parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande  en el departamento de Piura

Guíancarlo cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside.  Adicionalmente es trabajador estable en una empresa agropecuaria 

Guiancarlo desea adquirir más animales con sus respectivo alimento balanceado, así como también pastos y forraje para sus ovejas para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Guiancarlo  es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Guiancarlo is 19 years old, single, and he has no children. He live with his parents and their house is located in the community of Pena Viva. It is a rural part of the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura.

Guiancarlo raises small livestock, especially sheep, in a few corrals located near his house. He feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good level in their development he offers them up for sale to the merchants who frequently visit the region where he lives. Additionally, he is permanently employed at an agricultural company.

Guiancarlo wishes to acquire more livestock and their balanced feed. He also wants to purchase grasses and foraging for his sheep to expand his business and to increase his income. For this reason he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 400 nuevos soles. It will help him reach his objective.

Guiancarlo is quite an earnest and hardworking person. His greatest dream is to keep growing as an entrepreneur to be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: The picture above shows Yaa selling fried fish at Elmina. She acquires the fish from the market, cleans them and fries them in oil for resale. She is divorced. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry and sell. Her future plan towards her business is to reinvest her profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en: Orita is 57 years old and lives  in Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is single with five children. She also cares for one dependent. Orita runs a retail business selling poultry and clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are shortage of cash to order stock. Orita has requested a loan of $400 to purchase chickens and clothes from Zambia. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s lifestyle with better food types and more disposable income to purchase assets. In the future Orita plans to own a personal car and a possible venture into the transport industry.

loans.use: To purchase chickens-broilers and layers for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 41 años, es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora, convive con Luis, su esposo, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, a los que cuida y educa en una casa alquilada en la comunidad de Huaricolca. Con la seguridad, que le caracteriza, afirma, que lo importante en la agricultura es comercializar en diferentes lugares. Por ello quiso adquirir un camión, con el que pueda trasladar su producción y así lo realizó, gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, ahora no solo traslada su siembra, también hace servicio de carga a diferentes lugares del país; donde gana un dinero extra. Ya tiene 18 años de experiencia y su buena cosecha de papa, en sus diferentes variedades, como: “tomaza” (que vende mayormente como semillas), “Color” (el cual comercializa en la ciudad de Oroya, donde tiene buenos clientes); le brindan buenos ingresos y utilidades. Pero la ganadería, es otra de las actividades de Adelaida, ella tiene varias cabezas de ganado ovino; el cual enseba y comercializa en el mercado mayorista, gracias a los buenos pastos que ella misma siembra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de poder tener capital, el cual le permite ahorrar. Por ello agradece a todos ustedes, ya que le abrieron las puertas al desarrollo. Adelaida piensa sembrar 15 sacos de semilla de papa “única” y “tomaza”; por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le permitan concretar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Adelaida, age 41, is a strong and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Luis and they have four young children, who they care for and provide an education. Adelaida and her family live in a rented house in the community of Huaricolca. With the confidence that she is known for, Adelaida says that it is important to sell her agricultural products in different places. For this reason, she wants to acquire a truck for transporting her crops. She will also be able to provide cargo services to different parts of the country as a way of earning extra money. Adelaida has 18 years of experience harvesting potatoes of different varieties, such as “Tomaza” (sold primarily for its seeds) and “Color” (which is sold in the city of Oroya where she has good customers). Her crops generate good revenues and profits. Raising livestock is Adelaida’s other business activity. She has several heads of sheep that will be fattened and sold at the wholesale market. Adelaida also grows the fodder that is fed to her animals.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Adelaida is very pleased to have capital because she will be able to save. For this reason, she expresses her appreciation to everyone for opening the doors to development. She plans to plant 15 sacks of potato seeds of the “Única” and “Tomaza” varieties. With the support she received, Adelaida will invest the money she requested in several sacks of natural fertilizers so that she can guarantee success with her next planting.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 56 years old and is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Feliciana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Feliciana has been in this business for two years. In the future, Feliciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, tiene 25 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año.
Angélica tiene un puesto de verduras en el Mercado de su localidad, desde muy pequeña trabaja, recuerda que con el primer crédito que tuvo compró verduras y también se compró un ropero, ahora ya con mas experiencia y todo esto gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando viajará a Lima y comprará ahí las verduras que son mas baratas, ahora la meta que tiene es poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Estrella ["Star"] Communal Bank. She is 25 and has been a member of Finca Peru for one year.
Angelica has a vegetable stand in her local market. She has worked since she was very young. She tells us that she used her first loan to purchase vegetables. She also bought a closet. Now she has more experience. All of this is thanks to the training that she has received. With this requested loan, she will travel to Lima and purchase cheaper vegetables. Now, her goal is to be able to build her home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in Lima.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Wilberforce is the facilitator of the Upendo SHG group. He takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wilberforce had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wilberforce was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilberforce and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Wilberforce will educate his children, and buy food throughout the year.
In 2012, the members of Upendo SHG group will each plant between half and three acres of maize.
In the photograph, Wilberforce is pictured with his group members. Standing at the far left of the photo is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Meldy

texts.en:
Meldy is 47 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Meldy has a viand vending business. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. Meldy has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business.

Meldy has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her viand vending business

loans.name: Isatu Junior

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Isatu.  She is married to a businessman and has three children aged 10, 7, and 5 years; two are school-going children. In 2001, Isatu established her ready-made clothes business. She began her business when she got married and her husband asked her to start her own business so that they could get enough income to support their home. 

Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy ladies' dresses - 100 pieces @ Le30, 000 and T-shirts - 25 pieces @ Le40, 000.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Isatu plans to open a jewellery shop.  Taking out this loan will help as it will enable her to expand her business.  She wants her children to attend good schools so that they will become better people in future. 

Isatu is an honest and hard-working businesswoman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ladies' dresses - 100 pieces @ Le30,000 and T-shirts - 25 pieces @ Le40,000.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felipa; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende tejidos y tambien vende chompas,pantalones y polos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella vende en el distrito de Chinchero,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos y mantas,la socia quierea ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos y mantas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los tejidos como lana,tintes y palitos de tejer y tambien para comprar chompas,polos y sombreros al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felipa is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She is continuing to work in her handicraft business.  She sells knitted items and also sweaters, pants and polo shirts.  Felipa works from 8am until 6pm, and she sells in the Chinchero district.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling knitted items and blankets. Felipa requests a loan to buy materials to make knitted items such as wool, dyes and knitting needles.  With the loan she will also buy sweaters, polo shirts and hats at wholesale.

Felipa is pleased to have this loan and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy knitting materials such as wool, dyes and knitting needles, and also to buy sweaters, polo shirts and hats at wholesale

loans.name: Nicholas Ogut

texts.en:
Nicholas is 47 years old, married, and has six children. He operates a manufacturing store in Nakuru where he sells cooking pans, metal boxes, and charcoal stoves. He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  

Nicholas is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy scrap metals and paint. His business goal is to run more blacksmith stores within five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be disturbances by the city council.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and paint.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida, es conviviente con José que es carpintero. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sys 5 hijos de 20, 18, 17, 5 y 2 años de edad, además de una nieta.
La actividad que realiza Felicita es la carpintería labor que comparte con su pareja, y lo ejecuta en un pequeño taller instalado en su propia casa. En un inicio empezaron con un pequeño capital propio con el cual lograron comprar maquinas de corte de madera, atendiendo pedidos. Al cabo de 4 años, han logrado crecer y desarrollar su negocio y ahora cuentan con el apoyo de dos ayudantes a los que paga por semana de trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos del hogar, así como la educación de sus hijos, a los que quiere mucho. Por eso se esfuerza día a día, logrando tener su recompensa con la buena ganancias que le genera, por esa razón tiene planes de ampliar su casa y tener más espacio para implementar con maquinas para tener mejores acabados de sus trabajos.
Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado  se siente bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros se buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevo soles, comprará un motor cepilladora, valorizada en 600 nuevos soles, y con el saldo comprará más madera para sus trabajos.
texts.en: Felicita, 39 years old, is a hardworking woman, enthusiastic, cheerful and outgoing, who lives with her partner Joseph, a carpenter. Together they live in their own home with their 5 children 20, 18, 17, 5 and 2 years old, and also a granddaughter. Felicita performs carpentry work which she shares with her partner and runs in a small workshop installed at home. Initially they started with a small amount of their own money with which they managed to buy wood cutting machines and take orders. After 4 years, they have managed to grow and develop their business and now they are supported by two assistants who she pays for the work week. What she likes about her activity is to have an income to cover the costs of home as well as the education of her children, whom she loves very much. So she strives every day, managing to be rewarded with good profits the business generates. For that reason she has plans to expand her home and have more room to implement machines to better finish their jobs. This will be loan number 10 with the institution MFP, so she hopes for a small loan in order to fulfill her objectives. On the other hand she feels good with her community bank because she considers its members good people. With the amount requested, 1000 nuevo soles, she will buy a planer motor, valued at 600 nuevos soles, and with the balance will buy more wood for their jobs.

loans.use: to buy a planer and more wood.

loans.name: Marisol Marjorie

texts.es:
Marisol de 41 años, Empezó hace 3 años con esta actividad vendiendo aretes. Cuando se separo del esposo necesito solventar los gastos de sus hijos y decidió tener en su casa su propio negocio.

Ahora ella tiene en casa su negocio en donde vende aretes, perfumes, cremas, ropa y otros artículos personales. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00 hasta las 14h00 todos los días. Una de sus dificultades que presenta es la peligrosidad del sector en el que vive. 

Su meta es poder establecer una peluquería en su casa.
texts.en:
Marisol, 41, began her business selling earrings and other jewelry three years ago. When she separated from her husband she needed to pay her son’s expenses and therefore decided to start her own business in her home.

She now has a home business selling earrings, perfume, creams, clothing and other personal items. She works every day from 10 a.m. until 2 p.m.. One of the difficulties she faces is the lack of security in the area where she lives.

Her goal is to be able to establish a hairdressing salon in her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for ceramics and clothing.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gabriela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una empresa de telefonia,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende lineas de telefono ,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para implementar su cuarto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Gabriela, is 35 years old and married, and has two children.  She continues working in a telephone company.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  With this job she gets her children ahead.

She is requesting the loan to purchase a television for her room.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her room

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela de treinta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su sobrino. Ella posee una venta de comida rápida, tortas, hamburguesas y hotdog; tiene muy buena fama en el lugar y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende la comida más exquisita, con una sabor inigualable, todo elaborado con material de excelente calidad y precios accesibles además el servicio es muy bueno, siempre recibe muy amable a las personas que la visitan. Blanca es una mujer muy dedicada en su trabajo, piensa que para llegar al éxito hay que estar siempre dispuestos a jugar las cartas que se nos presenten,  y ella quiere aprovechar esas oportunidades es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, carnes, embutidos, verduras entre otros. Blanca Estela tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca Estela, 33, lives with her life partner and her nephew.  She has a business selling fast food, such as sandwiches, hamburgers and hot dogs.  Her stand has a very good reputation in the area, and she has attracted a lot of customers because she sells the most delicious food, with a unique flavor, made from excellent quality ingredients and offered at reasonable prices.  In addition, her service is very good; she always provides a friendly welcome to the people who visit her stand.  Blanca is a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She thinks that in order to become successful, one must always be ready to play the cards that are dealt, and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy bread, meat, sausages, vegetables and other items.  Blanca Estela is hoping that in this way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages and vegetables

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a 40-year-old who is married and has eight children. He operates a produce business, which he has run for a period of six years. At first, Mathias was in agriculture, harvesting beans and maize. Then he started his produce business and it has since improved steadily. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the business growth. 

He has a dream of educating his children and buying a car. He wishes to expand his business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops. He therefore wants a loan to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: compra de mas loroco por mayor

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is a 30 year-old, active and entrepreneurial woman. At the moment she is in a divorce process and for that reason she has to support her family alone. She decided to begin a small business of Tostada sales (It is a toasted tortilla with lemon and hot pepper, it is so popular in Mexico), snacks and sodas at her home. She reinvested her earnings so she could purchase groceries and dairy products to sell. She personally assists her business and her nephew also helps her in his free time.

Every day people prefer to go to her business to by her products and they have been requesting more variety in the products that she offers. She is requiring a loan of $250 USD to purchase hygienic and dairy products that her clients have been demanding lately. Her idea is pay it in a term of 3-6 months. Olga will thank you if you decide to support and contribute to her family well-being.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Olga Lidia es una mujer de 30 años, muy activa y emprendedora que actualmente se encuentra en proceso de divorcio y por lo mismo tiene que sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de tostadas, duritos y refrescos en su hogar y al estar reinvirtiendo sus ganancias en el mismo pudo ir incorporando la venta de abarrotes y productos lácteos. Ella atiende su negocio personalmente y un sobrino le ayuda también por horas a atenderla.

Hoy en día mas gente la conoce y prefiere acudir a su negocio a hacer sus compras, es por eso que le han estado pidiendo mas variedad en las mercancías que ofrece, ahora esta requiriendo un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 USD para comprar productos higiénicos así como lácteos que sus clientes han estado demandándole últimamente, su idea es pagarlo en un término de 3-6 meses. Olga les agradecerá si ustedes deciden apoyarla y contribuir así al bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase hygienic and milky products

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Mrs. G. is a teacher who, through great effort, has built a pre-school in her home in order to teach children from the community. With the loan money, she will remodel her home to improve conditions for the children and will also buy didactic materials to improve education. (blackboards, educational games, etc)

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora G. es maestra de profesión, además de dar clases, con mucho esfuerzo ha construido en su casa un preescolar donde brinda sus servicios a los niños de su comunidad. Con el crédito mejorará las instalaciones de su casa para brindar mejores condiciones a los niños que asisten y también comprará materiales didacticos que le permitan brindar una mejor enseñanza (Pizarrones, juegos educativos, etc.).

loans.use: The money will be used to remodel her home in order to provide a more comfortable environment for the children who attend her pre-school.  It will also be used to buy materials to improve education.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en: Nhanh is 32. Her husband, Tan, is 37. They have a son, 11, and a daughter, 2. The son is attends seventh grade at high school. Nhanh makes rice alcohol and uses rice alcohol by-products to feed her pigs. Their income is $9 per person/month. They need a loan of $75 to run this activity. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To make rice alcohol and raise pigs.

loans.name: Francys

texts.es:
Francys D. is single, he is 24 years old, and lives with his parents in the center of the city of Caaguazú. Francys started working when he was very young. First he worked in car repair shop, and later he worked in a car parts store, where he learned a lot about electronics, installation, and car accessories.

After several years of learning and saving money, Francys was able to open his own business in his house. He sells and installs car accessories, such as radios, buffers, speakers, power windows, etc.

He has a good number of clients, due to the fact that there are not many businesses in that part of town that sell the same types of products. Francys wants to expand his business and vary his merchandise with the latest models on the market. To do this he is requesting a loan of $200.00, with which he plans to buy new models of car radios.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Francys D. es soltero, tiene 24 años, se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres, ubicado en el Centro de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Francys trabaja desde muy joven, empezó como ayudante en un taller, luego trabajo en una casa de equipamientos para vehículos, donde aprendió mucho de electrónica, montaje y equipamientos de accesorios para vehículos. Tras varios años de aprendizaje y ahorro, Francys logró independizarse y abrir su propio negocio en su casa, donde se dedica a la venta e instalación de equipamientos para vehículos, como radios, buffers, parlantes, levanta vidrios eléctricos, etc. Posee buena cantidad de clientes, debido a que en la zona no hay muchos negocios que se dediquen a la venta de este tipo de insumos. Francys quiere seguir ampliando su negocio y variar sus mercaderías con los últimos modelos del mercado, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 200 con los que planea comprar modelos nuevos de radios para vehículos.

loans.use: To buy car radios at whole-sale price

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. He owns a small grocery store, which he first opened 20 years ago. His store is well known in the neighborhood due to the fact that he has been able to keep it well stocked with loans received through the Paraguayan Foundation.

He has plans to expand the store this summer, as he isn't currently able to display all his stock because of limited space. Don Carmelo tells us he's a fighter and that this line of work requires much sacrifice, as he must work everyday, including weekends, starting at 5 am and going well into the evening. In spite of this, he feels very fortunate to have his own business, to be able to support his family and to provide his children with a good education.

His principal customers are the area office workers as well as factory workers from a nearby ceramics factory. Besides running the grocery store, he also serves breakfast and lunch. He is requesting this loan to purchase meats, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Carmelo, tiene 50 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, posee una despensa en su domicilio, el negocio lo habilitó hace más de 20 años y es muy conocida su despensa en el barrio, ya que gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir bien su negocio. Tiene pensado para este verano ampliar su despensa ya que no está pudiendo exhibir todas las mercaderías que tiene en stock, por el espacio muy reducido con que cuenta actualmente dentro de la despensa. Don Carmelo dice que es un luchador por lo sacrificado que es éste rubro, ya que uno debe trabajar todos los días, inclusive sin descansar los fines de semana. A parte la atención se inicia desde las 05:00 am hasta la noche. A pesar de esto él se siente muy contento porque maneja su propio negocio y con esto mantiene los gastos de su familia y también le permite dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Sus principales clientes son los oficinistas de la zona, como así también los obreros de la fábrica de cerámicas del barrio a quiénes también él da el servicio de desayunos y almuerzos. Desea un crédito para comprar carne, azúcar, leche, harina, cerveza, vino, etc.

loans.use: To purchase meats, sugar, milk, beer, wine, etc.
